47.Name: Farming Village
47.Author: Aghar
47.Description: This is a farming village I did when I was working with the presale toolset. It was just for testing purposes and a learning expierence really. It's not finished by far(you will need to make some placeables enviromental objects for it to bake correctly), but maybe, with the lack of entries so far from the community, someone would like to finish the work and make it their own or just use it to spark some ideas. Either way, have fun with it.

48.Name: Large Town
48.Author: Aghar
48.Description: This is the same as the farming village I submitted. Early work from the presale toolset. I just used this to see what I could do with the toolset early on. It's not 100% ( you will need to adjust some placeables and make them enviromental to bake properly). Hopefully someone would like to finish this and make it their own. If not, maybe use some of it just for some ideas. Either way, I hope you have fun with it.

49.Name: Drunken Wench Tavern
49.Author: Eshin
49.Description: Small 6x7 Inn, my first attempt at an interior for the community. You'll need to add your own staff for the Inn.

50.Name: The Arena/Colosseum
50.Author: Plane Walker
50.Description: This version of the Arena contains no other areas besides the exterior with the Arena itself. The doors have been linked to allow you to enter/exit the arena and there are area transitions allowing access to the arena floor. In future versions, there will be other areas that cover the spaces below the arena and eventually the area outside the arena - however this release is for those who wish to create all of that themselves and just need the Arena.

51.Name: Ancestral Vale
51.Author: MithrilShadow
51.Description: This was originally just an attempt to learn the toolset. But since it turned out so nice I figured I would post it. It is a valley with 5 Crypts set into the hillsides, as well as graves along the various paths. For those of you who have played IWD it is similar to the Vale of Shadows. This is intentional and the Vale of Shadows was inspiration for this Prefab. Note that this is my first ever submission to the Vault, judge accordingly. Also if you have any tips, or complaints, please post them so I can work on them for my next submission.

52.Name: Wizards Lab
52.Author: Magus77
52.Description:
A very small interior room (only 1 tile). A wizards lab, with an alchemists workbench and a magicians workbench.
Both workbenches are set to static, if you want them to be usable, set the static flag to 'false'.
For builders, enjoy!
Magus77

53.Name: Small Farmstead
53.Author: BoomStick
53.Description:
A small farmstead with house, barn, outhouse, surrounded by a river with 1 exit, a bridge crossing the river.

This is a first map with the nw2 editor, mainly for experience, but perhaps some will find it useful.

Constructive comments welcome.

54.Name: New Generic city for YOU! .v3
54.Author: Spamdrekk
54.Description:
Due to feedback, Ive changed the size of the generic city to 16x16. None of the doors go anywhere and It is broken up into quarters: 

poor quarter, with gladiator pit and shanty town

tavern/living quarter with seedy alleys

palace quarter with high walls

a merchant/guild quarter with noble housing and buildings for class guilds

Thers also a town center for you to place your own decor in... 

New version ...updated and fixed some floating objects also changed the merchant quarte a bit... 

This should be good for fleshing out a PW or just for fun. Let me know what you think!

-->Spamdrekk

55.Name: a Forest with a Camp
55.Author: Marcelo_Lopes
55.Description:
Area Size: 12 x 8

A small forest with a camp by the cliff. Good for hunt little animals. 

There is two exits in this area, one leading to a road, another to a dense forest.

56.Name: Lost Ruins of Zartroff (level 1)
56.Author: Eshin
56.Description:
This is level 1 of "Lost Ruins of Zartroff" 3 more levels to come.. Enjoy.

** UPDATED V1.1**
- added new photo from v1.1
- placed a starting location inside the main entrance
- Modified all lighting
- Placed all burning torch sounds
- All placeable converted to environmental objects.

57.Name: Bluewater Village
57.Author: Ninthletter
57.Description: Nice village. No interiors or npcs. 16 x 16 area. 8 homes, 1 barn, 1 temple, 1 smith, 1 townhall, 4 shops, 1 boathouse, 6 watchtowers, 1 gallows, 1 small graveyard w/ tomb entrance, 1 windmill on a hill, a small lake, 2 main road exits, 3 small trail exits. All buildings have doors. Basic sounds and music. Good jump off point for a module. Save it to your desktop and copy paste into your modules folder. Smaller zip file coming soon. Please give credit if used, thanks and enjoy.

58.Name: Island
58.Author: Mosh_Pit
58.Description:
This is my first work with the toolset.. It's a basic island with a few caves about.. It will take some exploring to find them all..Check it out and please leave feed back, as I'm looking to improve my skill with this system. Thanks

Left as a module for easy viewing


I've updated this file..Thanks for the comments, please leave more :)

59.Name: Cave of the Winds
59.Author: Golgaron
59.Description:
A 16 X 16 cave with lots of doors and hallways for ambush,etc. One secret door with boss or treasure room. 
I took out all the creatures, since i could not make it through with a level one character.

There is supposed to be wind sound, but i can't hear it with my on board sound.

A big thank you to Seraldin for his NWN2Mapper plugin.

60.Name: a Long Bridge with Caves Around
60.Author: Marcelo_Lopes
60.Description:
There is 3 areas in this .erf.

A 20x8 exterior with a long bridge.
A cave 12x12 (I think), which is like a linear dungeon.
And another cave, which is only a small room 4x4.

(Note: I notice some problems with walkmeshes being missplaced when importing specific areas. If you get this problem, you will need to rebake it.)

61.Name: Dragonmount
61.Author: Puychaud
61.Description: This is a deserted ruined fort on top of a hill, with ruined temple, intact keep, and mysterious tower. The walkmesh is done, feel free to make what use of the area you wish. Area size 16x16

62.Name: Small Lake
62.Author: BoomStick
62.Description:
A small mountain lake surrounded by forest with a trail leading around the bend for an exit. A small, dark cave cave is also included, though sparsely decorated.

My second map, used mainly to continue learning the nwn2 editor ... some may find it useful.

Constructive comments and suggestions welcome.

63.Name: Island tower with cave.
63.Author: SeanCaldecott
63.Description:
This is my first attempt at building an area with the new toolset.

The area consists of a tower and a small cave on an island joined to the mainland by a bridge.

At the moment the area doesnt have any placed sounds, npcs or animals.

I hope the area is of some value to someone. ^^

If anyone has any suggestions or comments on this area prefab feel free to post. 

**Update**

The newer version is basicly the same apart from the path is now earth and planks (needs work), Rain, Lightning and wind have been added, walkmesh cutts have been placed around various objects. (also needing small work) Also an arch has been place over the cobble road for an entrance. (not needed) I hope the minor improvements didnt wreck it. ^^ Ty for comments guys.

If you have any comments or suggestions please tell me. :)

64.Name: Town Exterior
64.Author: Tank6ge
64.Description:
This is an exterior area to a rural village. This would be great as a starting point for players. There are two caves placed in this area (if you can find them).. There is also a gate leading to a small village and a farm with a farmer in front of his house. My ideas on this was an area where level 1-5 creatures could lurk while providing places where you could have early level characters go to complete quests. My idea on having the small farm was to have the farmer have the players kill the "corn beetles" that are eating his crops. This could be a mini-quest that could involve a reward of both experience and a small amount of gold. I am aware that the bridges don't work-if someone could help me figure out why I would appreciate it. 

In one corner I have also placed a row of trees where a path could go into the forest. This is an area I had in mind for a long time and one that I feel will be quite useful because of all the room to build on from here. Make it your own!! Let me know if you use this area and please provide me feedback as this is the first version of this area and I do update occasionally. Please come see what EW is doing at www.ewclan.net!

65.Name: Ancient City
65.Author: Tank6ge
65.Description:
This area was modeled after a few mayan temples that I have been looking at. In total there are 3 mayan pyramids and a floor level ancient temple as well. This should provide for plenty of action among the ruins of this people. 

check out what I am working on here:

http://server6.theimagehosting.com/albums.php?user_id=72237&public_view=1
I am always taking feedback and fixing up some of the areas I am working on-please help me to improve! If you leave a comment I will read it. If it has been previously mentioned, then I know about it. If you use this please let me know!!

Go see the Ew clan at www.ewclan.net (shameless plug)

66.Name: The Mossy Inn
66.Author: DavionShores
66.Description:
A possible rest area for travellers trekking through the swamplands. The size of the area is Small and hopefully not too heavy. I'll optimize it more if need be.

Feedback appreciated. :)

67.Name: Cobolt Point
67.Author: Ninthletter
67.Description: This is a small village 8 x 8 area. No interiors. NPCs have place holder conversations. Some ambiant life. There is an inn, a few cottages, a lighthouse, a dock, a small keep on the hill, a cave entrance, and two main road exits. Signs are examinable. Try staying in long enough for sundown and watch the lamps flicker and the lighthouse shine.

68.Name: River Crossing
68.Author: BoomStick
68.Description:
A riverside fort protects the bridge crossing the river and the nearby road. Two exits along the road, one cave exit.

Credit if used, please.

69.Name: Small Dinner
69.Author: Marcelo_Lopes
69.Description: a small (3x4) interior, could be used as a dinner or a tavern.

70.Name: Pyre's Lair
70.Author: Lanessar
70.Description:
This is a dragon's lair, which I supposed some people could use.

I've supplied some scripts within the mod, but they are not tested or proved to work, so do not rate on these. I would have removed them, but I figured that people would utilize them or remake them.

Here's what comes in the package:

- Dragon's Lair area, 8x12. There are MANY special effects in here, and all the placeables are set to enviromental and are not able to be interacted with. The walkmesh has been optimized so that the dragon will not hang up on an edge or "get stuck".

- 4 scripts. One is for the ondeath of the dragon, is not proven to work. What it was supposed to do is spawn two treasure chests and two "light beam" effects upon the death of the dragon. Also, as the dragon fell, it would deal 50 bludgeoning damage to all PCs within range. It should be well-commented enough for even the newest scripter to fix up (if it does not work correctly).

The other scripts were magic use limitations for PCs - 50% arcane failure. Merely a small point to make the area more challenging for high-level PCs.

- 2 dragon blueprints. A small red dragon (CR 13) and a larger dragon. My plugins crapped out on me for the creature creation, so the abilities for the large dragon may not work properly.

- 2 chest blueprints, resref of the chests to spawn when the dragon dies.

As far as the dragon's lair itself, it contains mounds of gold (a la Smaug's lair, I've always wondered why no one made a lair like it is supposed to be per fantasy lore), the surface is covered with black melted glass, and other details which either you will hate or love.

Again, I'd appreciate no ratings based on scripting or creatures, as these are not optimized, I merely left them in so that people could use them should they so wish.

Let me know about the area, and how you enjoy/hate/despise the building.

Note: The time is defaulted (or should) to nightfall, where I've set the environment up to specifications.

This area was given to a PW (The Frontier), so if you like this area, come see the frontier (especially the high-level zones) for more of my work.

Based on the response, I may upload other areas I've created about 43 in total) based on requests.

71.Name: Sammoths Keep
71.Author: Sammoth666
71.Description:
Big Keep I made but, in the process of adding more placeables etc. Its not final I have a bit more work to do.I planning on adding a bridge or walkpath over the lava on the sides to get to the back cave.This could be a Firegiant Keep also. I will be doing an interior to match. Enjoy =)


"Update"Fixed Bridge and added some placeables etc. with new Screens.Will be updating again soon for this update just unpack the same mod over the last one Enjoy =)


"Update 1.02" Added more placeables, trees, area sounds, background music, effects, and rotated outer keep walls to add battlements. Downloads and overwrite old keep file. Enjoy =)

73.Name: The Dark Lord's Keep
73.Author: Ninthletter
73.Description: This is the place your characters hope they never have to go. Enter the very heart of evil. Here you will find the evil keep atop a rock spire surrounded by lava. Caverns, tombs, Old watch towers, etc. 16 x 16 area. If you think it's creepy by day wait til night fall.

74.Name: Highgate Hunting Lodge
74.Author: Ninthletter
74.Description:
Deep Forest with a hunting lodge, waterfalls, cliffs, streams, a meadow, and more. 8 x 8 area. Two main road exits and two trail exits. NOTE: This is actually a 1.03 Patch area. The streams do not have any motion because it kept resetting to it's current state. I redid it twice. It's either the new patch or I'm having a massive stupid attack. Enjoy. Beautiful but, high frame rate. Take a torch, it's dark in the deep woods at night.

Update: I've redone this area to increase the size to 16 x 16. You may now walk into the entire meadow, etc. Oh, and look for the trail leading up above the upper falls.

Final: Ok, I know I said I wasn't going to do it but, the NWN2 area building monkey jumped on my back and it just wouldn't leave me alone. So, Drive Cam users rejoice. The big tree problem is solved.

75.Name: Slot Canyon
75.Author: BoomStick
75.Description: A narrow slot canyon (ravine) winding it's way through the small (12x4) map. Light environmental sounds added. One texture remains open per tile. Comments and feedback welcome & credit if used please.

76.Name: Skull Keep
76.Author: Kendaric
76.Description:
A small area containing a small keep/fortress in the mountains. 
As I was going for a different look than the fortress/keep models in the toolset, the keep is constructed entirely of mausoleum placeables.

This is something I created while toying around with the toolset, trying to avoid using the skyrings while still giving the impression of distance.

Area size: 8x8, the actual walkable area is quite small

77.Name: Riverbridge
77.Author: DavionShores
77.Description: A town perched over a waterfall in an autumn setting. A small pit stop or point of interest for travellers wandering through the forested hillsides.

79.Name: A small Village
79.Author: Me
79.Description: A small Village lying at the twist of a road coming from the mountains. The Village is seperated from the big Woods by a small river. Contains only the scene, lights and sounds. Have a look at the gloomy river at night ;) (Credits to Storyteller for his Norsk)

80.Name: Castle on the Hill
80.Author: Ninthletter
80.Description: The castle sets atop a large stone promanence along the coast. The town spreads out below safely behind the battlement walls. In this 24 x 24 area you will find docks, merchants, a manner house for your characters, the castle, two graveyards, the surrounding countryside is covered in crops. Enjoy.

81.Name: The Crater
81.Author: Ninthletter
81.Description: A Massive crater is all that remains of a once thriving town. Only the most outlying structures remain. A new outpost has been established at the edge to help investigate the strange cave at the bottom of the crater. Do the undead haunt the ruins? What caused an entire town to be whipped clean by the wraith of the gods? Use this 16 x 16 area to tell your story. Note: I've updated this file to make some slight changes.

82.Name: Rural Road
82.Author: BoomStick
82.Description: A short road with broken wagon, a small pond and roomy enough for combat. Made as the starting point for a module I'm working on. Light ambient sounds and placeables. Credit if used, please.

83.Name: Silver's Hideaway
83.Author: Silver-Calibur
83.Description:
"It is said that a rather peculiar fellow has taken residence in a quite peaceful little forest clearing. It's a field like any other, but with a sprinkle of 'Umph!' and a dash of "Hngh!". Enter... If you dare. Or don't. Either way is fine, really."


This is a peaceful little hideaway I made. Feel free to use, change, or do whatever else you want to do with it in any way, shape or form. 

If you do though, be kind enough to leave a comment and a rating. Cheers!

84.Name: Venice
84.Author: Ninthletter
84.Description: Venice - The city on the water. Get lost in the twisting turning streets as you explore this sprawling city. Crystal blue waters run in the cannals as the colorful boats of the locals bob in the waves. This 16 x 16 area is a great haven for pirates and rogues. Hope you like it. Note: I have updated this area to add a bit of mystery. Can you get into those things?

85.Name: Solace
85.Author: Tanthalis
85.Description:
To the best of my abilities, using the new toolset, this is the ground level of Solace.

The map is based off of the Atlas of Krynn, and is as accurate as possible.

This version of Solace is not good for Servers as the area size is way to big, however for a Single Player Module, it would be good.

It could use minor touch ups here and there, mostly with the texturing of the map.

Another good update would be to have some CEP items (when available) such as a spiraled staircase for the trees, an upside down wood plain (to create an illusion of buildings in the trees)

Coming soon, the bridgewalks, which will include this file and the bridgewalks area and replace this entry.

Tanis

86.Name: Fallen Goddess: Ebha
86.Author: B.B.
86.Description:
Lore:
------------
In life, the Goddess Ebha (Gaelic of Eve, meaning ï¿½alive, livingï¿½) battled to protect her world when it was still boiling in formation. In eternal repose, her body forms the boundary between lands while her towering hand holds a guiding starlight to her loch bed in Glenn Toirbheart. To the west lies a harsh, ever-changing desert. To the north, chaotic highlands sprawl from her locks. To the east grows a giant and dense forest; and to the south a winding river flows out to sea.

87.Name: Wolfguard Mountainpass [Updated Jan 6]
87.Author: Elvered
87.Description:
Snow-covered mountaineous transition-area with a frozen river, a waterfall and an entrance to the looming peaks above.

Enjoy :)

Download the Hak-pak to your hak-directory and add it to the module or the snow won't be visible. Check out Kraav's snow texture for the override files for the toolset if you wish to make your own snow-covered areas.

[Update]
- Expanded walkable area
- Fixed some terrain detailing
- Fixed floating trees

88.Name: Peaceful Home
88.Author: _FlyingPig_
88.Description:
A cosy little home near the road to the city. Surrounded by a big mountain, a small forest and the sea.

This prefab is pretty smal. Please take a look at the screenshots for better overview.
I also want to give a big thanks to Gilthonym for the nice toolset tutorial, that is for anyone who want to give the Nwn2 toolset a first try.

You can find the tutorial here. 
http://nwvault.ign.com/View.php?view=NWN2Tutorials.Detail&id=14

This is my first area I have made, it have been great fun doing it.
I have also learned alot from making this prefab.

It took about 20 hours from start to finish (ver 1.02).

I hope you enjoy it. And if anyone want to use my area to a module, feel free to do so, and change whatever you want.

I got much better understanding now about how much effort people is spending on all the prefabs that is already out here. Great work and great stuffs!

Thanks

89.Name: Coastal Tower
89.Author: BoomStick
89.Description:
A tower, perched on cliffs, overlooking the ocean with a small trail down the bluff as the only exit.

Small area with light ambient sounds and placeables, credit if used please.

90.Name: Seaside Village--Small
90.Author: NWNINJA
90.Description: A very small village, mostly a resting point for passing sailors. Currently set as very foggy.

91.Name: Small zone with river
91.Author: LichKing
91.Description: Here is a small transition zone with a river and a bridge.

92.Name: Coast with beach
92.Author: LichKing
92.Description: Here is a coastal zone with a beach. Have fun :-D

93.Name: Teper's Prefab Area
93.Author: Teper's or aadatepe
93.Description: Two areas , The first area is a country cross road, second area is mountainous area which show case 3 waterfalls with effects. Updated Road on crossroads, added new dirt textures and lumps/bumps on road to make it more realistic. Updated Greenway North walkmesh, cleaned up tree seed limit to 5 - 6. Added grass, reeds and small pond on eastern edge of map. Added more noise to map, extended road on east end of map.

94.Name: The Chasm
94.Author: Ninthletter
94.Description: The Chasm is a 24 x 24 area that can act as a small town of unusual nature. Look down in the swirling depths of the Chasm and up at the soring hights.

95.Name: Mountainous hill side town
95.Author: Teper's or aadatepe
95.Description:
Hi everybody, as promised I am releasing my third area prefab.This is a large mountainous hill town area 20x20 called Bree. Its ready to be used in any mod, I hope everybody will enjoy it. I have also provided some VFX's from previous prefab release
due to splash effect I'm using for fountain in the city.

96.Name: The Fortress
96.Author: Ninthletter
96.Description: The Fortress rises out of the shallow waters of the coastal sea. One bridge leads to the mainland but, for those who live on the island stronghold life is good. Use this 16 x 16 area as a town if you like. Includes a dock and ships as well.

97.Name: The Mill
97.Author: Tanvaras
97.Description: This is a small river area with house and Windmill, Feel free to use it, modify it etc. Was just something I was playing around with to add into a module of my own.

98.Name: The Long Road (1 of 5)
98.Author: Ninthletter
98.Description: The Long Road makes it's way down out of the foothills and into the beginings of a forest. It will eventually find it's way through all kinds of country side. This 16 x 16 area includes an Inn, a small house, a ruined tower, a barn, and a cave. Note: This is the first in a series of 5. Each area will stand alone but, they will be designed to fit together to form a long walk in the country.

99.Name: The Beach
99.Author: witness
99.Description:
Area 16x28
coastal beach with a Lighthouse

100.Name: Erith Region
100.Author: Zunath
100.Description:
This is a HUGE 32x32 area that could serve as a section of your world for many different player levels.

Features an encampment, desert, ruined village, caves, and other dungeons.

No interiors included.

101.Name: Satyr's Glen
101.Author: Tanvaras
101.Description:
A small clearing in a Forest, Looks to be an old Satyr meeting place or place of worship, Though it could be still in use?

Feel free to use/modify it for use in your modules etc.

102.Name: Teper's Game Start Prefab
102.Author: Teper's or aadatepe
102.Description: Every mod needs a starting point. This is a small entry area for players where they have access to game info, healing area, area for stores, and area for level down. The name of this prefab is called The Well of Eru, but can be modified to meet your needs. Enjoy and Happy Holidays.

104.Name: The Long Road (2 of 5)
104.Author: Ninthletter
104.Description: This 24 x 24 area is the second installment of The Long Road. Here you will find that the road continues from part 1 as it passes through some forested hills. Don't forget to look for the Cave, the wood cutters cabin, the barn, the manner house, the watchtower, the crypt, and the view at the end of the road. Enjoy, Part 3 is coming.

105.Name: Knights of The Chalice, Chapter House
105.Author: Cleitanious
105.Description: This is a Foyer and Antichamber area using the Castle interior tileset. It was designed according to the specificiations of the book "The Complete Warrior" and is a Knights of the Chalice Chapter House. Although you can use it for anything really, wether it be a Bandit Lord's Keep, or even a King's Castle. It sports red masonry with red and gold carpets, white marble flooring. A Receptionists desk and 2 secondary desks, an Altar and several sitting areas. This was constructed with use of my prefab package which is also availible for download on the vault. ***************************************************************************** By downloading and installing this prefab you agree to the following. 1) You will not sell this or any other portion of this archive on Ebay or by any other means. 2) You will read the Readme. 3) You do NOT have permission to redistribute any of the contents of this archive without requesting and receiving explicit permission from the author.

106.Name: Lichking's Haunted Forest
106.Author: LichKing
106.Description: This is a large exterior forest zone. You will find a river, an island and a manor on a hill.

107.Name: Walkable Warship
107.Author: Gnok
107.Description: This is a small area with a walkable warship. You need the walkmesh helper placeables installed for this to work. The only drawback to this boat is that your feet melt into the deck from the swaying animation built into the warship model.

108.Name: The Long Road (3 of 5)
108.Author: Ninthletter
108.Description: This 24 x 24 area has alot going on. The Long Road dives over the edge of the cliffs in part 2 and winds down into a valley below. You'll find a small village, a Castle, some tombs, a greaveyard, towers, and a few statues. Part 4 will be smaller.

109.Name: Sunless citadel exterior
109.Author: Sylvanus
109.Description: This is my first prefab area, based on the Sunless citadel pen & paper module.

110.Name: Teper's Misty Mountain Treck
110.Author: Teper's or aadatepe
110.Description:
Imagine a Mountainous hike through Mist covered Mountains, snow covered cedars and with dangers lurking around every corner. Who knows what you will encounter around the next bend. Might want to come equiped. A little surprise awaits towards the end. I hope everybody will enjoy the Misty Mountain Treck Prefab. You can change whatever you want on the area. Comes with readme.txt and credits to Authors of such fine work.

Update: Added Missing bitmap images for TME terrain in the toolset. 

Note: To see Terrain Textures in mod on Game start up screen select Options
Then on the (General Tab) uncheck Normal Mapped Terrain. Took some time to figure that one out.

111.Name: The Long Road (4 of 5)
111.Author: Ninthletter
111.Description: In this, the 4th part of the long road, the road leaves the valley and finds it's way through the marshlands to the east. The area is 24 x 24 and you will find a sunken temple, lots of grass, a boat on the river, and a few other things. Oh, and did I mention grass?

112.Name: farm/smith
112.Author: RugMuk
112.Description:
This is my first prefab area with enterable buildings.
This project took 4 hours to compleete.
Exterior size is 8x8 and contains a river, sea, 2 enterable buildings and alot of placables. 
The buildings are small i filled the "barn with hay" and the house with smithing/crafting stuff.
Size unpacked: 29,9 MB

Thanx to NWNMaster for his tutorial that made this so "easy" ;)

113.Name: Blacked Out Interior
113.Author: SorceressAshura
113.Description:
I saw alot of people were having trouble "blacking out" interiors. I've created a template that I use everytime I need to create an interior. With the new toolset, you can always resize an area at anytime after its initial creation. I've blacked out all the sky lights, and fog. Set all the appropriate behaviors, and added a light source inside to illuminate the interior for building purposes. I hope this helps, I know its saved me alot of time in creating new interiors. 

Directions.
Import the Erf. 
Open, pok ooc template Area.
Duplicate it by reclicking once, then rename it. Resize it to your fancy.
Commence the Building!


Remember, when you finish building. to remove the light sources I placed. Otherwise you'll have an intense glare on everything.

114.Name: AW Amphail v1.3
114.Author: Alaster Wolf
114.Description:
AW Amphail v1.3
Exterior

Exterior layout of Amphail. Based on "Volo's Guide to the North". No creatures, no interiors, only basic details (trees, grass, terrain, basic environment). It is suitable if you want to quick-start and populate it as you like.

There is also a DM Area, that might be useful when building/testing. You will start in DM Area and use the portal to get to Amphail.

I have plans to build interiors and populate it with creatures/people/environment. So, there might be more versions later. Anyone else is welcome to build it further and submit versions (please, put my name in credits). My versions will have a prefix "AW", so be sure to use your prefix if you submit your versions.

115.Name: The Long Road (5 of 5)
115.Author: Ninthletter
115.Description: Every road goes somewhere, and the long road has reached it's destination on the shores of the sea in a great city. In this 24 x 24 area you will find a city that could easily serve as the capital of a small nation. There are too many things to list and perhaps too many things for some computers to render. I hope you find it useful.

119.Name: Lost Ruins of Zartroff (level 2)
119.Author: Eshin
119.Description: Level 2 of the ruins.. I'm not 100% satisfied yet so I will be tweaking this later. But now I'm working on level 3

120.Name: The Keg Fort
120.Author: Ghost Pirate
120.Description: Deep within a valley now called Booze Valley is a great fort of untold legend! The Keg Fort has been come! The Great (not so well known) dwarf Hale Boozebottom has spent his life fortune in constructing this holy of forts. Dedicated to the Ale gods.

122.Name: Crossroad Keep Revamp
122.Author: Nebzer the Mad
122.Description:
This is a revamp of the crossroad keep area, and the village below it. It is basically all the areas needed for a predicted future of the keep, and working door/area transitions. 
Keep
Tailor
Artificer
Blacksmith
Mage Tower
Temple
Monastery
Mausoleum
Barracks
Inn
2 cave entrances(no areas attached)
Replaced farms in front of walls with a fairgrounds/training area.
Village of Crossroads
=============================
Please feel free to do whatever with this, and no I don't want credit of any kind if it's used.

123.Name: 4 Unique  Areas
123.Author: Tank6ge
123.Description:
4 areas for your module. These include east road 1, east road 2, Beetle road, and the winding road. The east roads and beetle road can definitely be used as transition areas and the east road 1, beetle road, and winding road use similar textures and pathways. The winding road is a larger area with a lot going for it! As I have worked on these areas for a while this is probably the final version of them unless I get a request. The first several screenshots are of the winding road- when you see a sharp change the first area is east road 1 and the second and third pictures after that are east road 2 - after that more pictures of the winding road and finally towards the end I have added 4 pictures of the beetle road. 

I would love to know if you were able to use these in your module. You can send me an e-mail with any specific requests you have and as always drop by and say hi at www.ewclan.net - we are always looking for help! Don't forget to vote and leave feedback. Enjoy! 

You can see what I am currently working on at 
http://server6.theimagehosting.com/albums.php?user_id=72237

124.Name: Temple Level 1
124.Author: Arpharazon
124.Description:
My first submission on the vault.

It's a 13*16 area. Depict a temple of good.

Rooms includes :

Rooms of blessing
Altar Rooms
Dinner
Scriptorium
and two secret rooms

I currently working on the part II.

Thanks to cleitanus for somes prefabs here.

Hope you enjoy.

125.Name: Teper's Lakeside Mts. Prefab Patch 1.04
125.Author: Teper's or aadatepe
125.Description:
Hi everybody, releasing my next prefab called Lake Side Mountains. This is my version of a hike through lake side Mountain valley. Good area for Transition out of Mountanous Area with snow. Area was compiled using Patch 1.04. You can change whatever you want on the area, I hope everybody will enjoy it as I enjoyed making it.

Update: added missing bitmap images for textures. Now texture images will show up for TME textures.

126.Name: Kiye Canyon
126.Author: Ghost Pirate
126.Description:
Kiye Canyon is home of the dryad Kora, she maintains the last bit of lush forestry of the canyon.

This area features a small makeshift fort settled, the Dryad Kora, and a cave/crypt/mine area

127.Name: Old_town
127.Author: Jonamar
127.Description: Creepy town with a creepy castle ...

128.Name: Valley Fortress
128.Author: IdleBoy
128.Description: Castle/fortress in an a mountain valley. Behind the castle there is a tunnel leading into the mountains.

129.Name: Small Bank
129.Author: Lady Lilia/Shimmer
129.Description: My first submission on the vault - I hope you like it - Your comments and suggestions are welcomed.

130.Name: Player's Rest "Updated"
130.Author: Brendan Silveryhands
130.Description:
What you have here is an outdoor area, a ruined mine office on the outskirts of Diamond Lake. It's based off of the player home illustrated in Dungeon magazine's excellent Age Of Worms Adventure Path. I am using it as the first area in bringing The Age Of Worms to my group's players. But it could be a good base of operations for any campaign.

Planned updates are to include a "ruined" state for the inside so you can have a lovely "before and after" look for your player's home.

Hope you enjoy and I look forward to receiving feedback on how to improve the area.

Cheers

To use, unrar and put in your modules folder.

Update: Added and tweaked almost all areas. Added more detail to exterior and completely reorganised interior areas.

131.Name: Sammoth's Keep Overhaul
131.Author: Sammoth666
131.Description:
Ok this has a major update with a few levels to it. It is not final but, it's close to complete. I kind of got stuck on adding a Dragon Lair to the lowest level because of cave height in toolset. Enjoy =)

"Please Vote" All comments welcomed.

132.Name: Tavern_001
132.Author: THE_Mook
132.Description:
This is a Tavern/Inn with a simple layout and central fireplace that includes an upper floor and cellar (used curb for stone floor). The upper floor includes a 3 types of rooms. Feel free to modify it in any way!

*** updated 01/30/07
-removed unassigned door
-added fireplace sounds
-removed duplicate lockboxes
-rearranged one middle-class suite to include window ;)
-included Module w/ area

133.Name: Temples - Evil, Neutral & Good
133.Author: Lady Lilia/Shimmer
133.Description:
Three Temples - Evil, Neutral and Good


1. Temple - Evil: This is for those who include the darker alignment in their mod, and wish to provide a place for the evil do'ers to worship in.


2. Temple - Good: A sanctuary for those of good alignment to worship. 

 
3. Temple - Neutral: Neither good nor evil, more leaning toward the nature loving and balance.


My thanks to Razare for the sittable chairs script which I have and will be using in the temples, though not using his placeables, I have customised others which are more fitting to the settings.


Your comments are very welcome and appreciated, whether good or bad.


Enjoy

134.Name: Castle Exterior
134.Author: Hicks
134.Description: This is an exterior castle area that I built to recreate the Sega games Warriors of the Eternal Sun (WotES)starting area.

135.Name: City on the Edge
135.Author: Ninthletter
135.Description:
This 24 x 24 area is a city on the edge of a great cliff. Come and explore.

Notes: There are two bridges and two curbs used in this area that do not have textures painted on the bottom. This results in players who are using the drive cam seeing through to the sky from below. I don't like it but, there it is. Enjoy.

136.Name: house on mountain
136.Author: Jonamar
136.Description: peacefull village on isle with harbor and a mountain with an accessible house on top of it

137.Name: A Distant Field
137.Author: naz6
137.Description:
Though I made TONS of area's for NWN, I never was able to complete the overly large mod I tried to creat on my own. I recently purchased NWN2 and now my creative juices are flowing again, but I'm intentionally aiming for a smaller initial module just so I can see actual results. In that spirit, this is the first area of my new module that I have completed (or feel that I have completed.) Each time I finish an area I will upload it to the vault for feedback, votes(if deserving) and also so that others may use them if they fit in with something they are doing.

A Distant Field - A small field of in this case "ferns". A small stream runs through the area and a tool shed(outhouse) is near the field. A path running away from the shed leads back towards a partially viewed farmhouse(though it is well outside the walkable area). Trees are plentifull, and as this is my first Area, I tried my best to give the illusion of distance and horizon beyond the walkable area. PLEASE share any information that you would like to! I will continue to upload area's and once I've finished most of them I'll start in with the actual module (my goal is to have about 8-10 exterior area's with supporting interiors as needed). Thanks!

UPDATE: I changed a few small items and removed some unnessessary trees to try and make this area more user friendly! Also have some images now thanks greatly to RQScott for the help!

138.Name: Merchants - Mage, Pawn & Smithy
138.Author: Lady Lilia/Shimmer
138.Description:
Merchants

1. Smithy

2. Mage Shop

3. Pawn Broker

Others coming soon

139.Name: Ascent to the Black Mage's Tower
139.Author: Tank6ge
139.Description:
I have been working on this area for the last 3 weeks and have decided now that I would share it with the community.

This large mountainous area is dangerous to even the most skilled of warriors. Follow the path down to the circle of the cursed warrior, cross the bridge and head through the path to find the Black Mage's Tower.

This large area is visually pleasing and a feasible area to insert into any mod. I will leave the interior of the mage's tower to you. Please leave feedback/vote and as always come visit us at www.ewclan.net 

Also you can see what I am working on currently at:

http://server6.theimagehosting.com/user.php?user_id=72237&public_view=1

Enjoy!!!

140.Name: An Old Farmstead
140.Author: naz6
140.Description:
An Old Farmstead - This is a small 8x8 rural exterior. There is a farmhouse, a barn, and some equipment and such around the buildings. There are several fields with fences and a stump wall separating several of them. There are trees and grasses, though I tried not to go overboard. A steam runs through, but with a small irigation type line, it is outside the walkable area. This is the second area I have completed for a module I am working on, and it has some improvements over the previous pre-fab that I put up. 

Though I made TONS of area's for NWN, I never was able to complete the overly large mod I tried to creat on my own. I recently purchased NWN2 and now my creative juices are flowing again, but I'm intentionally aiming for a smaller initial module just so I can see actual results. In that spirit, this is the second area of my new module that I have completed (or feel that I have completed.) Each time I finish an area I will upload it to the vault for feedback, votes(if deserving) and also so that others may use them if they fit in with something they are doing. 

UPDATE: Just added some images. Special thanks to RQScott for the help with them!

141.Name: Sky Harbor
141.Author: Pennguino
141.Description:
This is an area that features a rich waterfall, harbor, some high guard post and a castle. There are ships, a merchant area, a temple and a wizards retreat. Look closely and you may find a secret passage into the castle. That is if you can hold your breath ;)
Its a 24X24 Area. None of the buildings are operational and none of the benches are useable. Everything is from the basic TS with some customizing of size.

First I want to give Morez of the moeFX v0.1 waterfall and fountain effect. Thank you for a great effect.
Second I would like to give thanks to the NWNMaster for creating a great tutorial on the toolset.

This is my very first build of an area. Hats off to those that have submitted their work. You truly dont appreciate the effort required to build out an area until you try it yourself.

I wanted to created a harbor town that had some basic work. There is still more that can be done and maybe have the flow of the building changed a little. It was a test of my very limited abilities. I think it came out alright. As with all projects it could always be better. Please use it however you want. Vote if you like too. i am not doing this for recognition. Just wanted to contribute.

142.Name: Sorceress Ashura's Prefab Area Pack
142.Author: SorceressAshura
142.Description:
Greetings community.

I was going to use these areas in my future persistent world, but have decided to go with a different setting. The areas I'm not going to use, I really didn't want to delete them forever. I put a lot of time and effort into designing them. I didn't want to throw away all that hard work. So I thought maybe the community could make use of them. 

These areas are very detailed, and most of them are connected transition-wise. The only two there not connected is the castle, and tavern. I've uploaded them individually because the file size of all of them together was just too big. (Ranging up to 77mb) So I zipped them up individually. I've included screen shots so you can get an idea of the way they look before you download them. 

The only thing these areas need, are doors, and creatures. I've already added sounds, lights, and visual effects. (See my VFX Pack) I hope you enjoy them as much as I did creating them. Feel free to change anything in them. Some of the areas have names to them, as well as map notes. But at least the construction work is done.

Let me know if you have any questions.

143.Name: Pack Lobos-Tejones
143.Author: Elminster_falcon
143.Description: Este pequeï¿½o pack contiene los monstrous del lobo y el tejon ajustados al manual de monstrous 3,5 con sus aptitudes. En el caso del tejon furia y en el caso del lobo la dote de derribo.

145.Name: Generic Chapel
145.Author: Marcelo_Lopes
145.Description:
Christian style chapel.

There is 3 floors, the main floor (chapel), the basement and the quarters.

146.Name: Rural town
146.Author: smachkem bashem
146.Description:
Well I started this as part of a module but other things have caused me to abandon it. In that Light I offer this rural town. I admit it is not finished but majority of it is there and filling in the blanks should not be a problem, given what the blanks are it probably is best they are blank.

If this goes well I will probably begin work on areas specifically designed to be prefab and upload them all.

147.Name: Abandoned Inn
147.Author: Marcelo_Lopes
147.Description: Has 2 floors, the inn and the basement, both has a linear layout.

149.Name: The Hamlet of Far Hill
149.Author: naz6
149.Description:
This is the starter village from the module that I am creating. This frontier village/hamlet is surrounded by a pallisade wall. The main entrances have guard towers, and a road runs through the entire scene. There are a smattering of buildings, the edges of a lake, and several unreachable set dressings beyond the walkable area. There is an inn, a smithy, a temple, and merchant shop. As well as guards quarters, a windmill on a hill, and some odd warehouses and homes. I have placed a few sounds, but they are basic background noises at best. There are no interiors included. There is a fair amount of grass, as well as trees within the walls and without. This is the first Village type area that I have submitted, so any and all feedback is very welcomed! 

For those that maybe interested, I have also uploaded a farm field, and an old farmstead that follow a path designed to arrive at the hamlet so feel free to check those out as well. 
Thanks for taking the time to check out my handywork!

150.Name: Cormyr: The Haunted Halls of Eveningstar
150.Author: Raith Veldrin
150.Description:
The Haunted Halls of Eveningstar
From Cormyr in the Forgotten Realms
Straight from the Source
TSR 9354 - FRQ1 - Haunted Halls of Eveningstar
________
AREAS 
You'll need to adjust area lighting. Left CITY/DAYLIGHT be default for easy viewing/editing.
________

Haunted Halls
Width=28 Height=30

Haunted Halls North
Width=29 Height=19

Haunted Halls South
Width=28 Height=30


The Haunted Halls have been divided into 3 main interior areas:
-Main
-North
-South

There is also a non-canon area of Deeper Halls that serves as the basis for a pit trap in the South.

A few of the famous traps are in place with custom scripts. The few scripts included (traps and bashable doors) follow a logical naming convention are are hybrids of various contributions to the nwvault and community.

After a few years building for a Cormyr based NWN1 PW, and a fresh start with NWN2, I've decided to 'Pull a Bioware' and develop my own setting. So as I toil around with this brave new world of Wikis acting as the internets Dreamcatchers, I've decided to release what Cormyr material I had prepared already. To see what mess I've gotten myself into, head to Link and take a look around.

Feel free to use this in your own module, and also download 'Eveningstar'. 

Thanks for downloading, and don't forget to vote/post your praise or criticism.

151.Name: Cormyr: Eveningstar
151.Author: Raith Veldrin
151.Description:
Eveningstar
From Cormyr in the Forgotten Realms
Straight from the Source
TSR 9354 - FRQ1 - Haunted Halls of Eveningstar
Errata from Into the Dragon's Lair
________
AREAS 
________

Eveningstar
Width=20 Height=20



Eveningstar 1372
After the events of 'Death of the Dragon'
Inn availibilty according to 'Into the Dragon's Lair'
-Accounting for 'thinking Realms' workaround explanation by Ed Greenwood after Wizards made a boo-boo in citing the only open Inn as the Welcoming Hand.

After a few years building for a Cormyr based NWN1 PW, and a fresh start with NWN2, I've 

decided to 'Pull a Bioware' and develop my own setting. So as I toil around with this 

brave new world of Wikis acting as the internets Dreamcatchers, I've decided to release what Cormyr material I had prepared already. To see what mess I've gotten myself into, head to Link and take a look around.

Feel free to use this in your own module, and also download 'The Haunted Halls of Eveningstar'. 

Thanks for downloading, and don't forget to vote/post your praise or criticism.

152.Name: Helm's Stronghold (to become Helm's Deep)
152.Author: MDarwin
152.Description:
This is a W.I.P. I'm trying to build Helm's Deep. Well this is my second area so far. The map is big(to big really).It has got a huge castle on top of a hill which can be excessed via a ramp and a following bridge. On the foot of this hill, I've placed a small village. There are two NPC's in it with a dialog(testing all tools in toolset). A merchant with a working shop is in there as well. At the edge of the village is a fast flowing river(got to adjust the speed of flow)with a bridge. Both bridges are walkable.The trees need there walkcutters still. This is an outdoor area only, with a few placables. 


Well, maybe someone has use for it,enjoy.
One more thing, You might wanna take out the Autosave script on the Area enter slot. Some people have issues with it(autosave in areas).The actual file format is erf.

153.Name: Glade of the Fallen Wizard
153.Author: naz6
153.Description:
The 4th completed area for the module that I am building, this is a 24x24 forest/mountainous exterior. By far my largest undertaking so far, this area includes a large canyon that cuts across a portion of the area. A ruined structure stands upon a small platue that rises out of this canyon, connected by a narrow land bridge. There is also a cave along the canyon's rim, 2 separate and spares campsights, a stream/river and small pond, and a small trail that winds down from a steep hill and leads out to the ruins. 

This is my first really BIG area, and my first attempt with NWN2 to make a decent looking forest type setting. Any Feedback is greatly appreciated to help me as I am currently working on another Large outdoor area. Check out my other pre-fabs if you liked this one! Thanks again - Naz

154.Name: Underdark_Bazaar_areas
154.Author: Elminster_Falcon
154.Description:
There is a 4 areas of underdark that include one Bazaar. This areas is prepared that you put your NPC,monsters and some.

Aqui teneis 4 areas de infraoscuridad que incluye un bazaar. Espero que os guste.

155.Name: Harbour Casern / Port Barracks
155.Author: Zed_Den & Creat
155.Description:
Three Maps from the German Mod: "Insel der Schrecken".

The Screenshots says more.

... if you want more Maps like this, then vote ;-)


Link

156.Name: Elven_Forest
156.Author: Elminster_falcon
156.Description:
This is my last creation: Elven Forest. This area content some prefabs and one forest area creation. FOR SEE THE WATERFALL EFFECT YOU NEED THIS HACK OF SHADOWM: Link

Esta es mi ultima creacion: Bosque Elfico. Esta area contiene muchos prefabs y my forma de crear un bosque que tal vez os ayude para crear los vuestros propios. Podeis usar el area para vuestros modulos o mundos si lo creeis adecuadamente. Bueno espero que os guste.

Elminster_falcon

157.Name: The City Slums
157.Author: FriendlyFire
157.Description: A textured and landscaped city slum exterior, needs light and sound + inhabitants. Has bridges, river, market area, shanty town and error free walkmesh. No scripts.

159.Name: Random Field
159.Author: Silver-Calibur
159.Description:
This area prefab is of a random, everyday field. It can be used in a million different ways.

Use it, abuse it, edit it, do as you like with it.

Oh, and if you would, please leave some constructive criticism.

160.Name: The Anderack Bridge
160.Author: naz6
160.Description:
This is my 5th Ready to Submit area for the module that I am building. The walkable area is 32x24, and is much larger than my previous area's. This area features a ton of plants, mostly in the form of trees. A road runs across the southern portion of the area and leads to a bridge above a river canyon. Other features for this area include: A waterfall, done to the best of my current ability, scattered ruins, 2 different "camp" type area's, including one at the bridge. A fortified area at the mouth of a canyon at the northern edge of the area, a cave, some lighting and sound, and alot of placeables, some of which may only make sense to my particular mod. I have spent alot of time working on this area, but I realize that it is not perfect. There is alot of room for personalization. No interiors are included. 

This is the last of the BIG area's that I will be building for my module. I have tried to make each bigger and better than the last and I am excited about finally being able to really begin in earnest with making my mod. Any comments (including votes) are welcome, as I really want to make my offering's as good as I can. 

** A Note of Self Critisizm ** I fully realize that the road in this area is VERY straight, probably TOO straight in some eyes. I may change this before I release the actual mod that this area will be in, but in building the area, I didn't really see a problem with it. The grass and weeds I use are also a bit sparse compared to some, I don't do this for performance reasons, I simply like the look personally.

162.Name: Country house
162.Author: Phil73
162.Description: This small module consists of an exterior with a river, forest, small camp, and country house. It also includes the interior for the country house. It is the first prefab I have built using the NWN2 toolset. I did have plans to build a larger module but it was just too time consuming, so hopefully others will find this useful

163.Name: Just a simple bar quest...
163.Author: Moradin the Soul Forger
163.Description:
This is a quickie quest that I whipped up to fill a percieved hole in a server, that turned out to be a placeholder for a work in progress, so rather than throw it away, I post it here for those in need of simple filler.

To use the quest, erf out the dwarf NPC and the Badger_Den area. Place the dwarf in your favorite drinking establishment, and then add a cave to a nearby area and connect its entrance with the badger den.

You might want to adjust the dialog to reference an area in your own mod.

Feel free to alter as you see fit.

164.Name: Built in Cliff City
164.Author: Kilr0y
164.Description:
This city is built into the side of a steep cliff, which provides the large city with strong natural defences. 
----------------------------------
This is my second area, im still a bit noobish, but feel free to do whatever you want with it, no credits needed.

165.Name: Abandoned town
165.Author: Nexx
165.Description:
An abandoned and long forgotten town with a sinister castle, maybe waiting for adventurers. The area is medium size (16x16)

Note: this is a sneak peek at an upcoming module I'm working on ("Treasure hunters") that I thought to share with the community. the area is finished and polished, but lacks sound. enjoy!

166.Name: Sharpstone Village
166.Author: Jezla9
166.Description:
This is the first area I have made in NWN2. The village is the base of operations in my current in progress module. It is a small mountian mining village. All but two doors are static(the cave entrance and the general store), and sounds and lights are in place.

I have modified it slightly from the original that appears in my mod, and I have included an .erf and .mod file. Just import and populate!

Any comments or suggestions are welcome.

167.Name: ASG: The Mysty Brdige
167.Author: Timidon
167.Description: The Mysty Bridge, a small path over a river. Good for a foresty area. This Area is 12x12, has a few scripts attatched to it. Included are 2 blueprint monsters (bridge guardian, and a shrunk down version of the giant spider). This is part of my module in the works called "Expedition to the Dhamoril Woods". I spent a little while here testing out scripts and such. I thought it would be good to share with you folks.

168.Name: B.B.'s City of Dis
168.Author: Boozehound Blue
168.Description:
In Dante Alighieri's The Divine Comedy, Dis is the City of the Dead (it.: La cittÃ  infuocata di Dite). It is located in the sixth circle. Punished within Dis are active (rather than passive) sins: heretics, assassins, suicides, fraudulents and traitors. The walls of Dis are guarded by fallen angels.

This is an exterior area (32x32) which utilizes The Grinning Fool's "Complete Visual Darkness" to mock an interior. (Download it and give this area a walkthrough!) Makes for a great, two-story labyrinth. 

Note: this area is not fully completed. The foundation has been laid and quite a bit of ambiance has been added, but it needs more texturing.
********************************
Malebolge
********************************

169.Name: KOh: Folldeck Alpha 0.01
169.Author: Razoorsharp
169.Description:
please, before downloading read below link 
Link

This is Folldeck part of the world of Hayr . 
This outpost has been here for hundreds of years and has served as a safe haven in the middle of the Katran kingdom.

There are alot of bug's and parts left unfinished and rubbish in it but the general idea is there.
If any of you use it please credit us 
and our world 
Link

If anyone bugfixed it or finished it for us (before we do) please send it back to us , and we will credit you 

we are also looking for people who would want to create modules with our team.
We need alot of people

170.Name: City of Hayr "Megka" Alpha 0.01
170.Author: razoorsharp
170.Description:
please before downloading read below link 
Link

This is one of my capitols in the world of Hayr , inhabited by the Katran, the oldest of human races .

There are alot of bug's and parts left unfinished and rubbish in it but the general idea is there.
If any of you use it please credit us 
and our world 
Link

If anyone bugfixed it or finished it for us (before we do) please send it back to us , and we will credit you 

we are also looking for people who would want to create modules with our team.
We need alot of people 

****

City story!
********
City of Hayr .

Main racial group: Katran
Main Religion: Brorneo
Unique Resource: Mithieen Steel & Mithieen Gems
Main Trade: Wheat, Ale, Mithieen Gems, Mithieen Steel, Oak timber.
Civilians: 7.349
Military strength
- 380 Longbow men
- 725 Spearmen ( short spear, peasants )
- 20 Swordsmen knights of Brorneo
- 10 Royal Knights (Angelics)
- 300 City guards (Sword shield + shortbow)
- 3 Catapults (city defense)
- 2 Trebuchets (city defense)
- 1 Young Silver Dragon (Vashner)
- 0 sea vassals

Description:
The City of Hayr is the Capitol of the Katran people. In ï¿½The Ancient Bloodlineï¿½ the city is ruled by King Matheus XII (the greedy).

The city itself is placed upon a mountain that is going upwards towards the sea with only one way to approach it, making it almost impossible to lay siege to the city, with the docks still open.

The City is divided into six areasï¿½ the first is the crossroads at the base of the mountain.
The crossroads is where the farms are and a windmill and some of the old Megka ruins of the Hayrodians On the western side of the mountain there is a group of caves called the Mithieen caves . The smaller Mithieen caves are used as mines while the greater cave is a depleted mine and now harborï¿½s the lair of Vashner, the silver dragon.

The Second part of the city is the public area. Here you will find gardens and an arena where people from the realm can come and watch spectacular fights. At the second gates stands a barrack that also functions as a storage house and checkpoint for anyone who wants to get in the city. The public area is the lowest part of the city and for that reason is very vulnerable to arrows if an enemy would attack through this part of the city. These two areaï¿½s are the only ones that are accessible to none city inhabitants.

The Third part of the City is the lower district. Here live the common people and poor people, there is a small temple of Brorneo and Isa and a small market place. You will also find some shops here like Sealharï¿½s Blacksmith and Drakï¿½s Tavern...

When you enter the Lower district for the first time you will see a bridge on your right hand side and thatï¿½s where the fourth area is .

The fourth area is the training ground, it is a small mountain connected with a bridge to the main city mountain. Here you will find barracks and trainers who can teach you skillï¿½s and let you train them. The place is famous for its extravagant tower of strength, where mages study the power of enhancing physical strength through magic and religion.

The Fifth area is on the left hand side , this is the Higher district. When you get through the reinforced gates you will see a field or grain with a statue of Isa and a stone tree of Weberkar in a square with marble stones. The field and tree are holy places where people pray to those godï¿½s and on the edge of the mountain stands a temple of Broreo.

The Square is surrounded with luxurious houses and at the end of the square at the top of the mountain stands the castle.

The Sixth is the Harbor district; this part of the city has direct access to the castle.
If you are in the high district of the city you are able to access the docks by a path that runs down the mountain on the opposite side of the crossroads and public area. Here you will find a sailors bar where captains and their crew rest and sleep and also bargain about their cargo and trade. Some of the lower district female inhabitants have a working permit there but it has nothing to do with sailing or trading but more with the sailors themselves..



Attack/defend options

Although the city is heavily defended from the front the back is very vulnerable because of the docks. The only two things that defend the docks is the dragon lair Mithieen cave opening on the sea side, and the plateau behind the lower districts temple.

If you encounter an attack from the front catapults and the trebuchet fire on the crossroads and the bridge to the training ground provides a great spot to pepper the enemy with arrows. If they manage to get in the public area spearmen and swordsmen can hold the enemy back on the steep hill going to the lower district, while bowmen can shoot from the higher district towers and walls making it almost impossible to get through, even getting to the hill would be a death trap.

If they manage t break through to the lower district the towers and reinforced gate provides the best defense, the enemy would have to get a battering-ram up the hill in the public area while under constant fire.



History:
In the beginning of the Third era the Katran people where attacked by the Hayrodian people of Megka whoï¿½s reason for this war is still unknown. After the Hayrodians turned Homkatran into a pile of rubble the Katran people and survivorï¿½s retreated to a small village still left untouched in the woods under the protection of the Ferlinain, the village was Folldeck.

From there they assembled their last army in the hopes they could attack the centre of Hayrodian power, the city of Megka .

After the long march General Matheus saw a small temple with priests at the base of the city. After sending spies to investigate, it appeared they where bringing a statue in resembling one of the Katran. Matheus thought it was a way of putting a spell on the Katran and he and a few soldiers stormed the temple and killed the monks inside who never knew what hit them .

He ordered his finest soldiers to put on the cloaks and enter the city when the others finished building their ladders.
The next day he send the decoy monks in the city with the troops with ladders following them in order to fool the Hayrodians. When they opened the gates for the monks to get in the city the others dropped their ladders, when the monks threw off their cloaks when they were in the city they killed the gate keepers and the rest of the troops poured into the city killing everything and everyone in their path. The Hayrodians where taken completely by surprise and where not wearing their almost impenetrable armor during battle making them easy pray for the Katranï¿½s army.

After the Katran victory over the Hayrodians they destroyed every trace of this race from the city apart from the temple which is still today a memorial of this victory and how the Katran trick delivered them the most stunning victory the world had ever seen against all odds.

When they rebuilt the city they took great care in making an almost impenetrable city as it is today
They called it City of Hayr because they feel the city is the center of the known world.

171.Name: Aschbourne
171.Author: Rascal
171.Description:
Here is the start area of a project Ive been working on. Its a small fishing village called Aschbourne. Its located on the far eastern portion of Calimshan. 

I built and hosted Aschbourne as a PW for NwN1 and now with NwN2 I'm taking it to new heights.

I will keep this file updated as much as I can but I thought others might find a use for it. :)

All comments welcome.

172.Name: Tropical Island
172.Author: Rascal
172.Description: This is my attempt at making an Tropical Island. Its still a WIP but I thought others could use it and make it into what they want. :-)

173.Name: Teper's Hidden Valley Prefab
173.Author: Teper's or aadatepe
173.Description:
Hi everybody,I am releasing a new area prefab called Hidden Valley, based on Tolkien's Rivendale Valley. 
I hope everybody will enjoy it as I enjoyed making it. I had some walkmesh problems with the decking tried fixing as much as 
possible, still some spots that are strange but for the most part it works fine. I decided to use some of the 
water fall effects that botu and moefx have created. Basically I broken down some of the effect into smaller
individual effects for easy extension and placement. For the walkmesh I used Placeable Walkmesh Helper version 0.3, by Zarathustra217.

174.Name: Western Heartlands Prefab Pack
174.Author: C.M. Clark
174.Description:
This was the beginnings of a module that I started working on after the release of NWN2. A few different factors came into play and I've decided to stop working on the project and make available to the community the work that I completed.

In the module you will find four linked areas set in the Western Heartlands against an autumn backdrop. Included are the following buildings/areas:

- A completely mapped out small town with interiors finished. There you will find a blacksmith, general store, grocer, town hall, mayor's home and a few surprises if you explore.

- A fully mapped out 3 level "wizard mansion" interior and exterior area.

- A carefully designed small farm exterior.

- Several lush exteriors for your use/enjoyment.

Please feel free to use any of these areas as you see fit. The small village is by far the best area and I hope I get to see it in a completed mod someday. I did a lot of the grunt work involved with area building here and I don't want to see it go to waste. I only ask that you shoot me an email if you complete a mod using my areas so that I can check it out.

- C.M. Clark

175.Name: City of Hayr "Megka" Alpha 0.02
175.Author: Razoorsharp
175.Description:
Part 2 of the Alpha . 
Look here first
Link

This is Alpha 2 with a walkable bridge .. 
There is still something that need's to be done like the walkmesh on the docks.. getting the upper district to work propperly fill in the militairy part and Crossroads . 
But this will give you a general idea how it's going to look . 

Feel free to use it in any way .. 

Don't forget the credits 

And i would like to credit " Zamora" for his work on the module . he made the bridge and gave us his Cemetery to use for our module . 

Way to go Zamora .. 

He also taught me a few things on walkmeshes . 


For more " Kingdoms of Hayr" check here

Link 

** please do not extract the Cemetery unless you asked "Zamora" first (he's on the NWN2 boards)*

176.Name: Warehouse
176.Author: Wyrin
176.Description:
I spent too long fiddling with this area which the player will spend at most 3 minutes in for my upcoming mod Dark Avenger so I thought I'd share it here

It's a warehouse, complete with trolley system to move goods around. Doorways at north and south left open - can be altered easily enough to fit the use. Sounds and lighting are included. Walkmesh is fine, although I'd avoid placeing anything more around the central platform, as then it might struggle when baking.

Link

178.Name: castle
178.Author: zach_twister
178.Description: not intended for use - trying to figure out how to add content

179.Name: General Training Camp
179.Author: MorningWaits
179.Description:
This is an area from a module I decided not to continue, but I thought some of the areas of the module were good. So, I thought I'd share this one. It's a training camp (Lyian camp in the module) with a "office" or inn style building. There's a shed next to that building, and two training sections split by fences. There is also a statue with an inscription, maybe for the camp's founder?

 Feel free to edit any of this area. As I said, this is an area from a discontinued module, so if you stumble across any random named objects, please let me know. I hope you enjoy. :)

180.Name: ArdenCityCenter
180.Author: bjlehto
180.Description: This is my first offering. It is the city center for a module I'm building. I was inspired by the Forbidden City in Beijing. There are no working doors or anything, but it took a lot of work and I thought someone out there might want to use it.

181.Name: Farmland
181.Author: MorningWaits
181.Description:
This area started with my boyfriend giving my ideas of areas I could do when I was bored. It turned out pretty good, I think.

 It's a farmland, fenced off with two roads spilling at the corner of the crops. There's a lake that streams around the farm for the plants. Across the little bridge and up the road are a home and barn.

 Feel free to edit any of this area. Let me know if you find any mistakes. :)

182.Name: Riverside Town
182.Author: MorningWaits
182.Description:
This smaller sized town sits next to a river that spills into a lake and empties on the other side of the town. A single road curves through the town with houses on each side. A guard post is set next to the bridge leaving or entering the town (depending on which way you're going).

 The walk mesh is a bit sloppy and I cut a lot of things I didn't need to do, this is mostly because I was half asleep when doing all this. :) I did my best to check for mistakes, but I might have missed somethings. Please let me know if you find any or have any questions.

183.Name: Lathiz  preview
183.Author: superbau
183.Description: o montain village trying to make it

184.Name: Teper's Bafa Lake Prefab
184.Author: aadatepe or Teper's
184.Description:
Hi everybody,I am releasing a new area prefab called Bafa Lake, based on my recent stay in Turkey for 2 years. I had
the opportunity to do some hiking around the Bafa Lake region south of Izmir. Is a very beautiful place, with small
villages nestled in the mountains, and on the northeast end of the Mountain range called the five fingers, is an ancient city
called Heracles which is currently occupied by villagers who have built their homes on the ruins living side by side with history.
I hope everybody will enjoy it I tried to capture the essence of the area. Updated the northeast range, sandstone textures did not look right, cleaned up some grass and trees. Also the area offers 2 caves one is hidden up on the slopes. I kept the walkmesh simple, builders can decide on the walkmesh they want.

185.Name: Yawning Portal tavern
185.Author: dutch206
185.Description:
This is a prefab of the first floor of the Yawning Portal Tavern on Rainruin street in Waterdeep. (This is the floorplan from the Forgotten Realms Interactive Atlas, not the city set)

Prefab contains no NPC's -- completely blank and ready to use in your module.

186.Name: Prairie Area
186.Author: Sir Kicley
186.Description:
This is my very first attempt at creating an area. I read through the Help Tutorial with the toolset and tried my hand at it. It is a small area of prairie-like terrain.

This has no encounters, creatures, NPCs, triggered events, or scripting.

It is simply an area landscape to practice and shore up on skills of making terrain.

I am hoping some of the more veteraned module makers can take a look and give me some feedback; whether I'm on the right path towards doing something good, and/or where I fault and can improve.

187.Name: Hallowed Woods
187.Author: Seed
187.Description:
This is an area I created using the YATT plug for the NWN2 Toolset. I have not added any grass, trees, placables or water. It is just the raw area output created by YATT. The only thing I did after creating the area with YATT was to clean up the walkmesh and bake it. This is a good example of what you can make using YATT - I did not edit the terrain or textures at all in the toolset.

Feel free to use this in any way you see fit. If you do use it, I'd be very interested to see the final product and if you send me the file, I will add it to this download page when done.

188.Name: Autumn Village Prefab
188.Author: Saorsa
188.Description:
This prefab includes three areas and a few custom items and placeables I made while working on a Ranger oriented module. I ran out of inspiration and haven't worked on the module in a while, so I thought I'd post the completed areas for others to use if they like. 

Areas:
*A small cabin with some basic ranger gear inside.
*An autumn village with a few crops, a handful of custom placeables such as a hen's nest with eggs a couple logs with moss that can be used to cure light wounds. Two non-fleshed-out NPCs, and a bunny.
*A small forested area with an undeveloped cave area, which was going to be a poacher's den. Also includes a few custom placeables with magic moss and bark.

-----
The 37mb file is the complete, unstripped version, and requires WinZIP to open.

189.Name: The Misty Road v2
189.Author: RogerWilco2007
189.Description: Part of a mod that I am making, this section of The Misty Road contains rolling hills, some trees and vegetation, a small watering hole, and sounds. Any comments or suggestions are welcome... Enjoy!

190.Name: Rise
190.Author: SeanCaldecott
190.Description:
This an area intended for some sort of boss battle or major battle at least.
The area is supposed to be a dormant volcano top fortress that has been destroyed by unexpected volcanic activity. It only has one Transition point but a portal or something could be added I suppose ;). 

Unfortunately I could not give the area any weather or sounds because my toolset isnt fully functioning(no plugins work either).

191.Name: Seahorse Cove: The Cathedral
191.Author: Allyndn the Beggar
191.Description: Seahorse Cove is a proposed collection of building prefabs to add depth and detail to a city setting. I began this project for three reasons:1) I (as a player) want to be rewarded with interesting things when I explore.2) As a builder, I wanted to have a fun way to take gold from players. 3) As a DM, I wanted to create a setting which would serve as a jumping off point for many different adventures. The "Cathedral" is the first prefab for Seahorse Cove. Features include: **A priest who gives a doctrinal message when the altar is approached, **A relic store, **A holy shrine, **A library containing books which give a one-time experience point bonus, **A prayer nook where a PC can make a small offering, then pray for a blessing, healing, or guidance. Results are based on class and alignment. "Insight" is not implemented; a builder could use this conversation node to give a player a hint as to what to do next in the module.

192.Name: House of Joys
192.Author: Conall Halfbearded
192.Description: This interior area was originally designed as a house of negotiable repute on the 18+ World Of Desire server. Due primarily to unreasonable attitudes on the part of the sever owner, I have since left that server, and as the admin refused to discontinue use of my creation on my departure, I decided to give it to everyone. The concept was Dwarven-built, just underground, with various Themed rooms for the clients through the doors to the right of the Great Hall (As you face from the bar towards the fireplace), Storage and Staff quarters to the left behind secret doors. This could easily be a sumptuous Castle basement with some placeable reworking, if you wish a more.. PG rating.

193.Name: ddaedelus Sample Areas
193.Author: ddaedelus
193.Description:
This module is a small collection of 3 areas I've built in the toolset. 

There are no encounters and no plot. They are area samples only.

The external areas were originally built for the second part of my campaign 
project, "The Craftsmen of Knell: Fetching Hollow." The two areas are almost 
identical with the notable exception of the walkmesh.

The interior area is just a small transitional space between the two
external areas.

If you wish to use these areas (or the .dds) in your projects, feel free. But 
please credit me and also understand that there is some small chance that I 
might actually finish my campaign in the next five years or so and use the 
external areas myself.


Installation:

 "ddaedelus Sample Areas.mod"
 Put this is your \My Documents\Neverwinter Nights 2\Modules folder.

 "PLC_BR_RIVERKEEP01.dds" 
 This is an optional file. It changes the color of the Riverkeep placeable
 from slate blue to light brown so that it matches the rest of the 
 placeables used. If you choose to use it, put it in your 
 \My Documents\Neverwinter Nights 2\Override folder.

 README.txt
 This file. Put it in your recycling bin. :)


Thanks for taking a look.

ddaedelus (aka Don Allmon)
07/25/2007

This is just an exterior representing a graveyard.

Ceci est un simple extÃ©rieur reprÃ©sentant un cimetiÃ¨re.

195.Name: White Wind
195.Author: Pennguino
195.Description:
Large Area. Castle, Church, Noble section, government section, commoner section, Weapons and Weave Academy, 2 Inns, twin water falls, market area, walkable walls, moat.

This is part of a module I have in my head. A questline battle of good and evil. The Serrated Saints (Good) and the Crescent Moon Assassin Guild (Bad). The assassins are aided by shadows (See cave and windmill).

An epic battle with a Black Dragon and a Shadow Lord scorched the earth and carved out the lake. (this is why there is so much black earth and dark waters)

If i new scripting I would have put a lever on top of the walls to transport a toon down. Also i would have activated the secret sewer entrance in the cave to sneak into the grave yard. Also a shadow is behing the Dragon Flagon (upper Inn). The shutter is partially open and I would like to have a script to check for evilness and a member of the Crescent Moon guild to allow one to sneak into the back of the inn for a covert entrance.

This is my second attempt at building an area. Hats off to all of those that contribute to the game. I have been working on this for about 3 months off and on at night.

Added Screen shots. was in a rush last night to post it and didnt notice that bmp failed
