203.Name: (Port City) Harlin'lee
203.Author: MorningWaits
203.Description:
This is a smaller sized town with two main docks connected out at sea. Not many doors are in but besides that, the building process of this area is complete. Feel free to add any NPC's or edit the area, all I ask is a little credit for the area. :)

 There's a lot to see in this area. From the starting gate you move down a coble road to a small farm. This would be one farm of many outside of this area, along the outskirts. The owner just happen to be lucky (or rich) enough to get a spot close to town. Down the road a bit more from the farm is the inn. Following the bend of the road next to the inn, you enter the city. Right away you'll find the small park to the right, up the stairs (my personal favorite spot in the area :D). Next to the park is a church-style building with the first main dock. Then there's the main street of the city. There's a nice fountain upon a few raised curbs, but more importantly, there's the merchants. They're to the left of the street, homes and living courters on the right. At the end of the street, you can see a small storage area with a lonely bench. Then finishes the area with the second main dock.

 This area took me a few days and I'm content with it. There's a lot of small details I wish I could have gotten into the screen shots, but I think you'll just have to walk around in it personally and keep an eye out for anything small. I've been trying out a lot of player-made mods and found that a lot of the areas are kinda.. iffy. I mainly build to try to make the game "pretty". I love putting way too much detail into things people will probably never notice. Like the light house on the lonely island that's out of range for most people to see with their distance settings. o.o;

 Please let me know of any mistakes or problems. I made most of this area while talking with my boyfriend over an IM, so there maybe a few. :D

 PS: If anyone cares much, I'll be updating and adding the same area, but filled with a lot more lore. NPC's, finished buildings, merchants, ect. I have a lot of ideas for Harlin'lee, maybe a few of you would like to see them too. :)

204.Name: Tepers Arid Extra Dry
204.Author: Teper's or aadatepe
204.Description:
Hi everybody,I am releasing a new area prefab called Arid Extra Dry (BO not included). Contains three 12x12 areas with working transitions and some creaters to boot.
I hope everybody will enjoy Arid Lands. You wander into strange lands, hot, windy and engulfed 
in endless dust clouds. A great battle has been fought, remnints of it still linger. Funny thing 
about Land it never forgets,but always covers the truth from sight. What truths will the
arid lands reveal? What discoveries will you make? Will a new kingdom be forged from the sandy
depth of the Arid Lands. I leave you to ponder how the adventure unfolds.

207.Name: Witch's Hollow
207.Author: TheNine
207.Description:
Witch's Hollow is a very small town in the middle of the jungles of Kastel were it serves as a missionary outpost to religious men from the Gendalian empire.

At least it used to, not it's overrun with drow, the living dead and ridicolously large flesh-eating vermin and the only survivors is a sentient zombie, a crazy gunman and an intelligent imp.

Well, at least that's what it is in Scourge of the Hellgates. But if you remove the portal in the middle of the town it can serve as any random small jungle town.

Just putting this out there both to see how it competes with other areas just for fun and I thought maybe someone needed a partially ruined jungle village.

P.S. I may have forgotten some wolfs somewhere in there.

208.Name: The Atoll
208.Author: Ninthletter
208.Description:
The Atoll is a 20 x 20 island complete with docks, ships, a small town, and lots of places to explore. You'll also find two cave entrances (one is hard to find), a campsite on the beach, and more.

Some technical notes:

The trees in this area are not locked down nor are they blocked with the walkmesh cutter. They are not locked because I didn't want to die of old age before I was done. They are not cuttered because there are many places that you will want to go that would simply not be possible if they were. You'll see.

If you see something you don't like jump into the toolset and slice, dice, and chop to your hearts content.

I hope you enjoy,

Ninthletter

212.Author: ~fenixphire~
212.Description: This is what I use for the starting area of my campaign mod, but it could be used for other things. Make the portal usable, and turn it in to a wizard lair! Change some placeables and make it a secure hidden vault in a mansion! I'm sure there are lots of things that can be done with it. All I ask is that you give me credit if you use it. (And yes, each and every little gold pile was hand placed...).

213.Name: Preshall's Mountain Pass
213.Author: Preshall
213.Description:
This is an uncut (that is not final) version of the mountain pass area that I am creating for Cerea 2. This was originally planned for my own PW which is now on hiatus, so I decided to release it to the community in its current form. It will go thru many revisions (waterfall, new bridge, etc) before it goes into C2. You are welcome to use it in your module/PW but please give me credit for the original area design. This represents close to 60 hours of painstaking terrain editing (no terrain generators used - all done by hand) and texturing. I personally think it is gorgeous. Please vote and let me know what you think.

Known issues/notes to user:
-Some Walkmesh areas are not complete (some walk and nowalk editing needs to be done.)
-Bushes need to be made either environmental or deleted completely (pathing issues - hard to walk around them in some spots.)
-The whole east side of the area can still be edited and used if need be.
-Large size: 107 MB.
-You will need to reset the start position.
-Some texturing of the ground under the lake needs to be completed.

Again, please vote but remember this is a rough and unpolished area so don't expect it to be perfect - just damn near. :) Leaves a lot to be customized if you want.

217.Name: Desert - Pyramid
217.Author: JayAre
217.Description:
This is my first Area Prefab, nothing spectacular. I wanted to create a Pyramid for a desert module, either for myself, or anyone else who may have a need for a large pyramid. 

The area is only 16x16, and the Pyramid is actually a part of the terrain. I just raised up the terrain in the desired shape and then texturized it. If you want the pyramid to face a certain direction, then just change the direction "North" is facing in the toolset. I'm sure that someone can create better looking dunes than my feeble attempt, my main concern was raising the temple.

I've included in this download Desert_Pyramid as an *.erf (Area) and as a *.mod, for a quick look at the area.

I hope someone can find a good use for this. Enjoy!

~JayAre
08-22-2007

223.Name: Private shrine
223.Author: Bh
223.Description:
A small private or secret shrine located inside a house or manor. Can belong to a secret cult, a rich person that secretly or privately wants to worship his god(s).

It is comprised of a corridor and a larger area where the shrine exists and the area's format is module. Partly inspired by Lady Lilia's Temples.

Original idea included many lit candles and candelabras scattered throughout the shrine floor, in order to convey a heavy ritualistic tone. Unfortunately this was impossible, since dynamic lighting and shadows are an extreme resource hog even for the latest graphic cards. Unwanted lights and effects can be removed for better performance.

Updated and removed some glitching placeables that appeared in the area with the installation of Motb. Also removed the 25 paintings hak. 

Haks/overrides required:
1) Gortan's Magical Gadgets (hak): Link
2) Sorceress Ashura's VFX Pack (override): Link

!!Requires Motb!!

225.Description:
This is a marsh I made for my mod, it is intended to be a PvE area with a "safe path" and a path leading through the marsh to an ancient building.
Note: the lighting is extremely dark. (bring a 20 yard torch)

The Area has alot of grass, trees and terrain, also water which may overload some systems so toning down may be necessary. (im working with a C2 Duo, 2 gig RAM, 7600 GT)

I look forward to your questions, comments and suggestions.

Credit isnt compulsory but would be nice ^^

226.Name: Anar
226.Author: TheNine
226.Description:
Anar is one of many smaller cities built by survivors of the meteor shower thirty years ago. And like most mainland cities bar the large ones who can afford their own eco-system Anar is pretty err...wastelandish? With high crime rates and all that jazz, my point is it has ruined stuff and meteor craters. And the place the majority of the first Scourge of the Hellgates module will take place in as well.

Anyway, it's a 12X12 city area suitable for perhaps a desert or a wasteland or just anywhere there isn't much vegetation.

 -Peace out


P.S: The close fog is there to represent dirt still being in the air after the meteor showers in Scourge of the Hellgates. So it's not there to spite you. Even though spiting you is kind of funny.





But you can use it as anything.


UPDATE: For some reason I forgot to remove all the Soth (Scourge of the Hellgates) creatures in there. And because of the the few people who alredy downloaded it have ended up with a few conversations as well. And the ability to play a few seconds of Scourge of the Hellgates.


Though, instead of just removing that zip file and replacing it. I'm leaving it there. Just in case someone needs a populated Anar. For a DM campaign or anything or you are just extremely bored and want to play the firts few seconds of Scourge of the Hellgates. Or perhaps you want to see what kind of population I had in mind when building the area.

 But I'm also uploading an unpopulated version. Obiviously.

UPDATE: Removed Populated version, because it no longer represents the start of Scourge of the Hellgates and I'd hate people getting the wrong idea about it. Even if it means I'l lose 19 downloads.....

:(

227.Name: City Of Cauldron - North
227.Author: Sir Kicley
227.Description:
This is my rendition of the City of Cauldron. This is the city that the Paizo Publishing campaign of Shackled City takes place. 
So far I have completed a walkable section of the North area of the city. The other areas are to follow while I'm soliciting feedback on this one to see what I can take and apply to building of the other areas.

Feel free to download this area and use it if you want to populate it for your own needs. As is customary, I would at least appreciate being credited for it though. I have one favor, if/when anyone uses this area (and the upcoming adjacent areas) and adds quests, etc to it, I would love to see what you've done with it. I intend to make interiors and NPCs (especially the important ones to the campaign), and would love to see or collaborate with others on what can and has been added.

For those unfamiliar with Cauldron: The city is built in a circle. It is built within the caldera of a long-dead volcano. Cauldron is placed in tropical mountainous region overlooking vast rain forests. The city is a cosmopolitan place of about 5,000 population, ruled by wealthy nobles. Each street is a concentric ring around the center which is a bright blue lake. The streets closest to the lake and the docks are are where the poorest and destitute people live. As one travels outward, each subsequent concentric street becomes more and more lavish...and more lit (the docks and side streets can get awfully dark and dangerous at night). The nobles and estates dwell on the outer ring - then a wall surrounds the city. As the city is inside a volcano, imagine the city sitting in the shape of a bowl - so each thoroughfare outwards is not only bigger but higher - the nobles literally look down on the rest of the city. When visiting the docks you're literally looking up at the city.

The city has cobblestone streets made from dark volcanic rock and is built on the reddish earth of the dead volcano.



I divided the city up into four quadrants - each the shape of a wedge of watermelon. I have only completed the North. Eventually there will be transitions available on each street at each end that will then take you to the adjacent quadrant. Theoretcially you can eventually walk in a circle around the whole city.

Currently there are no interiors done, no NPCs, scripting, encounters or conversations. The doors are currently unlocked, but dont lead anywhere, so ultimately I am posting this for people to peruse and just walk through it.

This is only the second area I have ever built; the first one was just a small outdoor field for practice. I am doing this for two reasons: 1) I would like feedback to see if I'm on the right track towards accomplishing something great. 2) I would like to make it great - with the intention of hopefully attracting the attention of persons who can script etc so that I could team up with them and make the city as a backdrop for a number of quests (as I have no scripting knowledge whatsoever but really want to learn and really want to use this city for quests).

Those interested in learning more about the Pen and Paper version of Shackled City - as it pertains to my campaign that I'm running (as my campaign is set in a homebrew world and so my version of Cauldron does have slight differences than the actual released product) can use the following link to my message board that I maintain for my players' use.

Link


Robert

231.Author: SGK73
231.Description:
Two Ravenloft inspired villages.
One set in mountains and the other in a deep forest.
The villages are quite generic so a change of lighting and sound set will transform them into abit more standard fantasy villages.

Note that there are *no* interior areas, as there are alot of good interiors in the prefab area to link into for modulebuilders.

*UPDATE* 
Added two optional DayNight Cycles for those who do not want a static night time. These where saved with the 1.1 editor so is probably not going to import correctly into 1.06.
Also do not forget to change under environment variables, "Day/Night Cycle == TRUE" and "Is Always Night == False".

232.Name: Solvheil: Barl Swamp Prefab
232.Author: Raith Veldrin
232.Description:
With the release of Sands of Solvheil I: The Ruins of Kazatharis Link, I've decided to release some of the more reusable areas as prefabs. Continue the adventure, or create your own. Perfect for DM run campaigns. These area prefabs are stripped of all module specific content and import as ready to use area erfs without additional baggage. Feel free to use these as you see fit.

But wait, you ask, how can I use these areas if I don't know anything about them? As an optional resource, you can find all relevant information (History, NPCs, etc) on the Solvheil Wiki:
Link

Of course, you can always rename them, reinvent them, and shuffle them around to suit your own custom adventure as well.

I hope you find these useful in your NWN gaming experience.

Barl Swamp:

The Barl Swamp was formed when the Imlan Sea spilled over the top of the Crenmantle Mountains during the destruction of Solvheil. Its stagnate waters contain both ruins of early settlements from Kazatharis, as well as dangerous manner of beasts not found in dryer lands. It is now fed from the Fen River that breaks off the Thynoth River in Dalreon.

Instructions:
Import ERF file into toolset and populate. The area is already baked to a delicious golden brown, so walkmesh is already in place.
 
Feel free to modify and/or use in your own campaign. 

Atlas/Wiki
Link

Other Solvheil Area Prefabs:

Rindleforde [River town]
Link

Kazatharis Ruins [Cliffside Ruins]
Link

Barl Swamp [Twisting Swamp]
Link

Evertide [City Docks]
Link

Link

Link

Link

Link

Of course, you can always rename them, reinvent them, and shuffle them around to suit your own custom adventure as well.

I hope you find these useful in your NWN gaming experience.

Kazatharis:

Kazatharis was once a thriving port town on the western edge of the Imlan Sea. Early pioneers from Solvheil built this fortress of a town into the Crenmantle Mountains directly above some old Dwarven Halls.

Before the massive flood that expelled the Imlan Sea, most residents escaped West to the area that would eventually become Dalreon. The tidal waters were held at bay by a collective effort of mages and bards combining spell and song to form a barrier. Though almost all were killed holding back the waves, their efforts secured the escape of humanity.

Instructions:
Import ERF file into toolset and populate. The area is already baked to a delicious golden brown, so walkmesh is already in place.
 
Feel free to modify and/or use in your own campaign.

234.Name: Solvheil: Rindleforde Prefab
234.Author: Raith Veldrin
234.Description:
With the release of Sands of Solvheil I: The Ruins of Kazatharis Link, I've decided to release some of the more reusable areas as prefabs. Continue the adventure, or create your own. Perfect for DM run campaigns. These area prefabs are stripped of all module specific content and import as ready to use area erfs without additional baggage. Feel free to use these as you see fit.

But wait, you ask, how can I use these areas if I don't know anything about them? As an optional resource, you can find all relevant information (History, NPCs, etc) on the Solvheil Wiki:
Link

Of course, you can always rename them, reinvent them, and shuffle them around to suit your own custom adventure as well.

I hope you find these useful in your NWN gaming experience.

Rindleforde:

Situated at the split of the Thynoth River, where the Fen River heads north toward the Barl Swamp, lies Rindleforde.This walled city is built around its impressive docks that serve as the end of Dalreon's waterway. Beyond this point on the Thynoth River lies the Great Forest and the kingdom of Lyritholln. Having been kept from developing any further into the forest by the elves, Rindleforde represents a sort of border between civilized land and the untamed wild.

Instructions: 
Import ERF file into toolset and populate. The area is already baked to a delicious golden brown, so walkmesh is already in place.
 
Feel free to modify and/or use in your own campaign.

235.Name: Realms of Ultima Prefabs - Moongates
235.Author: MokahTGS
235.Description:
Here is a simple system for Moongate travel for use in Ultima themed projects as well as anything else, because they are just that nifty. This system has been themed for Ultima with town names as destinations, but could easily be changed to use however you see fit.

This is a fully functional system for using blue moongates in a world. It extends the system created by Driller (Thank you very much for all your help!!) and includes additional scripts, a conversation, and all the items and placeables youï¿½ll need to set up a system in no time! Cut and paste, drag and drop.

The current version uses 8 moonstones of various colors to spawn a blue moongate that can take the player to 8 different locations. Locations are dependant on which of the 8 moonstones they currently have in their inventory.

This system assumes that you are using JasonNHï¿½s moongate VFX package, but you can use whatever effect you want for the moongate.

Future Plans:
The current system only uses the blue moongates, as in Ultima lore red, black and silver gates could only be opened with special items or special people. I intend to create an addition to this system with an Orb of the Moons object which will allow players to open red, white and possibly black gates.

For more information on moongates click here.

Thanks again to Driller, and JasonNH for all there help and commitment to excellence. The community is what it is because of people like you!

**Update Notes - Version 1.1**
1) Updated each moonstone to have a correct item description.
2) Added an .erf file for easy importing into modules.

Peeps/triggers, weather and sounds are all that you need to make the area personal.

244.Name: Pillars of Nosgoth Prefab/Legacy of Kain Items 1.0
244.Author: Geistertanz
244.Description:
Pillars of Nosgoth prefab/Legacy of Kain blueprints 1.1

Author: Geistertanz, a.k.a. Gidion The Crazy Kraut
Contact: GidionTheDead@aol.com

#####Description#####
Included in this archive are conversions of the weapons from the classic game
Legacy of Kain: Blood Omen, as well as a "Pillars of Nosgoth" prefab.

Feel free to use these blueprints in your modules as you see fit.

The new items are:
Iron Sword (longsword)
Iron Armor (plate mail, Damage Reduction Fire)
Mace (chance to stun enemies)
the Axes (2 battleaxes, hasted and keen)
Flame Sword (longsword, extra damage fire)
The Soul Reaver (greatsword, vampiric regeneration, cast slay living on hit)
Wraith Armor (plate mail, ethereal visage)
Vorador's Ring (summon vampire)
Heart of Darkness (similar to a "potion of heal")

#####updates#####
1.1changed a bad ResRef in the Soul Reaver .uti-file
("Slay Living" was changed to "Finger of Death")

#####Installation Notes#####
Simply place the .utc and .uti files into the NWN2 "override" directory and the
"The Pillars of Nosgoth.mod" into your "modules" folder (located in the <User
Files> directory of windows).

Start Neverwinter Nights and select "New Module". Now choose the "Pillars" module.
You will find the new items in a small chest and the coffin on the fasr side of
the area.

(Please make sure you have the right feats to equip the items.)

I also included "Kain", a 1st level human fighter, who already has all the items equiped.

#####Item Tags (for reference)#####
lok_ariel
lok_flame_sword
lok_heart_of_darkness
lok_iron_armor
lok_iron_sword
lok_mace
lok_soul_reaver
lok_the_axes_1
lok_the_axes_2
lok_voradors_ring
lok_wraith_armor

#####Future Releases#####
*Adding the Spells from the original Blood Omen game.
*Adding some of the creatures (demon, spitter, vampiress, thorn-plant)
*Adding a Nupraptor's Retreat/Avernus Cathedral/Dark Eden/Wasserbunde prefab (my favorite areas!)
*The Wraith Reaver!

#####Credits#####
Wizards of the Coast
...for at least one annual income spent on Dungeons & Dragons books.
Obsidian/BioWare
..for many long nights in front of the toolset, wondering what key-combination turned that Â§%&# chair again.

245.Name: Chondalwood - Druid Grove
245.Author: Bh
245.Description:
This area features part of a forest, a river, a lake, mountains and a druid grove. It represents a part of Chondalwood and in specific the region near a druid grove. Chondalwood was selected because it was the place where Silvanus appeared during the Time of Troubles.

 With the help of a friend, some lore was created to facilitate the existance of the druid grove, the Guardian and the Heart of Silvanus. Hopefully, there aren't any major inconsistencies with the general FR lore and the Time of Troubles. Not sure how good this attempt is, but it is what i had in mind when deciding to create such an area.

 Regarding performance, i apologise in advance for the heavy use of trees and vegetation, as it may cause problems. It is my belief that environmental shadows should be turned on for this area, as they heavily impact the feeling of the forest (as well as fps unfortunately).

 Some parts of the ground may seem a bit jaggy but i doubt they can be improved more, taking into consideration the variety of heights for the area and the absence of mesh refinement abilities from the toolset. 

 And an issue with the creatures: some of them (such as deers) have been placed outside the occlusion grid (buildable area) on decorative purposes. While they do show up in the toolset, they are not visible ingame. Perhaps it is a nwn2 engine issue, since placeables, npcs and creatures that can battle the player are displayed (ingame). The problem seems to be with creatures with a decorative purpose. 

 Two versions are availiable, one with haks and one without any haks. Be warned however that the second will seem more or less incomplete as almost all the effects (and i also think the overall feeling) of the area will be missing. 

Updated version with hak to proper pond/stream colour and removed flock of birds. Any suggestions are welcome, thank you.

 Version with haks/overrides:
1)Camb's creature FX/Camb's light FX: Link
2)Sorceress Ashura's VFX Pack: Link

!!Requires MotB!!

A few areas each containing a summoning/magic ritual site.

*Requires MotB*

248.Name: Faerun - Walk Map
248.Author: Semperphi
248.Description:
I didn't like the OC interface with the world map. So it got me thinking. If an interactive one could be made. Also to put into perspective how large Faerun actually is! There is almost 200 hrs worth of work and its unfinished. It is to scale to what the mesh would alow.

I am having a major problem with the river systems and the water. They don't show up. I didn't catch it untill late into making it. So I tried underpining the water with a colour. So at least you know that a river is there. I was hoping that the latest patch and the new MOTB would clear it up but NOT! So getting on the frustrated side I left it. Its been sitting on my HD for a while so I might as well share it with the community. Too bad really, It does look cool from the toolset.

Not much is there. Just water raised terrain.

If there is a Huge interest. I might finish what I can. But for now Its an "as is". Maybe someone over at Atari will take a look and fix up the watter issue (hint, hint) ;)

Enjoy

*2007/11/13
This is now a work in progress. As the water is now working. Keep checking back for updates.

*2007/01/14*
Somehow the map has been horribly corrupted. I though I had cut out enough to work ahead, But It keeps coming back. So I have resised it and posting it as final. Im guessing that the issue started when I first made it with an older version of the toolset. For me to fix it I will have to start from scratch. And I don't have the energy to do that.

So Enjoy use it any way you like. But I warn you!....ITS POSSESSED! lol

250.Description:
Wood cutters Camp ï¿½ the mod by Alen Swift, has a trading post where you can buy stuff ( some base items are in the shop) and a tanner you can trade some hides with and she will give you hide armor ( you can sell the armor or use it). There is also a trash wagon (trash barrel) for unwanted items or just to help cleaning your world. 


Scripts created by the Late Yoshiko Washima, The worlds will miss her. Thanks to her there are many awesome scripts she has made, I will attempt to share her works, as it would be a shame to let her works die too. RIP Yoshiko and thanks.

251.Name: B.B.'s  Malebolge
251.Author: B.B.
251.Description:
n Dante Alighieri's Inferno, part of The Divine Comedy, Malebolge is the eighth circle of Hell. Roughly translated from the Italian, Malebolge means "evil ditches". Malebolge is a large, funnel-shaped cavern, itself divided into ten concentric circular trenches or ditches. Each trench is called a bolgia (Italian for "pouch" or "ditch"). Long causeway bridges run from the outer circumference of Malebolge to its center, pictured as spokes on a wheel. At the center of Malebolge is the ninth and final circle of hell, Cocytus.

In Danteï¿½s version of hell, categories of sin are punished in different circles, with the depth of the circle (and placement within that circle) symbolic of the amount of punishment to be inflicted. Sinners placed in the upper circles of hell are given relatively minor punishments, while sinners in the depths of hell endure far greater torments. As the eighth of nine circles, Malebolge is one of the worst places in hell to be. In it, sinners guilty of "ordinary" fraud are punished. (That is, fraud that is committed without particularly malicious intent. Malicious or "compound" fraud ï¿½ fraud that goes against bond of love, blood or honor ï¿½ are punished in the ninth circle.) Sinners of this category include counterfeiters, hypocrites, sorcerers and simonists.

Dante and his guide, Virgil, make their way into Malebolge by riding on the back of the monster Geryon, the personification of fraud, who flies them down through the yawning chasm that separates the eighth circle from the seventh circle, where the violent are punished. Dante and Virgil plan on crossing Malebolge by way of the system of bridges, but find their path disturbed by many broken ledges and collapsed bridges that were destroyed during the Harrowing of Hell. They must then cross some of the bolgias on foot and even rely on demons to guide them. Eventually they make it to the inner ledge, where the Titan Antaeus lowers them down to Cocytus. -Wikipedia.
*******************************
City of Dis
*******************************

253.Author: SGK73

254.Name: Teper's Iron Hills Mine Prefabs
254.Author: Tepers or aadatepe
254.Description:
"I said miners not minors" 
Hi everybody and Happy Thanksgiving, I'm releasing my first attempt at interior building to complement the Iron Hills prefab. This is my take on the dwarven mines of the Iron Hills. I have built out four areas which begin with East mine lvls 1 - 3 and a connector tunnel leading from the west mine to the east mine lvl 3. I will continue to update this entry with a few more lvls which will include the western portion of the mines. You will need to download and install Skull Port hak before opening mod in toolset. Link to hak Link

I will be working on expanding the iron hills prefab, should have update in a few weeks.

**Update** Added Mod Version of Mines. 
Added East Mine LvL 4/The Pit and 
removed erf version of areas.
12/7 Added west Mine LvL 1, Cavern Passage and West Cavern for Iron Hills Mine.

1/02/08 Cleaned up walkmesh in areas, added ambient sounds. Added dwarven bath house and cavern of tranquility with crypt entrances ( dedicated to miners who have fallen during the building of the mines). Completed West Mine LvL 2. Some Minor design changes have been made due to walkmesh issues with tile sets. Have compiled all areas including ironhills in single mod. Also cleaned up load screens and area transitions. Also just a note South crypt is designed to be puzzle/maze area I'm sure a good scripter can make triggers to transport players to random spots in the area.

Credits:
My Thanks to dmguild for the excellent selections and compiling the hak and the many authors which have given the community great content as dmguild has listed.

I hope you will enjoy the mines and May the dwarf be with you.

255.Name: Woodland Trail
255.Author: Jezla9
255.Description:
A very small area I made for a mini-module I'm working on. It turned out so well, I decided to share it with the community now.

It's a simple forest trail with a cave entrance. It has sounds and weather (rain), all that is needed is to add an encounter if desired.

To install, just import the .erf file to your mod. You may modify the area as needed, just be sure to credit me as the original builder.

256.Name: Infernal Kingdom
256.Author: Chaos_Theocrat
256.Description:
Requires Nwn2, MotB, v1.10.1116

Within the Infernal Realm, bordered by a bleak river, is a place where mortal souls toil at the mercy of a demonic nobility that dwells in darkest luxury behind the walls of a mighty castle perched high atop an imposing cliff, and protected by a series of gates. On the other side of the region... a path leads down... to a half-hidden shrine housing a portal to even lower depths.
A massive volcano looms over streams of lava, and a columned temple of the Fallen commands a view of the entire landscape from atop it's unholy mount.

Special thanks to SGK73 for the Quarry prefab, which formed the foundation on which I built the Infernal Kingdom. :)

Update: I've fixed the cliffs around the temple and improved a bit of it's architecture while adding more sounds.

257.Name: Waldheim
257.Author: Dark
257.Description:
I designed this winter village some time ago, but i dont think i have any use for it anymore. So why not share it with you out there, maybe one of you can find a good use for it.

The area comes with a completed texturemap, walkmesh, walkmesh cutters, lightsources and has been tested for performance with up to 15 npcs. 

If you like it go ahead and vote. Maybe i can come up with some other stuff too if there are enough people interested ;)

Btw, "Waldheim" means "Foresthome".

258.Name: Gothic Home Interior
258.Author: Chaos_Theocrat
258.Description:
Requires Nwn v1.10.1116, plus MoTB

This is a house that has two floors and an attic, and is very exquisitely furnished in the rich Gothic Victorian style. Moonlight shines through the windows of the house, which is very well suited for use as a home for a noble, a scholar... or even a vampire.
There is also a cellar, which contains a semi-hidden shrine, to a nameless goddess; just for that small touch of strangeness. Everything is designed to give you the impression of an elegant old place filled with a great number of antiquities, curiosities, and works of art. Have a look around, using the demo module... or, import the Gothic Home into your own module world with the .erf file. This is my very first interior prefab for Nwn2, so I hope that everyone will like it. Cheers! :)

259.Name: Cliff Rocks
259.Author: Ho5a
259.Description:
A Width 24 Height - 16 forest and Cliff area. 

Created with Patch 1.06

260.Name: Abandoned Dark Fortress
260.Author: Corey Holcomb-Hockin
260.Description:
A area using the shadow fortress tileset. Its very dark. I built it around the idea that torches or light spells would be used.

I ran into some pathfinding trouble with combat and decided to redesign the area for my module. This version will probably work fine as long as you don't place fights close to stairs.

Its fairly empty because it doesn't include the scripted encounters from my module.

261.Name: Copy Paste City
261.Author: SGK73
261.Description:
First I want to make one thing absolutely clear, this is *NOT* an area that is usable as-is.

The intention is that the module builder or area prefab builder(I hope to see area pefabs based on this) uses this as a template or clipart to futher refine.
There are no small placeables like barrels, crates and so on(except a few crates I used to plug gaps between buildings) as the area is probably to the limit of what the toolset can handle(see Known Issues).

The textureing is fairly simple, there is a reason for this, it is easier to add minute details then there is to remove them.
So use the available textureing as a base and add more gradients and smaller detail as needed.
Another reason for this is that it should be easy to swap existing textures with a different set to create a whole new area style, check the examples files for this.

There are also no sounds, trees, water or FX as these are also setting dependent.

The walkmesh should be set to all walkable polys after copying unless you want to finetune some of the slopes.
I have cut out all of the buildings with walkmeshcutters as they're mostly environmental objects except for a few that needed stairs.


Known issues:

There might be trouble opening the area, I had the toolset crash on me or throw an "Index Out Of Bounds" error when opening the area in the toolset, not importing it.
I'm guessing it got to do with the amount of placeables or some kind of resource allocation error.
If this happens *reboot* your computer, not just restart the toolset, this worked for me.
Also it takes a while to open the area even when it works so give it some time:)

The camera goes through most buildings, this is because I had to convert most buildings to environmental objects or the bake routine would most likely have left an unwalkable mess.

The edge areas might be a bit "wierd" as I had originaly planned for adjacent areas to continue out from this one.

The area is named "terrain" seems wierdness(breaks the placeables list) happes if this is changed.

Probably alot of things I forgot:)

Dependencies:

TerraCoppa which can be found here: Link


I'm looking forward to see the area prefabs people make from this.

If there are trouble opening the area please say so and I will split the buildings over two or more maps and post that.

Also this is the last area I will make for some time as I have joined a PW project to make some areas.
I hope you have enjoyed the areas I have made and found them useful.

262.Description:

A small temple

263.Author: Daelos
263.Description:
This is desert rare with grass fou you mods and persistent worlds.

Link

264.Name: Stable
264.Author: Rylock
264.Description:
Needed a stable for my current module and noticed that there wasn't a pre-fab for it -- so I've uploaded the ERF for it here. The stable could very easily be turned into a regular barn with minimal difficulty. The way it's set up right now, there's a place for the stablehand to sleep in the loft -- along with a couple of containers there for personal items.

Use as you like. Be kind with comments -- this is my first shot at putting together an interior. Any constructive criticism is, of course, very welcome.

265.Name: Realms of Ultima Prefab Starter Module
265.Author: MokahTGS
265.Description:
What is it?
This is a utility module for starting a Realms of Ultima Prefab.

Simply download this module and save it as a new project. This module has all the 3C placeable blueprints as well as NESS for NWN2 installed. It also has the RoU Moongate System installed.

What is Realms of Ultima?
Realms of Ultima is not just one module. It's designed to be many module prefabs that can be combined together to make new story modules, PWs, multiplayer DMd modules or whatever people would wish to create, all with an Ultima theme.

Each module made with the RoU banner will have these content packs in common, giving builders a common thread and consistency throughout.

***** Required Hak Pack Files *****
Realms of Ultima Content Packs
Community Content Compilation (3C)
3C - Armor in Progress Compilation

266.Name: Sillverymoon - Moorgate
266.Author: IPalindromeI
266.Description:
This is the moorgate district of silverymoon. I tried to capture the feel of city based on the canonical artwork. I've also added the village of Underhome - a small dwarven enclave just below the city.

This prefab was made using nytir's 'Building Construction Kit (BCK2.1)'; It is required for the mod. I also strongly recommend using tupoun's version of the 'Castle RESKIN texture pack'. The retexturing is strictly optional, but the city walls will tend to clash using the default texture.

267.Name: Shanatar Ruins
267.Author: naz6
267.Description:
This is the exterior of a great ruined fortress, once a part of High Shanatar but now forlorn and monster infested. These ruins are stair stepped, but the only way to reach the top is to go through caves crawling with evil! This is only the exterior, the interiors are left out so that you can fill them content appropriate to your module. The Ruins include defensible positions that are designed to make it tough for players to reach the top. Again, these ruins lack interiors and sounds, there are placeables and grass and everything else needed to make the area look forboding. 

This is the sixth area that I have submitted, and as always, any and all feedback and votes are welcomed. If you like this area, check out some of my others, and Thank You for taking a look.

268.Name: Peasant Interiors
268.Author: Rylock
268.Description:
Some examples of peasant home interiors, all of them using Brendan Ellis's SLS:Scripted Lighting System (found at Link so that light shines through the windows during the day and the fireplaces and candles and such are only lit at night (and then are off late at night when everyone should be asleep). All of these homes have one entrance and are intended to be used with the various city building placeables.

* Peasant Home 1: a two-story interior intended for a single fisherman or childless couple.
* Peasant Home 2: a two-story interior intended for a family.
* Peasant Home 3: a one-story interior intended for a single antiques dealer or childless couple.
* Peasant Home 4: a one-story interior intended for a family.
* Peasant Home 5: a variant of #4, just intended to be much more delapidated-looking.

...feel free to use and/or alter as you see fit. I needed some simple interiors like this for the module I'm working on and noticed that there was nothing really suitable in the Vault, so maybe these will benefit someone else.

269.Name: Elven Temple Courtyard
269.Author: Seraphimsage
269.Description:
A one area exterior (12x12) of a tranquil courtyard outside a elven temple, complete with a fountain decorated with statues of the Seldarine, or the highest ranking gods/goddesses of the Forgotten Realm setting, Elven Parthenon. There is also some fauna both wildlife and one domestic wandering around between Waypoints. Your free to use this area anyway to wish.

Updated(1/19)
Smoothed Terrain and fixed the benches.



To install: 

Simply place the file into the modules folder, which should be located in:
C:/Documents and Settings/Owner/My Documents/Neverwinter Nights 2/modules

Then just start the game, new modules, pick or make your character and enjoy!

270.Name: Sea Reach

270.Description:
A large sea-town area,built on the idea that it was to become the hub of a multiplayer server.

(It includes sittable benches with Razare's on_sit script,and door_close script provided by ot_wise.)

I will upload 3 more external areas(seareach north,south and old burial grounds),to complete the Sea Reach package over the next couple of days.
These extra areas complete the exterior of the town giving you an almost 270 degree view.
(.erf)

These extra areas(seareach-north,south and old burial grounds.) complete the exterior of the town giving you an almost 270 degree view.

These extra areas(seareach-north,south and old burial grounds.) complete the exterior of the town giving you an almost 270 degree view.

There is a couple of crypts for you to hook up your tiles to,and the burial grounds themselves arent too shabby for running around in circles screaming either.

These extra areas(seareach-north,south and old burial grounds.) complete the exterior of the town giving you an almost 270 degree view.

274.Author: Handall
274.Description: Little village with low wall and inner keep in a little hill. The town is divided in several zone: milirary, rich, merchant, rural. The center of the town is focused in merchant and religious zone.

What else? Only ... like ever sorry for my english.

276.Name: ForestPrefab XXL (Part_B)
276.Author: Registerdebakel
276.Description:
A 32x32 forest area (Part_B). 

Created with MOTB Toolset Patch 1.11. 
This is the 2nd part and the neighbour of "Forest Prefab XXL (PART_A)".

Check out the screenshots for some first impressions. 

Have a walk and enjoy :) 

Registerdebakel/Adrieann/RPG-Jack 



**** NEED YOUR HELP IMPORTANT ****

Unfortunatly this map is NOT 100% finished. Toolset causes crashes every time i used the walkmesh brush and attempted to save. I tried everything and after a long time of hard work i am realy losing my patience regarding Toolset-crashes.

So what's missing/needs fix:

1.Everything that is supposed to be not walkable (trees, cliffs, rocks) is walkable. As i mentioned its currently out of my influence (100% chance of TS-crash) to fix that.

2. At the cave of the waterfall's origin are two fallen trees. They are suposed to work as bridges to allow players crossing the water. I was not able to place walkmeshhelpers correctly. 

3. Delete the blackcolored bookstand in that cave and replace it with an (disbled) cavedoor, that are used in general with these caves.


I hope somebody can contact me for an fixed version or just upload it on the vault.

Thank you for reading :)

278.Name: Fortified Town: Cardith
278.Author: Newtons.Bit
278.Description:
This is a town I was working on for an unnamed module, but I never had the time to do any serious work on the module itself. The town is devoid of any creatures but well populated with placeables and buildings.

The zip file contains a module with just this area. If you wish to use this town in an existing module, you will need to export the area.

279.Name: Realms of Ultima Prefabs - New Magincia
279.Author: MokahTGS
279.Description:
What is it?
This is a 32x32 prefab island village of New Magincia created for the Realms of Ultima Prefab Project.

New Magincia Lore
Realms of Ultima uses a storyline based 300 years after the events of Ultima 9 and the ascension of the Avatar. Here is the cityï¿½s description in the RoU travelersï¿½ guide:

After the destruction of the sunken city of Ambrosia the gargoyle race lie almost in ruin. The few survivors brought the queen egg, given to them by the Avatar to the deserted remains of New Magincia. It is here that they have rebuilt their shattered lives. Seeking to erase the mistakes of the past, the Gargoyles sought to rebuild the town and dedicate their new life to the virtue of Humility. They now live out their days in peaceful simplicity as the caretakers of that shrine.

You can learn all about the cityï¿½s history at the Ultima Wiki.

****************************************
Version Information
Initial Release (v1e) ï¿½ This includes the full exterior 32x32 isles of New Magincia, with docks, small rural village, cave entrances, moongate ring, and a small shrine.
Future Release (v2) ï¿½ All building interiors, small cave system, and final polish.

This module is built originally from the Realms of Ultima Prefab Starter Module and has all the 3C placeable blueprints as well as NESS for NWN2 installed. It also has the RoU Moongate System installed so have moonstone, will travel.

What is Realms of Ultima?
Realms of Ultima is not just one module. It's designed to be many module prefabs that can be combined together to make new story modules, PWs, multiplayer DMd modules or whatever people would wish to create, all with an Ultima theme.

Each module made with the RoU banner will have these content packs in common, giving builders a common thread and consistency throughout.
****************************************

***** Required Hak Pack Files *****
Realms of Ultima Content Packs
Community Content Compilation (3C)
3C - Armor in Progress Compilation

280.Name: UO Serpent's Hold
280.Author: Chaos_Theocrat
280.Description:
Requirements: Nwn2 v1.0.1153.0 and MoTB

Constructed on the largest island just to the east, and south, of the Cape of Heroes: the Isle of Deeds... Serpent's Hold is the training ground for nearly all the realm of Britannia's knights.
Serpent's Hold is, mostly... a single, compound structure, with an internal castle to house the Lord and Captains, the instructors, meetings halls, and the mess hall. Outside of that, but still within the keep's walls, are the barracks, the smithy, the stables, and the training grounds. Serpent's Hold is less a city more than it is a great stronghold. Although the keep has been there for some time... very few newer buildings have sprung up around it.
Serpent's Hold stands, as a building symbolizing the principle of Courage, and it's mighty walls strengthen the courage of it's fighters, and allies, while putting fear into the hearts of the enemies of the keep. The Order of the Silver Serpent has total command over the fortress, and adventurers of every kind are welcome to test their martial skills in a sparring match.
The fighters of Serpent's Hold are the best in all of Britannia, and will oft train many recruits in their ways of fighting and war. Also, the very best weapons and armours are produced at Serpent's Hold. Serpent's Hold is also known to house the Eternal Flame of Courage and the Bell of Courage, two items of highly symbolical value. As long as Serpent's Hold stands strong, Britannia will yet defend itself from every kind of threat. This variant of Serpent's Hold is from Ultima Online.

Note: It was necessary to take several liberties in order to create a more realistic and convincing 3D version of UO's Serpent's Hold for Nwn2. I made the terrain more mountainous, and I also emphasised the tropical climate of southern Britannia. I lastly added some unique touches, like fountains, statues, an orchard, etc. to present more diversity as well. What you'll find, is an interesting prefab useful for those working on Ultima projects, or any module that needs a good island castle. Feel free to use as desired and change anything you like. Just do not forget to mention me, if you end up using this in your mod, or world. ;)

Contains a module so you can explore Serpent's Hold at your leisure, and an .erf for importing it into your own module. Also included, are two UO maps of Serpent's Hold, so you can see what it looks like in UO, compared to my version for Nwn2. That said... enjoy!

281.Name: Some mine
281.Author: NeVerSun
281.Description:
I made this mine a few month ago and just added some MotB-Content.
I would be very nice, if you VOTE (even bad or good) to show me, how "hard" you vote ;)

~Sry for bad english.

282.Name: Undead catacombs
282.Author: NeVerSun
282.Description:
A small area (10x10 - not all spaces used) with a "dark face".


There are 2 versions:
~ One without any undead monsters (in encounters)

~ And another with 3 undeads for lvl 8-10 character

283.Name: Tepers Marshland Prefab Area
283.Author: Teper's or aadatepe
283.Description:
Hi everybody, releasing my next prefab called Marshlands (AKA Swan Fleet based of Tolkien's Middle Earth ).I wanted
a little break from building iron hills and mine area and started working with height
maps. I was able to creat some cool heigh maps and with the help of yatts was able to bring my creation to life.
I have been working on this area for about 2 months on and off finally got it finished. 
You can change whatever you want on the area, I hope everybody will enjoy it as I enjoyed making it.

284.Name: Ship Interiors
284.Author: Briesence
284.Description:
I was experimenting with creating wooden walls using placeables and I think the results turned out well enough to share. 

The .erf contains four small interior areas:

Captain's Cabin
Fishermen's Cabin
Ship Cargo Hold - with cargo
Ship Cargo Hold - empty

I didn't experience any problems with the camera getting stuck. However, occasionally I got a face full of books if I maneuvered the camera just right in the Captain's Cabin.

285.Name: Teper's Blessed Realm Prefab Area
285.Author: Teper's or aadatepe
285.Description:
Hi everybody, releasing my next prefab called Blessed Realm (AKA Heavens Gate ).I think every
mod needs a blessed realm to respawn players. I got the idea from the ToR server and thought now with
nwn2 should have some fun with the walkmesh tools to create some cool areas, so I put this little
mod together with the hopes that the community will enjoy it. 

You can change whatever you want on the area, I hope everybody will enjoy it as I enjoyed making it.
You will need to unzip the package using winrar if you don't have it you can download from "www.rarlab.com" its free. 
Inside the folder called Teper's Blessed Realm Area Prefab you 
will find the following files and folders they are as follows: 

1. Readme.txt
2. Blessed Realm.erf
3. Override Folder

Screen shots on the vault.






Credits: I have used the following Authors VFX Pack in creating this prefab they are as follows:

 1. Sorceress Ashuras VFX Pack Version 5.0 - Thanks very much, some cool visual effects. 
 2. Bioware for NWN2 and MOTB.

Note: Made changes to cloud effects and ror_soullights. I wanted a little movement in the clouds so they flowed in
 different directions, also I wanted different size clouds with movement in them. Heavens Gate vfx is
 modified motb ashenwood effect and heavens gate vfx is something I created from existing NWN2 effects. 

Install Directions:

1. If you have an empty override folder then you can copy the data folder inside (override) to 
 "C:\Documents and Settings\Tepers\My Documents\Neverwinter Nights 2\override"

2. For people who have stuff in there override folders I hope you organized it based off NWN2 Data Folder. 
 I have which makes keeping all your override stuff organized and easy. So in my override folder I keep 
 a folder called DATA and underneath Data I have seperate folders called 2DA, walkmesh, NWN2FX and so on....
 underneath my NWN2FX folder I have it broken down just like the files in the data folder that are winzipped.
 So I have FX_Ambient, FX_Battle, and so on ..... for P's that organize like me all you need to do is copy the Ambient vfx files 
 to "C:\Documents and Settings\Tepers\My Documents\Neverwinter Nights 2\override\Data\NWN2_VFX\FX_Ambient" and your
 good to go. 
 

 P.S. Sorry for the long install instructions.

286.Name: Tepers Hell Prefab Area
286.Author: Teper's or aadatepe
286.Description: Hi everybody, releasing another prefab area called hell, I took a different approach with this area as you will see. Included is the erf version of mod which you will need to import. I hope everbody will enjoy the prefab as I have enjoyed making it.

287.Name: Teper's Void Prefab Area
287.Author: Tepers or aadatepe
287.Description: Hi everybody, I made this area a while back and decided to release it so to compliment heaven and hell. Since the area is small it is in mod format.I hope everybody will enjoy the area as I enjoyed making it.

288.Name: Teper's Frozen Hell Area Prefab
288.Author: Teper's or aadatepe
288.Description:
Hi everybody, releasing my next prefab called Frozen Hell which not only complements previous realms, but makes a good 
place for neural aligned toons to respawn back. 

You can change whatever you want on the area, I hope everybody will enjoy it as I enjoyed making it.

will find the following files and folders they are as follows:

3. Override Folder which includes vfx pack.

Screen shots on the vault.

(Note: The Soul Ball VFX do not seem to show up in game, but Iam still releasing them in the hopes

List of Obsidian Standard TGA's used in effects

2. fx_KOS_Burst3.tga

4. fx_4_point_star_2.tga
5. fx_waterfall.tga
6. fx_fireball_explosion3.dds
7. fx_fog_layer.tga


Credits: I have used the following Authors VFX Pack in creating this prefab they are as follows:

 1. Bioware for NWN2 and MOTB. 
 


Install Directions:

1. If you have an empty override folder then you can copy the data folder inside (override) to 
 "C:\Documents and Settings\Tepers\My Documents\Neverwinter Nights 2\override"

2. For people who have stuff in there override folders I hope you organized it based off NWN2 Data Folder. 
 I have which makes keeping all your override stuff organized and easy. So in my override folder I keep 
 a folder called DATA and underneath Data I have seperate folders called 2DA, walkmesh, NWN2FX and so on....
 underneath my NWN2FX folder I have it broken down just like the files in the data folder that are winzipped.
 So I have FX_Ambient, FX_Battle, and so on ..... for P's that organize like me all you need to do is copy the Ambient vfx files 
 to "C:\Documents and Settings\Tepers\My Documents\Neverwinter Nights 2\override\Data\NWN2_VFX\FX_Ambient" and your
 good to go. 
 

 P.S. Sorry for the long install instructions.

289.Name: Forest Chasms
289.Author: cepapoe
289.Description:
Starting a Ranger's post, trails lead into the nearby chasms and ravines. Some have scenic views while others lead through the mountains or into caves.
**********************
This is my first area so constructive criticisms is expected. This is only one area, so the caves lead nowhere for now anyway. No haks required. There are no encounters either.
I got the idea after the server I played on removed a forest area, and kind of inspired me to make one.
***********
I updated it (Forest Chasms v2) cleaning the walkmeshes and making a lot of changes in general. Feedback and votes are always welcome of course.

290.Name: Tank's Prefab World
290.Author: Tank6ge
290.Description:
As there has been some question (I'm not sure why) this is not a single player module that you play through. 

This is a prefab module (for builders)for those who don't have the time to put together the base of your module. Add your own stories, use parts of it. It is meant to be for a large multiplayer module. 
Hopefully, it will be the start someone needs to create some buzz in the NWN2 world with their module.


*Updated high-res photos with desc. at bottom as of now

**More pictures of what I have done can be found here: Link

***Much of that site is outdated and the areas that you download here may be a little more finished - either way it will be a good resource to see exactly what is in these files.

This was started to be a sequel to the Path of Ascension. As time went on, I realized my ultimate goal would not be achievable by myself. The idea to throw this module up on the vault has been in my head for many months now, and after joining various teams, trying to modify it, etc... I just never found anyone with the work ethic to help to finish it.

 This was made to be a level 10-20 hack/slash persistent world. It even Beta tested for quite a while but I couldn't get the scripters I needed for the final result I desired. Also, after having my second child time is not something I have much of anymore. 

In this mod you will find many unique creatures and 37 unique areas (I have added an additional 6 below here). In my opinion they are all very well-done. Transitions have all been placed, many triggers and creatures have been placed, convo scripts, stores, you name it it is here. Hopefully, this is exactly what someone has been looking for. You can modify it how you want, rip it apart, it's all fine with me.(Yes you can even change the name) 

As of now I have the low, medium, rare, unique treasure system in place with a lot of unique items - again this is all set for something that I was trying to balance, but it all can be easily changed. Yes, this module was nearly complete, but I just don't have the time to finish it. After at least 300 hours into this thing I just realized I needed a change.

Here's an additional challenge for people. If you modify it and make it work, and want to make this into a top-notch multiplayer module, I will join your team to help finish it. 
I think Ideally I would move the levels back to 3-20 and start from there. Creatures would have to be rebalanced, but there is a lot to build on.


Please let me know if you have been able to use my work. I'd love to see feedback on it all. 

PS Not every area there has pictures to the right, but I've covered most of the bases and you can find every area at the link above. 


***Updated to include map overlay of the 37 areas in the EW_POHA_BETA file

291.Name: New Orc City
291.Author: Roland
291.Description:
This is an area that contains a castle keep that will be held by an Orc Tribe in one of my modules. There are currently no encounters.

Use as you like. I do not need credit.

292.Name: Rough and Ready Frontier Outpost
292.Author: Roland
292.Description: This is a small frontier settlement where only the brave, the bold or the desperate choose to live.

293.Name: The Riverport Inn - WIP
293.Author: powerboy
293.Description:
The Riverport Inn is located on a small tributary of a well traveled river. It has grown to become a place of respite for overland and river travelers.

The Inn is inspired 0one Games Riverside Inn Product.

This includes the Inn exterior and interior (3 Levels) and a small shop space and warehouse. There are no NPCs present, so you will have to add them as needed.

This does use the FRW Persistent Companion system, so you will need that HAK as well. It is conveniently located here on the vault.

This is a Work in Progress. Please let me know of any changes that could be made to make it more useful to the community.

294.Name: Lichking's city prefabs
294.Author: Lichking
294.Description:
Two area prefabs for city exported from the module I am currently working on.

Note that I left a small patch of terrain hidden in the bridge of the western bank area to set an area transition on it.

I hope that you will enjoy them :-).

296.Name: Assault on an Orcish Stronghold
296.Author: Roland
296.Description:
This prefab is submitted in modular for and is actually playable. It includes a Desert Exterior with a stronghold surrounded by a deep moat with a walkable bridge crossing it.

If you decide to play it you probably will have most success using a fighter. Five companions are included for the assault and probable will be needed. There also will be help from the kings troops who will join you in the attack.

With anything higher than a 2nd level fighter there will likely be little challenge to this module. 

This is not a final version, nor is it a complete module. If you like the idea you are welcome to use it in anyway you see fit. I may use it in a future module myself as well.

Please make comments and suggestions on how this might be improved. All constructive criticism is welcome.

When you have breached the outer walls you can enter the small castle which has a main floor and an upstairs area. I am thinking about adding a dungeon when I update if people like what has been done so far.

This battle is winnable by a first level fighter if strategy is employed and judicious retreats are utilized.

297.Name: Water Baron's Castle
297.Author: Chaos_Theocrat
297.Description:
Requirements:
Nwn2 v1.0.1153.0 and MoTB
Required Hak Pak:
Chaos Placeables v1.6 for Nwn2

A well-worn road leads down through a desolate landscape, amidst the slopes and crags of mighty mountains. The old road ends at the very base of a great fortress that towers over all of it's surrounding lands, a work of ancient artisans who toiled in a distant age.
Steps lead up the cliffside, towards the keep that lies behind the fortress walls. Once... this place was the home of a powerful water baron, upon whom the local peasantry depended in times of drought. But, according to legend, he had taxed the thirsty peasants so greatly that one year they rose up in rebellion. The baron has not been seen since and the ruins of what was once a thriving community are now only a mute testament to whatever dire powers were unleashed in that long-ago struggle.
Only one farm remains where once there were many... but someone, or perhaps something, still seems to be residing in the water baron's ancient fortress, where lights are always seen at night.

This is a grand place for adventurers to explore and evil creatures to haunt!

Link to Chaos Placeables v1.6 for Nwn2:
Link

298.Name: Mountain Approach
298.Author: MammothTruk
298.Description:
REQUIRES:
MwMDragons Weapon Pack v1

This is a mountain slope that leads up to a School of Summoning magic. Its kind of basic at the moment with me altering the background a little each day to be more immersing.

updated to 1.1
-added 3 basement levels
-revised tree placement and seeds
-added dream walker city
-revised building on summit

slated
-removing creatures from level 2-3 of the basement
-add 17 more basement levels
-finish upper floor 1
-add 19 more upper levels

updated
-added some new features to the approach area
-started working on upper level 1 and toying new ideas on how things will work
-removed emenies from basement areas

299.Name: Black Wolf Forest
299.Author: Azenn
299.Description:
This is an area that I just finished making for my upcoming mod that takes place in Icewind Dale. It's basically a nice little forest, far removed from civilization at the current time. The giant tree may be familiar to those who've played the Black Isle series. ;)

I had just finished designing the area (no creatures or encounters) when I noticed the Obsidian contest forum post, so it was really easy for me to simply submit. I hope you all like it. If you have any feedback or questions, please post here and I'll check for it.

I would especially appreciate it if anyone could tell me if they experience any lag in the area. I myself have a mediocre computer, so I try to cut back on the grass if there's a lot of trees. If there's no problems, though, I may add a bit more to my other, earlier areas in my mod.

No haks or custom content is necessary.


Thanks,

Azenn

301.Name: Harbor of Sands
301.Author: Shinad
301.Description:
Module contains three areas:

- Harbor of Sands - A town situated on a crag being a gateway between a warm, unnamed sea, and a deadly, uncharted desert. The first and only resting point for travelers venturing into the sands.

- Skyship - Flying ship slowly traveling in the clouds above seas and lands.

- Astral Castle - A castle hanged in the endless void enveloped in glare.
(This area is a part of the Official Polish Server - Aeris.)

NOTE: Module uses Heed's walkable ships hak for static ship model of the skyship, but the area can by used with standard ship model (walkmesh is independent from it)

304.Name: Wayne's Showcase
304.Author: Markus "Wayne" Schlegel
304.Description:
This portfolio module contains three independent areas:

-----------------------------------------
 AREA 1: New Phlan - Walled Settlement at 1340 D.R. 
-----------------------------------------

This area was taken from my award winning campaign Pool of Radiance Remastered. I tried to stick to the sources as close as possible and this is the result. This is only one of several interlinked areas of Phlan. You can see some landmarks of the adjoining areas in the outer parts of the area. The walled settlement is being reconstructed and so it will change
over time when the story of PORR unfolds. 

For more details on the area design of all Phlan and the mentioned changes of Phlan during the
course of PORR see the PORR project at

http://nwvault.ign.com/View.php?view=NWN2ModulesEnglish.Detail&id=63

or the screenshots 

http://www.schlegels.de


-----------------------------------------
 AREA 2: Shadowdale 1356 D.R. before the Time of Troubles 
-----------------------------------------
 
Shadowdale, one of the most famous places of the Forgotten Realms. Many adventures are connected to this small hamlett somewhere deep in the vast forest of Cormanthor. Again, I took some source material of the Forgotten Realms Atlas and gave my best to convert the drawings found there as literate as possible. This area is not used in any of my works so far.

-----------------------------------------
 AREA 3: Svirfneblin Mine - Central Hall
-----------------------------------------

Although underground, this area uses the NWN2 engine for exterior areas. This area also needs Botumys drow cave placeables to work properly. (Thank you Botumys for your great underdark placeables) Some people who know my prior works will recognize this area - it is the main cavern of a large svirfneblin complex you are forced to infiltrate in chapter 2 of my A Hunt through the Dark series. The svirfneblin dug deep into the cavern and the huge stalagmite in the middle and made this place their home for decades. 

Check out my upcoming new project A Hunt through the Dark Remastered to learn more about this place. 

http://www.schlegels.de


------------------------------------------------------

 OBSIDIAN AREA CONTEST CONTRIBUTION V.1.0 March 16th, 2008
 
------------------------------------------------------

305.Name: The City of Cresentine
305.Author: ticladesign
305.Description:
The City of Cresentine

For the Obsidian Area Contest I present the City of Cresentine, an elaborate cosmopolitan city with a harbor and dozens of buildings of many types. 

This multi-level city is complete with a variety of locals could make an excellent central city for any module or persistant world. 

The module contains two areas:

- Cresentine City
- Eclipse traders Interiours

NOTE: You may need a rogue character to access the entire Eclipse interiours area.

Right now The City of Cresentine is part of the World of Talernon RP Persistant World, and has been well received since it first appeared. 
Check out more of my work at Link

I am anxious to know how this area is received by the rest of the NWN2 community and the Obsidian Area Contest, so I have decided to post it here on the Vault.

-Ticladesign.

Update: Made an oopsie, there were supposed to be one or three exteriours, so added two additional exteriours I made, and took the interiour out. The module is named differently, so anyone having the old version can still have the Eclipse Interiours.

New Areas:

- Dark Forest
- Drylands

306.Name: South Bridge Graveyard
306.Author: Ariella
306.Description:
The folk of South Bridge, in the Mere of Dead Men, created this place to inter their loved ones, but after the Second War of the King of Shadows the graveyard stood abandoned...

This is part of my first attempt at modding and is an abandoned graveyard in a swamp.

307.Name: Realm of the Fey Princes
307.Author: Wyrin
307.Description:
Below are four areas, but all based on one core area design template - a walkway through the tree tops. I've had the idea for these areas for a while, but not really had a need for them in my work, but thought I'd spend a day knocking them up to see what they look like.

Realm of the Fey Princes
========================

Each of the three fey princes has a castle in the midst of the giant trees. Travel across the walkways to find them.

I've intentionally left much of the area on the walkways empty for others to populate depending on their needs - e.g. the Crossroads would also make a good fey bazaar area, with merchants around the central trunk

Hope they can be a good starting point for someone

308.Name: Tombwatch Pass, Winter Farm, Tourney Field
308.Author: SGK73
308.Description:
Area 1:
Tombwatch Pass. A watchpost observing an ancient tomb for signs of undead.

Area 2:
Winter Farm. A small area of a farm set in a forested area. This area contains "deepsnow" the walkmesh and the visual terrain mesh differs.

Area 3:
Tourney Field. A jousting and grand melee area(coconuts not included). This is not a new area, included it because of lack of time to do an area from scratch.

**Update: For those that can't use 7z I've added area 1 and 2 to separate files. Winzip and Winrar will be able to handle these as the archive isn't split. The tourney field area can be found here:http://nwvault.ign.com/View.php?view=NWN2PrefabAreas.Detail&id=252

309.Name: BCKII Extra Demo - Ruins
309.Author: Nytir
309.Description:

Three areas of the Yamato Island

Path of Philosophy : One of the safe commercial routes of the Yamato Empire. Caravans are usually seen in this pacific path full of sakura trees.

Kurokuma Pass : A good place for a hunter's area. Wild animals can live here.

311.Name: Surague Escarpment
311.Author: Anduraga
311.Description:
Note: Included are two DayNightSetting files. By default, the module has a non-bloom enhanced version. If you would like like to view the Bloom version, import the SuragueBloom file into the area before playing. 

If the toolset crashes on load, try again. Toolset isn't very friendly with rather large areas, but the game plays just fine. 

-----------

This area is modeled after the information given by the Unapproachable East handbook, combined with a few extra touches from myself. The Surague Escarpment is one of many areas that youï¿½ll be able to visit in Thayvian Nights: a module I have been working on for the past few months. The area takes into consideration that Thay is a relatively dry land, so the western border is relatively bare of grass and trees.

A few things that Iï¿½ve added was the natural hot springs that form along the base of the Surague, where a dormant volcano has remained relatively inactive over the past few years. This concept was borrowed from the Yellowstone National Park and Old Faithful. 

The screenshots to your right only feature a few sample spots of interests, but there are plenty more to be had in this area. The area is fairly large, so it would be impossible to capture every scene of interest.

----------------------------------------- 
Surague Escarpment 
----------------------------------------- 

At the eastern edge of Thay, amid the foothills of the Sunrise Mountains, rises the third of Thayï¿½s major cliffs - the Surague Escarpment. The Surague forms a shelf atop the First Escarpment, averaging about 6,000ft (183m) in elevation. Numerous streams spill down from the heights of the Sunrise Mountains, creating a tangled maze of gorges and canyonlands in this corner of the country. (Unapproachable East, p150).

The Sunrise Mountains, which many consider to mark the eastern end of Faerun, run all the way from the center of Rashemen to just past the south-eastern border of Thay. It forms the entirety of Thay's eastern border, towering just below 15,000ft above sea level. The mountains are teeming with dangerous animals and hostile humanoids. From time to time, scouts from the goblin and kobold tribes living here forage into Thay.

Every now again, the tharchions of Thay send an expedition into the peaks of the mountains for those sturdy and adventurous enough to take on the task. The Sunrise Mountains are said to be virtually impassable on foot, but those who know their way about the mountain can scale the cliffsides or find another path that other inhabitants of the mountains have made. Old Raumviran towers and strongholds lie buried beneath the snow of the high slopes, as well as ancient well-like fortresses of some even older people forgotten by time. Rumors have it of a hidden passage leading through the mountains into the Endless Wastes beyond, but no such cavern has been found to this date. The caverns beneath the Sunrise Mountains are filled with horrible creatures, including nagas, chimeras, and things unspeakably worse.

----------------------------------------- 
Area Statistics 
-----------------------------------------
ORL = Over-Recommended Limit
Area Size: 24x32
Amount of space useable: Roughly 50-60% without further modifications.
Time Taken to Complete Area: 7 days
Area Entranceï¿½s/Exits: A path leading to the Rauthammar Plateau at the south-west corner; 3 cavern entrances towards the eastern side; a farmhouse to the north; and a path leading to the Sunrise Mountains area (not included) towards the central east region.
Layout Design: Linear (one exterior entrance and exit each). 
Trees Used: AspenC, Boxwood, Frond Shrub C, London Plane, Spruce, Umbrella Thorn (6 - +1 ORL).
Seeds: 176718, 874459, 497721, 481259, 486299 (5 - +1 ORL)
Textures: 
Dirt_13 (main dirt ï¿½ base texture), 
Rocky_05 (main pathway), 
Cliff_08 (For rocky cliffsides), 
Grass_14 (main grass texture), 
Dirt_15 (muddier texture ï¿½ compliment to Dirt_13), 
Mud_01 (used as the base for the waterfalls and to give the mountain a dirtier look), 
Snow_01 (Escarpment peaks), 
Snow_03 (Texture blender for the snow ï¿½ also used to make the textures appear greyer from the cold)

PS: Escarpment is a precipitous cliff.

312.Name: Forgotten Ziggurat
312.Author: Wyrin
312.Description:
This is an area I've had in mind for a long time, but isn't going to be needed until chapter 4 of my current series Dark Avenger, but I thought it was a nice idea to throw into the contest and make available to others.

The forgotten Ziggurat once stood in a lush jungle, that over the years has given way to swamp. Once an elegant temple to an ancient deity, it has now fallen into ruin, and new inhabitants call it home.


For ease of use by all builders, I've not included custom content such as the walkmesh ramp, which can be found elsewhere (http://nwvault.ign.com/View.php?view=NWN2HakpaksOriginal.Detail&id=27).

Only got one screenshot for now but will add more later, or go to Link

319.Name: Mountain Pass
319.Author: Preshall
319.Description:
This is an area that I have been working on since the pre-release toolset came out. It is by far my favorite area I have ever made, and is the culmination of over 200 hours of experimenting, tweaking, rebuilding, texturing and pretty much learning the toolset inside and out. It is quite a resource-intesive area, but it is well worth it, I think. My system runs it really well on medium settings, so you might need to tweak your settings a bit. 

This is 100% hand made, I did not use YATT or any other terrain generating plugins. My inspiration came from the natural formation of mountains and I really tried to capture that in the area design.

Requires RWS Bridge Hak @ Link and Sorceress Ashura's Visual Effects @ Link

I encourage any feedback both negative and positive.

320.Name: Teper's Desert Oasis and Ruins Prefab Area
320.Author: Tepers or aadatepe
320.Description:
i everybody, releasing my next prefab called Desert Oasis and Ruins Prefab .This will be my
entry into contest since time is limited. My other project is taking longer than I estimated so
I will release that when I finish it. This area takes place of the caravan routes which has long been forgotten. 
As you stumble out of the desert you approach a walled oasis built to keep the desert sands and wind out but time has 
worn the surrounding walls down and it seems the desert has started to reclaim it once again. You notice the surrounding 
structures and realize that it must have been an important place in the trade routes. A blending of cultural
influces can be observed in the remaing structures that stand. As you approached the walled oasis your journy begins. I leave 
the rest for your imagination to fill in. You can change whatever you want on the area, I hope everybody will enjoy it as I enjoyed making it.
You will need to unzip the package using winrar if you don't have it you can download from "www.rarlab.com" its free. 
Inside the folder called Teper's Desert Oasis and Ruins Prefab you 
will find the following files and folders they are as follows: 

1. Readme.txt
2. Desert Oasis and Ruins.mod
3. Height Map "Desert Mts 3.bmp
4. Screenies posted on the vault.

Note: Added Version 4 of mod with minor changes. Did a little more work on the area and came up with a Half dome Temple which I added into area, also I added some lighting effects to make it a golden dome, in addition I made some minor changes to the temple near area entrance added ruby to it with more structures to the temple and some foliage. Added a saphire to main temple with some lighting effects and added lighting effects near water falls.So this last variation of the area will be my contest entry, Please vote only on area version 4 for contest enjoy. I felt with some of the comments that the area was lacking so I made some changes it was fun to see it progress into final version, Thanks everybody for your input. Comments are always welcome, Please don't forget to vote.

Min Height = 0

Height Map is from Tepers Height Map Vol1 on the Vault posted under Other which contains 
doc with examples.
