 1. Yatt by sidefx - Thanks very much, this great tool cut building time in half.

321.Name: Highlands
321.Author: AmstradHero
321.Description:
This is a 32x32 highland area featuring a variety of different landscapes and points of interest. I started the area this month after hearing about the contest, and it is my first major NWN2 exterior apart from a few small areas created for my 'Fate Of A City' module.

The area was created entirely by hand and without the use of any plugins like YATT (or any plugins for that matter!). No hak paks are required in order to use this area.

The area contains a variety of different possible entrances/exits and a substantial amount of walkable area (I'd estimate 50%-65%). Even for a 32x32 area, it should not be too resource intensive on a system; the area that is roughest on my system is the forest grove. If people do have problems, I'd be interested in hearing system specs and locations/conditions that cause problems for future reference.

---------
Highlands
---------
The highlands lie atop a plateau that is only reachable after several days of climbing up steep terrain. However, the highlands are known equally for their beauty as they are for danger and adventure. Coming from the South, there is a bleak wasteland of rock and scree, broken by a few trees that are have found places sheltered from the elements and harsh wind. Climbing the ridge to the plateau in the centre of a highlands gives a vista of a grassland marked with rocky outcroppings. The West is dominated by a mountain peak with a failing mine, which overlooks the potential dangers lurking in a set of ruins in the valley. Heading to the East, a dirt track descends into a gully, which passes through to a lush forested area. Here a mountain stream cascades into a cool lake surrounding a sacred grove. To the north lies an eerie moor, which during the day seems benign, but at night takes upon a more sinister aura. A hillside encampment is established at the North of the Highlands, overlooking the treacherous path down the chasm, but travelers can never be sure whether the encampment will be a source of refuge or danger...

-----

Highlands - An Area by AmstradHero aka Shadow Beast
I would love any feedback on what you liked/disliked and any suggestions for possible improvement to help further refine my skills. I'd be more than happy for someone to use this in a PW or a module, and if you choose to, I'd like to hear about it! (You can contact either through this site or PM on the official NWN2 forums - username: "Shadow Beast")

324.Name: Post-Eden
324.Author: NeverWinterGirl
324.Description:
This module is displayed in a post apocalyptic setting. The bountiful world as we knew it has rendered nothing but dust and vermin for decades now and mankind has been confined to small outposts beyond the city walls. A hell-pit has formed in the center of Eden and it seems to be the spawning grounds for many disturbing things. The old Arbor Village has been a refuge for many years but has recently become inhabited by bog-stalkers, so it is no longer safe. Where will we go next? How will we ever survive in Post-Eden?


POST-EDEN

Area 1 Highlights:

The Hell-Pit comes complete with sound and effects. The Amphitheatre of Torture is where the minions keep the captured humans, complete with sound and effects. The whole area is surrounded by crystal black waters, contaminated with post-apocalyptic chemical sludge.

Area 2 Highlights:

This area is central to the Arbor-Village Swamps. There is always a toxic breeze in Arbor-Village! Mossy slime riddles the filthy waters, along with the dreaded Bog-Stalkers. The delapitated docks glow with the burning torches and are always buzzing with local pests. Here you will hear the chants coming from the Crimson Horn Church...but beware the residents! The old Arbor-Village Apartments still remain and are a major landmark in Eden.

325.Name: Unicorn Run
325.Author: Ladyelvenstar
325.Description:
Here is my contest entry for the NWN2 Area contest. It was inspired by the Forgotten Realms Campaign Setting Book, p. 166:

"Flowing down from the Star Mounts in the High Forest to the valley of the River Delimbyir, the Unicorn Run is known for its hundreds of waterfalls, its whitewater rapids, the fey communities along its banks, and occasional sightings of the creatures that the river its name."

I will be using it for Act III of the campaign "A Time to Die" for Neverwinter Nights 2.

Installation Instructions:

1. Download the unicorn_run.zip file from the Vault.

2. Unzip file and place the unicorn_run.mod in your
 My Documents/Neverwinter Nights 2/modules/ folder

3. Download the sorc_ash_vfx2.hak from the Vault if you do not already have it in your hak folder. If not, place here: My Documents/Neverwinter Nights 2/hak/ (I've included it in the zipped file for your convenience)

4. Download the unicorn folder from the Vault and put in My Documents/Neverwinter Nights 2/override/ (or you can use the version I have included with the unicorn_run.zip file with my version of the appearance.2da file. Delete the 2da file if you don't need it and you want to simply add the unicorn code to your own appearance.2da)
 
Tips for Using Area:

I was trying to get the log to work for crossing back and forth, but for some reason, I had the settings wrong for the conversion to fire correctly. Due to the lack of time before submission for the contest, I created a wild elf and used the unicorn to aid the player in moving back and forth between the Uxinor's Meadow and the rest of Unicorn's Run.

I purposely made the area as unsettled by habitation as possible with the exception of a few fey creatures. There are plenty of hills and rough terrain, which is how I pictured Unicorn's Run would be like. There might be a few problems with the walkmesh and trees, but I didn't have time to go through everything thoroughly. Hope you enjoy exploring!

Yatt Settings for Bad Lands 9.bmp:

Max Height = 30 (or 40, can't remember exactly)

Min Height = 0

(Height Map is from Teper's Height Map Vol.1 on the Vault)

Credits:

1. Yatt plugin by sidefx - used the version 1.11 (before I upgraded to 1.12)
Link

2. Teper's Prefab Heightmaps - what a timesaver, thank you!
Link

3. Sorceress Ashura for her exceptional work with visual special effects and I used quite a few for this module (Version 5).
Link
 
4. Daronas for creating a unicorn for me on such short notice - thanks so much for all of your support!
Link

LadyElvenStar, 2008
Link

Link

Link

327.Name: College Square & Imperial Watchtower
327.Author: tinplatepaladin
327.Description:
Submitted for your approval, two areas, one a slice of cityscape, the other perhaps the entrance to a dungeon. A possible backstory is included for each, if you like.

Area 001: Cannoneer's Square is a small specialty marketplace located behind the venerable Iluster College of the Arcane. The district is dotted with warehouses and workshops. A small alleyway lead off to one side of the College's alchemical labs, and onto the well-manicured college grounds. The market plays home to a number of travelling peddlers during the spring, and at present, is the site of a gathering expedition into the mountains, to be led by a small mercenary company camped in the middle of the square. To one side of the largest of the red tents is a grimy alleyway by which is reached a set of stairs, that lead up the mouldering ramparts to a quiet overlook, often frequented by city guards. Down the opposite stairs one comes to a locked grate through which lies access to the city's ancient, overgrown aqueducts.

Area 003: The Watchwall is a relic of the old empire, long since abandoned. The elder races had powers now lost to history, and it was these ancient mages who built the great watchtowers, the Southian Tors, which scraped at the dome of heaven and housed whole armies in their day, their strength barring invaders at every mountain pass across the entire Imperial range.

This village is one of the areas to be found in the upcoming World of Palladium PW. It was designed to be a relatively small exterior based around a farming community with a central market that acts as the regional trade hub.

330.Name: Anph2Areas
330.Author: Anph2Tea
330.Description:
These two areas are straight out of our persistent world of anphillia 2, which is still in the works. So you can consider this as a shameless plug ;). The module is in beta, and is slowly nearing completion. Both areas are 24X24 and use custom textures, which I included in a hak. 
One area is a valley in which are the outer gates of fort axfell. Axfell, which is a playable faction, has build these walls in defense against cleavens (also a playable faction) and other enemies. The area is called Rusti Valley on our server and was my first creation way back when the game was first released.
The second area is called Rustin Point, also on the axfell side of the island. Itï¿½s inhabited by gnolls, which are a popular target for axfell veterans to hone their skills. Also a 24x24 I am personally not too fond of, but since others insist they like it - here it is. 
Anphillia sports many original areas such as this one, from myself and from Anduraga,
who has submitted an area here Link
We also appreciate many of the great works done here on the vault and use them were it fits. If interested come and visit on our forums. Link

331.Name: Allyndn's City
331.Author: Allyndn the Beggar
331.Description:
I had the idea to create this small, dense port city years ago. Tried to evoke old city with a history. Part Edinburgh, part Dublin, part Seattle. Foggy, a bit run-down, with some interesting neighborhoods. It's market day today and traders from all over have set up tents and wagons around Castle Bridge Park near the main gate. 

I had been dabbling in creating the exterior map ever since Tupoun released the beautiful City Hak. This prefab is, in many ways, a showcase for that hak file. I hadn't intended to release this for quite some time yet, but when I noticed the contest last week, I decided to finish this up. My understanding wife gave me "every waking hour" for the last three days to put everything in order.

I hope you enjoy it. I hope the City inspires module builders and story tellers to create things in the city. I am inspired by it, personally and intend, eventually, to use it as a hub and launching point for many of the modules I have in development. 

You need for this module:

Tupoun's City Hak (available elsewhere on the vault)
Camb's vines override (optional)

Version 1: just the exteriors

Version 2: adds exterior shops (see the readme file for details)

332.Name: Treasure Island - Prefab
332.Author: Dave Crowell
332.Description:
Treasure Island - A Prefab area for NWN2 by David Crowell aka Eat2surf

This is an area for my upcoming module of the same name.

To create an expansive area without taxing the computer I decided to experiment with scale. I have reduced the entering characters to .3 scale .. the current, crude-but-functional script changes the scale and slows down the character to keep the movement speed relative to the PC's size.

Thanks to this scaling, I have been able to deliver you a complete island to explore. An area that takes a long time to walk from one end to the other. An area big enough to get lost in.

This scaling does have a couple of effects that may initially be unsettling.

The camera settings are designed for normal sized (1,1,1) characters.. thus, when zooming in the camera goes over your scaled-down avatar. When using the NWN1-style strategy mode it is best to keep the zoom a bit back from your character. It also works fairly well to use the Chase Camera and lower the view to watch your PC run.

There is a script to slow you down in the swamp. It has a SpellID of 1001.. and the scaled-speed has an ID# of 1000.. I have no idea if these conflict with anything.. not my forte.. and in interest of completing this for the NWN2 Area Contest I haven't researched this. If any issues arrise from this I will update!

The Area is based on the descriptions in Robert Louis Stevenson's book, "Treasure Island." He was inspired by the area around Monterey California and thus mentions an island with a good deal of pine trees. However, he also sets Treasure Island at a location that is fiting of palm trees and tropical plants.

While such areas exist, I found that many I talked with thought the two tree-types didn't coexist. I assure those critical of this mix to research what troubles them.

In addition to recreating Treasure Island as described in the book, I also wanted to use only what was given to me in the NWN2 toolset. I built this with NWN2 1.11 .. This left me a bit lacking in shrubbery. (Oh how the kights who say, "Nih!" would be disappointed!) .. I rotated and scaled the two tropical shrubs I found in the toolset (Shrub-small.. Shrub-medium) to create my clumps of greenery.

There may be other shrubs that would work. I had already used the Holly bushes in the swamp and thought the same plant up in the hills would be inappropriate. There may also be other placeables that I missed. I only got NWN2 in February 2008.


Included are The Stockade, The Hispanolia, the swamps, all the topography mentioned on the map that Jim Hawkins took from Billy Bone's sea chest, Ben Gun's cave... Rum Cove.. the North Inlet.. and even some bird cement on the sea rocks.

Anyway, Here for your exploration is Treasure Island. 

Enjoy!

Dave

335.Name: Hidden Domain
335.Author: ebear - 'E Halls'
335.Description:
This is my first submission to nwvault for the Area Contest and my first area to reach a semi- complete status. There is still more I would like to do in order to add character, and fine tune the placed effects so later for that.

There is a cave door behind the waterfall, there is a skull above that waterfall through which the creek is fed water, and there are fireflies you can observe better during the night cycle(I wish I knew where to find the setting for increasing the density and area which the firefly effect covers, if there is one).

Apart from that most of the other features will simply stand out as you walk through.

336.Name: Temple Ruins
336.Author: Fhulhi
336.Description:
Wandering through the forested hills, you stumble upon a small valley and the ruins of an ancient temple. To the north lies an overgrown cemetary, and to the east you hear the echos of a rumbling waterfall.

My small offering for the NWN2 Area contest.

The area is fairly small and would probably be best used as a sort of transitional area. In regards to the path by the waterfall: it is possible to get to the cave, but the walkmesh seems to be a little wonky. (this may be my system only; I don't know.) There are only a couple interactive items at the moment; I felt that this could be customized as needed/wanted.

At any rate, I hope everyone enjoys!

~Fhulhi

337.Name: Fallbrook Village
337.Author: Zarconus
337.Description:
This is a small walled village in a forest with a stream running through town and a river for boat travel.

I built this area as a starter town for a mod that i'm making. I was going to enter it into the area contest but I missed the deadline!

I still have all the links and signs to transition to my interiors.
These can easily be changed in the toolset to add your own.
This is my first submission so I hope you enjoy the area!

Please feel free to comment or make suggestions.

338.Name: Damian's Fae Sail
338.Author: Damian
338.Description: This is my first Mod, has 9 areas for friends of Haven only. Come check it out.

340.Name: Baldur's Gate City
340.Author: SÃ©bastien Raymond
340.Description:
Here it his: Baldurï¿½s Gate City completely revamped.

All exterior areas have been reproduced, as well as all the shops, temples and all places of interest like the Ducal Palace, the Iron Throne, the H-Q of the Flaming Fist, and so on. However, you will not find individual apartments of citizens like in the 1997 release. 

The city is animated by commoners, merchants, aristocrats, and priests, through automated scripts. 

I respected as closely as possible the original design release by Bioware in 1997 and I even observed the precise location of objects in indoors areas. 

 
You can use this Prefab like you wish however mention my name and e-mail address please. 

Cheers, 

SÃ©bastien Raymond

//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
SPECIALS THANKS TO:

Anthony Dietrich (aka Kieron), who helped me in the translation of a variety of texts included in this prefab and to Edward, a talented scripter (aka Ebear) who give me some help in some twisty scripts. Also for Jlftn, the maker of the Sword Coast Chronicle, who inspired me for the Iron Throne building exterior. 

Special thank to Nytir maker of the Building construction Kit (BCK) and to RWS for is RWS Deep Sewer Tileset.

Finally, to Michael Hoeing, compositor of the Baldurï¿½s Gate original music.

342.Author: Slit518
342.Description:
Here is a dungeon that I have made, I originally made it for a PW called Lost Dungeons of Adventure, so it may have waypoints with comments on them. And it may have a few enemies in the beginning, just feel free to change what you need.

I will paste images soon, hopefully...

343.Name: City Area
343.Author: Phoenixus
343.Description:
These are the Silverymoon areas I was going to use originally for Tale of the Asberties. Unfortunately I simply cannot populate these alone without adding significant dev time for something relatively unimportant to the main plot. So I'm cutting out a few things. 

This specific one is the palace district and probably the one I worked with the least. 

Silverymoon is supposed to be covered in a Mythal like the elves of old had warding Myth Drannor. It means the weather inside the city is milder than outside the city. It was supposed to take place in the fall. 

But this is the palace district where the Mythal eminates from so it is nearly as green as summer but still holding a little bit of autumn in the air. It includes the temples and the high palace as well as the extension into the market area. 

As I look back at this, I think it would probably be an excellent area for a PW, and could benefit it.

344.Name: Old City
344.Author: Phoenixus
344.Description:
This is another area I am cutting out of Tale of the Asberdies. Unfortunately there is just too much to populate and use that is not plot crucial enough to spend the time on. 

This is the Old City. It's on the north side of the river and includes the docks. This one is a little further from the Mythal of the palace, but still you can see the effects of the warmth on it. You can still see traces of summer here even in the autumn season. 

Originally I had the main grass texture as grass_17 but decided to trade out for grass_36. You can swap one for the other if it seems more fitting to what you want. 

This area was mostly complete but I did want to tweek it a bit more. Still I am releasing it now to any who want to use it.

345.Name: Floating castle of DOOM
345.Author: Me
345.Description: Inspired by Shinad's Astral castle prefab, here comes my very own floating castle of extra DOOM! Could work well as a hideout for your extra evil bad guy or as a devilish shadow plane fortress or something.

348.Name: Just Add Encounters: Exterior Dungeons
348.Author: SGK73
348.Description:
This is a dungeon area using the exterior area type.
The intent is to have a large area for hack and slash dungeon crawls.
I left the placeables mostly generic so the module builder could easily add specific placeables for the type of creatures that will inhabit the dungeon.

A note about the torches that are placed in the area. These are not really supposed to be perfectly placed or even sensibly placed just so you can get a feel for the area during a walkthrough to see if the area is usable in your module.
Also the area is somewhat desaturated to simulate lowlight conditions.

Have included a .mod file for easy viewing.


Known issues:
There are a few things to keep in mind when rebaking the area.
In the placeables list there area three directories named 90, 180 and 270.
The placeables inside these need to be aligned to the correct angle or the floors/stairs will not bake properly.
When adding new placeables it will be alot easier to cluster up a few placeables and edit the walkable polys then cutting with a placeable or a trigger. Adding lots of new cutting shapes will most likely break the baking routine.

Also baking time is quite long 1h+ or so.

Some Z-Buffer artifacts (red pixels) are visible both in the toolset and ingame because of the collision helper objects where those intersect with another object. This will probably vary depending on your graphics card and/or settings.

There are also alot of dynamic collision placeables and non environment objects so the area might be a bit heavy for PW use.

If the toolset crashes when trying to load the area try again and if it still crashes restart your computer. Had this happen a few times when building. This problem did not occur ingame.

Dependencies:
BCKII: Link
Collision Helpers: Link
Black Skydome: Link

I have included a placeables.2da in BCKIICH.hak that has the BCKII and Collision Helpers merged. If your module uses another placeables.2da you will need to merge this one too.
As the .hak references are not saved in the .erf check the .mod for load order.
Also extract the placeables.2da from the .hak and place in override when building.
Check the forum and/or tutorials on how to do this.

*Update: Added a 'clean' version of my going to be crypt style dungeon.
*Update: Added the crypt version.

349.Name: The Eclipse Traders
349.Author: ticladesign
349.Description:
The Eclipse Traders
by Ticladesign, 2008

Interior: Shops

Prefab area - this area can be used for any module as a Shop and Rogue's hideout with Rogue store. There are also Crafting stations available with a Crafting Store.

Two scripts make sure Doors autoclose, and lock with the doors that need locking ;)

Two convo's for the NPC's in the area.

General idea of the area:

The Eclipse traders may seem like an ordinairy shop with some general goods for sale, but to a keen eye, preferably a Rogue's eye, there is more to this store than what one may expect. It's one interiour area that can be connected through two doors to any possible exteriour area: a main door to the normal shop, and a 'backdoor' with a lock. There is also a possibility to access the Rogue's hideout from the main shop, but it needs some investigating.

Hope you like it, and please vote for it if you do ;)

-Ticladesign.

350.Name: Mountain Summit
350.Author: Boozehound Blue
350.Description:
A snowless mountain summit/pass. 16x16 area with multiple pathways & 4 cave entrances. Texturing compatabile with Anduraga's "Surague Escarpment" prefab.

This is an area I've designed for an upcoming campaign. (See the link.) I may re-texture a duplicate for snow. 

If you've any suggestions, please let me know. Thanks!

351.Name: G-Forest(no waterfalls)
351.Author: ChaunceyBillups1
351.Description:
A mid-sized forest area chock full of trees, mostly evergreens. 

I started this wanting to make a really brown, drab looking forest ala northern Michigan. However, for some reason, maybe the spring weather, I made it all green and purdy. It contains two entrances for ruins/dungeons/fast-food restaurants/etc. I tried to stick to the 5 seed rule on trees but I may have gone over just a tad. I don't have an impressive rig(heh heh), and it runs like butter for me with shadows and anti-aliasing off. 

Anyway, I hope you guys enjoy this area. I may work on some interiors for the entrances, but there are already some lovely dungeon prefabs on the vault that would fit this area.

352.Name: G_Mines
352.Author: ChaunceyBillups1
352.Description:
Two small mine areas linked up and ready to go.

When I made these a few months back I was just trying to pull off a simple, short, dark dungeon that looks full while still allowing lots of room for combat. I hope I hit close to my mark, and that you guys can find some use for it.

353.Name: G-Wizardlab
353.Author: ChaunceyBillups1
353.Description:
It's a wizard's lab! There are some rooms for him/her to socialize and study, a room for him/her to drain the blood from hanging bodies for experiments(or maybe just his/her morning coffee?), and yet a third room for storing frozen bodies. 

It consists of two interiors which are all linked up and ready to go. I made it intending it to be a short, low level dungeon romp with lots of quirky things going on.I hope you guys enjoy it!

P.S. Forgot to add a description to the rar. It contains both areas in erf form.

358.Name: Solvheil: Evertide Prefab
358.Author: Raith Veldrin
358.Description:
Keel Street on the Docks of Evertide in the Kingdom of Dalreon.

(Prefab area from Sands of Solvheil II: Beneath the Hearleforne)
Link


Instructions:
Import ERF file into toolset and populate. The area is already baked to a delicious golden brown, so walkmesh is already in place.

All doors have been set to static to allow builder to select which buildings to use (just uncheck static button in door properties)

Feel free to modify and/or use in your own campaign.


Evertide
Situated on the Southwestern Edge of Dalreon where the Sea of Aluun forms the Thynoth River, Evertide is an impressive feat of human craftmanship. 

Evertide plays more than just the role of capital for the Kingdom of Dalreon, it also serves as the economic hub. Imports come in across the Sea of Aluun from the Orilyn Empire while goods also arrive via caravan from the desert and get shipped downriver.

Evertide is home to several independent trading companies as well as the private houses of some nobility. Among some of the larger trade organization are the Ardent Anchor Trading Coster and the Golden Gills Trading Coster. These rivals both deal in the flow of goods across the Aluun Sea and economic diplomacy with the Orilyn.

363.Name: Solvheil: Solvheil Ruins Prefab
363.Author: Raith Veldrin
363.Description:
The Ruins of Solvheil sunk into the sands after the Imlan Sea was expelled from its moutain basin. After the tampering of elemental forces that led to its destruction, the ruins were enveloped in a pocket of planar rift. Because of this anomoly, the altered gravitational and electromagnetic surroundings have a profound effect on sound, light, and even time itself.


(Prefab area from the upcoming Sands of Solvheil III: Crusaders of Shalihir)



Instructions:
Import ERF file into toolset and populate. The area is already baked to a delicious golden brown, so walkmesh is already in place.

Feel free to modify and/or use in your own campaign.


Ruins of Solvheil
Solvheil was once a powerful empire that evolved from the birthplace of man. It was located on a landmass in the middle of a vast inland sea which sat in a basin surrounded by mountain ranges. Rel, the creator, walked with man in the ancient civilization of Solvheil. It was here that arcane and divine magic were at their pinnacle. Priests of Rel possessed the greatest of healing while Solvheilian mages controlled the elements.

Ambition seemed to be the heart of man's strength. It was the never ending quest for knowledge and power that ultimately led to destruction. The ancient Solvheilians learned how to harness the gravitational energy of the earth and sea. In their tampering they pushed all of the water of the inland sea outward spilling out of the basin over the mountains. The result was a catastrophic flood that devastated much of the outer lands and left the inland sea a dry sandy basin without water. Solvheil shook on it's foundation and crumbled from below sinking onto itself and buried under rock and sand.

Atlas/Wiki
Link

364.Author: jlf2n

From the gates at the Wall of the Faithless, you can roam the city all they way up to the doors of Bone Castle and beyond. 

This was created for our Place World, Baldur's Gate: The Sword Coast Chronicles. You can learn more about it by clicking on the forum thread link below.

365.Name: Small husbandry settlement/fortified rural mansion
365.Author: DMN
365.Description:
Note: this area is not yet finished. Requires minor tweaking before it is functional.

This is my second attempt at building an area using the NWN2 toolset. My aim was to create a small settlement, to the purpose of learning the processes of terraforming, texturing surfaces, and working with the placeables. 

My approach to areabuilding is that an area should be an expression of something bigger. Similar to how a construction site tells of engineering, and how a modern office building tells of capitalism, each area in gamedesign should tell of something. 

For the setting, I decided to focus on the concept of a medieval knight's residence. In the feudal age, knights were vassals of more powerful landlords. The knight would serve the landlord in war and administration and in exchange, the knight received an amount of land and serfs to live from. He would need to keep horses, provide armour and weaponry as well as surround himself with a number of warriors to protect his belongings. 

I began the area with the idea of a large mansion. I took inspiration from the Briton hillforts of the classical era. I placed the mansion on an artificial hill, and surrounded it with a number of apple trees to hint at luxury. I fenced the hill and began to work on the homes of the knight's servants. He would only keep his most trusted and important servants close to him, such as his warriors and horsehandlers. Placing housing for 6 families, I worked on a path and again fenced it off. Next I kept a stroke of lands free as pasture for the knight's horses. A hillfort wouldn't be a hillfort without fortification, and I painstakingly constructed a palisade and ditch. I realised the pasture would also make an excellent military camp in times of trouble, and thus I added an encampment next. The watchtowers came after that, and I figured it would be nice to have something to actually look-out at. I placed some trees and elevation and by applying an old theatre trick, crafted the optical illusion of distance by scaling the trees smaller the more distant they were. 

The area is not yet finished and not suitable for actual play. It has no sounds, no NPC's and no gameplay content. It is simply my second attempt at worldbuilding using the NWN2 toolset.

Some of the lessons I learned:
- Applying different shades of the same texture might look good in the toolset, but it does not come out properly in-game. 
- Settle the area dimensions early in the creation process. Having to change it later will create allot of work since the elevations have to be adjusted. This is difficult and I haven't been able to make the landscape look good after making an area bigger.
- NWN2 is not made for looking into the distance, but rather top-down in the style of Baldur's Gate. I have to take this into account what making my compositions of placables, building, etc.. 
- The proportions of the placeables are scaled too small and are almost fairytale-like. Interior-design won't match the exterior proportions of the houses. This makes my drive for authenticity difficult, and will require creative solutions and tedious efforts to get it right. For this module, I used BTH's housing pack and 'clipped' the houses into each other to make bigger houses. 

Some of my design principles, mostly explained with some example questions I come up with while building:
- Authenticity, not sensationalism. Areas should be believable at first, beautiful at second. 
- Region and geography determines terrain. All non-human(oid) elements from 'nature's perspective'. IE: what natural processes have affected the area and terrain?
- Function and purpose determines engineering. All human(oid)-elements such as constructions and roads are there as effect or side-effect from human(oid) activity. IE: What was this activity? What was the purpose? Why is a home placed the way it is? Why was it build in that style of architecture? What has happened to the building since it was made?
- Enhance the gameplay experience. Players will witness the area as they travel through it to quest, battle, etc. An area should accommodate player movement and activities. IE: between which points will players travel most? Should this be clustered as much as possible?
- The landscape is a gamefeature. Exploration and sightseeing shpud be accomodated.
- The context of the gameplay narrative. The area should hint at the storyline and plot the players are going through. IE: if there is a war, should there be signs of siege or preparation? 
- The day of play. There should be signs of daily activity, according to the time and period a players travels the area. IE: if it's winter on a farm, are all farming implements stored away? 
- Computer performance. The complexity of the area should not be a hindrance to the player. (Note that with this area, I disregarded performance.)

I might continue with the area in the future. At the moment, I just wanted to share it so that I can 'proof' myself to any people or projects looking for builders. 

If anyone can actually make use of this area, feel free to do so. And please let me know how it works out for you!


Note: I combined the following resources into the module's hakpak (part of the .rar files):

BTH House Placeables
RWS Bridge Pack
 BTH Rural Defence Pack

A big thanks goes to their creators!

366.Name: Forest Labyrinth
366.Author: Fhulhi
366.Description:
You find yourself walking through a forest shrouded with dense fog. Eventually, you come upon a stone wall and a tall black door. Passing through the door, you discover you have stumbled upon a huge, stone labyrinth...

If you have ever entertained the thought of thoroughly frustrating the PC by dropping them in a huge maze, this may be right up your alley. :D This area contains a few custom encounters and basic scripting. (Please read the readme file for the specifics.)

This thing stole countless hours of my life, so if you like it or hate it or simply saw something that could be improved, please leave a comment. I hope you guys get some enjoyment out of it!

367.Name: Forgotten Temple
367.Author: Zarconus
367.Description:
This is an outdoor dungeon of a temple in a swamp. I left all the rooms blank so you could populate it as you see fit!

This map uses alot of MotB content so you will need the expansion!

It is my second submission to the vault I hope you enjoy it as much as I did making it! Comments are welcome.

Here is an updated version with more rubble, shading and sounds!

368.Name: 2 levels of a catacomb
368.Author: NeVerSun
368.Description:
Here are two small underground area prefabs for you. They have (or at least should have) a dark face and yes.. look at the .mod or the .erf-file.

You will have to place the module nv_underground_mod in your module folder in the My Documents-folder. 

For example: C:\Documents and Settings\Administrator\My Documents\Neverwinter Nights 2\Modules


And for the erf you will have to open toolset first. 
Then click on File and Import....

369.Name: Port Town
369.Author: Vron
369.Description:
A small town, with docks, that I hope will fit into most locations.
Made it for our Bloodstone server but looks like we wont get large enough to use it, so no point in wasting it, ay?. lol

370.Name: Exterior Castle
370.Author: Ugly_Duck
370.Description:
*********************************
*** Area Prefab: Castle_01_01 ***
*********************************
Date: July 10th, 2008 (07-10-2008)

This is a castle mounted on a hill surrounded by water. With the right light settings for the evening, it even looks kind of spooky. The default evening/night setting doesn't do too bad of a job making it look scary.

There are 2 versions of the same area: The 1st area has taller grass & the 2nd has shorter grass for your gaming pleasure.


Use them however you see fit, but do give credit.

The files are .erf and they are compressed in .zip folders.

Please post any comments/concerns here.

Thanks.

371.Name: Portal Room
371.Author: Vron
371.Description:
A Small portal room, that I made as a lobby for our server but we changed our minds,
Here for anyone to use now. :)
Constuctive feedback most welcome

Pictures show the two ends of the small chamber. I'll leave your own exploring to find our little DM joke we were going to use, that we left in. :)
Enjoy.

372.Name: G_Hopeless
372.Author: ChaunceyBillups1
372.Description:
Hopeless, the gate town to The Grey Waste in The Outlands. This is an area from Rogue Dao Studios Purgatorio project. It is being released in part to give vaultgoers an indication of what Purgatorio will look like, and in part because its just a really slick looking area(we thought anyway). There are some things you guys should know about it so I'll list those now...

-It has barely any sounds and barely any vfx. Since its unpopulated I didn't know what people would be using it for, so no sounds. As for the vfx, well rds has a boatload of custom vfx and we also use several packs off the vault so I just took them all out. So just add vfx and sounds to taste.

-I left a door off the rws tower I used at the bottom of the city. Again, add a door to taste. 

-There are some chairs and whatnot that I left as enviro objects, partially for easier baking on my end(heh heh) and partially because I don't know what you guys will do with said chairs. So once again, the chairs are yours to do with what you will.

-It is a ginormous area that makes liberal use of trees. It is intended for very sparse population and contains no interiors(gotta keep some stuff under wraps).

_This does require the RWS tower pack. If you don't have it already I highly recommend that you download it with the quickness. It really is wonderful.

-In Purgatorio, there will be an accompanying skybox depicting the spire in the distance. Until then I gave you a pretty decently dreary day/night cycle.

Thats pretty much all I can think of. The area was made from the maps of Hopeless and the writeups in the 2nd edition planescape books. There are appropriate(where possible) building types for landmarks such as the mayor's mansion, and you can even see the city of Torch in the distance from within the walls. 

I really hope you guys enjoy this one, and feel free to use it however you like!

373.Name: Beregost
373.Author: SÃ©bastien Raymond
373.Description:
Here it his: Beregost Town (v. 2 updated and retextured)

All important interiors areas are there:

Jovial Juggler

I respected as closely as possible the original design release by Bioware in 1997 and I even observed the precise location of objects in indoors areas. 

 
You can use this Prefab like you wish however mention my name and e-mail address please. 

Cheers,

Finally, to Michael Hoeing, compositor of the Baldurï¿½s Gate original music.
