374.Name: Empath Abbey Exterior Prefab
374.Author: JasonNH
374.Description:
This is a 24 x 24 exterior area inspired by the Empath Abbey Keep from the world of Ultima, but was also designed for general use by the community. The keep has an inner courtyard, a fully walkable roof, and another small, middle level that would be good for something like a shrine. Please note that there are no interior areas created for the keep at this time. Instead, the three doors in the courtyard are currently linked to the upper levels of the keep so that you can walk around on the roof. I have also included a custom load screen for this area. There are some locations on the roof where the walkmesh is a bit quirky, but it's the best that I could get after many attempts.

The area around the keep consists of grassy plains, lightly forested areas, a deeply forested area, a coastal beach area, and a couple of streams that lead into the sea. There is also a vineyard behind the abbey, although only a portion of it is inside the walkable terrain. There are several walking paths that were implemented in such a way to provide convenient transition points from different kinds of terrain. I went a bit light on the placeables associated with the keep, figuring that they would be pretty specific to each personï¿½s own intentions. I have intentionally dismissed the idea of cutting out individual trees from the walkable terrain because this can be irksome to those who play with tree fading enabled.

Feel free to inform me of any serious gaffes in the area (trees floating off the ground, places where the camera swings inside the keep, etc.) and Iï¿½ll do my best to make them right. With an area of this size and scope, there are bound to be some spots that can be touched up and improved upon, but hopefully the majority of the terrain is usable as it is.

Acknowledgment when using this prefab is much appreciated!

Installation and Use:
=====================
This area has the following dependencies:

BCKII Generic hak - Link
BCKII Gothic hak - Link

I have packaged this area into three parts: 1) A module demo 2) A hak file 3) An ERF file. The module and the ERF are compressed using the freely available 7zip archiver.

Demo Module: A fully baked version of the area with the custom loadscreen and a little scripting to turn outside lights on and off at appropriate times.

HAK pak: This contains the 2da changes and MDB files used by the community content as well as my own custom loadscreen and placed effects.

ERF file: This contains the exported ERF file for the area.

To try the demo:
1. Download the module and place it in your ../My Documents/Neverwinter Nights 2/modules directory.
2. Download the hak dependencies noted above as well as the empathyabbey.hak file down below and place it in your ../My Documents/Neverwinter Nights 2/hak directory.
3. Start a new game -> new module and select "Empath Abbey". Any character will do, there are no encounters.

For builders:
I donï¿½t need to tell you, you know the drill. You can either download the HAK and associate it with your module and import the ERF file if you donï¿½t already have your own 2da changes, or you can merge my changes in with yours. I tried to be sensible in my 2da assignments. Hopefully they donï¿½t collide too badly with yours.

Acknowledgments:
================
Nytirï¿½s BCKII is a brilliant piece of work that made this possible. If you enjoy this area, be sure to go and give him a big ole, high vote. He did such a great job with it.

SGKï¿½s collision helpers for their indispensable value in preventing the camera from swinging inside the keep and completely killing immersion. Without the collision helpers, you would experience some really ugly moments with the camera passing through the walls of the keep, so please remember SGK with a nice vote if you make use of this area. Link

375.Name: Tropical Shore
375.Author: Anduraga
375.Description:
Tropical Shore is a fairly small prefab experiment with crafting more realistic shores. I wasn't able to create actual ocean waves like I wanted to, but the area is still pretty decent without it. 

I made this after taking a short break from creating a series of massive interior areas for Misery Stone. Every once in awhile, a guy needs a break from the usual workflow.

Anyways, hope you guys enjoy this small contribution, and don't forget to check out Misery Stone on the Bouncy Rock Entertainment forum!

Link

376.Name: Desert Canyon
376.Author: JasonNH
376.Description:
This is a 16x16 exterior area of desert canyons originally developed for a personal project that is now canceled. Areas of interest include five cave entrances, burrowed holes for housing nasty little critters, and an oasis with a waterfall built with custom VFX. I have also implemented custom rest restrictions such that resting is only permitted in the region of the oasis. The area also enjoys very smooth frame rates given the minimal amount of vegetation, which tends to slow things down.

Please feel free to make use of as much or little of the area as you like, though acknowledgment is appreciated.

377.Name: Acorncroft: A ring-walled fort
377.Author: Amraphael
377.Description:
Acorncroft is a classic ring-walled fort on the sparse flatland where you find a small middle age-style village of 14 thatched country cottages complete with pigs, cows and chicken. Close to the fort lays a place of sacrifice.

More images here:
Link

Instructions (sort of):
For your convenience there are two downloads. On .mod so you can easily test it by playing and one .erf that you import into the toolset. Both are baked and has sounds placed and the animals has ambient animations enabled. All doors are locked and has a spoken locked message. Just enable the doors you want to use by unchecking the locked box under properties. 

Just fill it with NPCs and Heroes and start telling the story. Feel free to modify/use it in your campaign or module.

Tutorial:
When making this Prefab area I made some notes that could be used as a area design tutorial. If you want to you can check it out in the tutorial section:
Link

Have fun!

378.Name: Merchant House
378.Author: NeVerSun
378.Description:
A merchant house.

Size: 5x6 squares

Works also with the normal NWN2 - No MOTB content.

Just an erf-file.

For the erf you will have to open toolset first. 
Then click on File and Import.... 


It was just sleeping on my harddisk, so have fun with this ;)

379.Name: Canyon Grove
379.Author: AmstradHero
379.Description:
Proceeding along the wilderness in the shadow of hills and mountains, you travel along a winding dirt track. The track descends in a small depression, and trees loom up on either side.

You suddenly come across a small clearing, a raised grass plateau amidst this serene forest. You wonder whether the strange arrangement of stones on the top of the hill signifies something...

----------

This is a 4x4 exterior.

380.Name: Sea cave
380.Author: Wyrin
380.Description:
Interior cave built using exterior area and cutom skydome, taken from Dark Avenger Chapter 2. Useful for smuggling den or cave part of underground dungeon complex.

Download contains module containing the area, and erf for exporting into existing module, and custom skydome files, which can be used in Campaign or Override folders

381.Name: Lockmyre Lighting
381.Author: Jclef
381.Description:
This urban nightmare is known as the Den. It is located in the city of Lockmyre.

It's an area taken from a scrapped project of mine called "The Rogue".

The area lighting is meant to portray feelings of hopelessness, loss and depression.

Screenshots:
Link

383.Name: Prodigy
383.Author: DK
383.Description: Nice prefab forest with river and waterfall! made with v1.13.1409

384.Name: African Desert (Day/NightSettings)
384.Author: Anduraga
384.Description:
These are a couple of Day/Night settings that I fiddled around with during Tropical Storm Fay. Couldn't do any real work since the electricity kept blinking on and off.

I googled some images on the net for references, and I hope they are close to accurate within NWN2 limitations of course. 

There are no screenshots of night-time as they are not much different from the ones included with Surague Escarpment. Just a few minor color changes and what not.

385.Name: Interior Bloom - Dark
385.Author: Anduraga
385.Description:
These are the bloom settings I often use as a base for any interior that I do. If I want the interior to have a themed variance I often change the GroundLight and SkyLight colors to suit my needs. 

And as you can probably see from some of the screenshots, the effects achieved are often moody. So, for dark and creepy settings (like Misery Stone and Faithless), bloom settings can often enhance your module tremendously.

My recommended settings are to turn off Directional Lighting.

For installation, go to Import Properties within the Area Properties Tab and Select "Default". Find and locate the file and it should import fine.

386.Name: DayNight Environment Pack
386.Author: Wyrin
386.Description:
This is simply intended as a quick resource for builders - collecting some official cycles, and a couple of my own in one place for builders looking to explore the effects of lighting on an area - and saving time on exporting them from the official campaign themselves

OCSwamp - taken from the tutorial module that comes with the game. Good atmospheric swamp lighting. Import for all stages

MOTBdefault - the standard cycle use in MOTB exteriors. Import for all stages

MOTBthay - the Thaymount lighting from MOTB. Import for all cycles

MOTBsnow - the snowy area lighting from MOTB. Import for all cycles

wyrin_spooky_deafault - a dark lit area, slightly desaturated, taken from the Raven's Lake sidequest of Dark Avenger 2. Import as default lighting and set area not to have a Day/Night cycle and no directional light

wyrin_interior_default_NoDirect - an interior lighting setting I use as a base for tweaking to get other interiors e.g. using placeable lights or turning on directional light and using different sun/moon colors, make specular light slightly green/purple in aberrant areas etc. Import as default lighting, no Day/Night cycle, (+/- no directional light)

All screen shots from the Dark Avenger series

387.Name: Temple of the Rose
387.Author: CrimsonAngel
387.Description:
The Temple of the Rose is My start Area for my own module that is in the Making War of the Rose.

But becaus i am pretty new to the tool set i have decided to make some of my work available as prefabs so that it can be tested out and i can get some feed back on a few things.

For now it is only one Area, but i plan to get more out there so it can be tested.

Now to my ideas around this room is empty with a sense of foreboding.

Something bad happened her and i try to portray that with some cold lighting and fog effects.

I hope i can get some feedback on it.

389.Name: Small Exterior Lighting Set
389.Author: AmstradHero
389.Description:
Here are four lighting presets that I've used.

Autumn Wilderness - suitable for nature areas. Used in my Canyon Grove prefab.
Exaggerated Dusk Dawn - Suitable for a variety of situations, this makes dusk and dawn a little more exaggerated in terms of their red and orange saturation.
Opulent Exterior - Probably most suited to a bright area. Gives a goldish aura during the day with a moderate amount of bloom.
Glorious Battle - Gives a slightly reddish tint and would be suitable for a variety of exteriors.

Note the variations in these may be somewhat subtle, but they are noticable.

390.Name: Myratma West
390.Author: VPJ
390.Description:
Portion of the City of Myratma near the West Gate. Of course, this could be used for just about any city.

There are no scripts, merchants, NPCs, encounters, interiors, etc built in. This is just the exterior area of a small portion of the city.

NOTE: there are several paths which a PC will not be able to travel as it is outside the walkmesh. I plan to add transitions as I go, but I personally don't like walls/gates/etc placed in the player's way just to show that it's time to move to a new area. 

However, you may feel free to modify as you like.

Enjoy!

Update 9/6/08:
--Added some new plants and placeables to pretty some of the buildings up a bit. 
--Had some trouble with multiple doors showing up in one doorframe. That should be corrected.
--Added transitions to Myratma Docks area. I'll add a link once I get it uploaded.

Update 9/7/08--The Docks can be found here.

391.Name: Myratma Docks
391.Author: VPJ
391.Description:
Docks for the City of Myratma. As Myratma is a major exporter of textiles, there are lots and lots of warehouses. There are some other buildings to play with such as the Temple of Umberlee and the Hard Aground Tavern.

There are also area transitions to Myratma West.

As always, you are welcome to modify to suit your needs.

Enjoy!

392.Name: Forgotten Village
392.Author: Hosa
392.Description:
This my new area - "Forgotten Village"

Created with Patch 1.13

My others areas:
666 Layer of the Abyss:
Link
Cliff Rock:
Link

393.Name: Grey Manor
393.Author: Ayrik
393.Description:
This is my first shot a creating an interior area in NWN2, and I rather like how it turned out.

It uses almost entirely the Estate tile set, includes an entry way, three guest rooms, a banquet hall, throne room, guards quarters, large kitchen, and two sets of stairs, one up for additional levels and one down for a potential dungeon.

**UPDATE**
A few minor changes to the area, including changing the direction of the staircase in the dining hall to match the upstairs area I am finishing up.

395.Name: Manor Grounds
395.Author: Ayrik
395.Description:
Another first attempt for me, this time an exterior area to go along with Grey Manor. It's pretty unpolished, but should not be too hard to spruce up.

 If anyone has any suggestions to make it pop a bit more, please let me know.

**UPDATE**

This has been long delayed for no good reason really, but here is the reworked version of the Manor Grounds. I believe that it looks far better now than before, thanks a lot for the suggestions.

396.Name: Country Inn
396.Author: Snotwort (aka: Varasin)
396.Description:
This is a country inn with a rustic atmosphere. 

Updated to Version 1.1: 
Tweaked the lighting and made some changes to a few placables.

397.Name: Mountain Village
397.Author: Jagwire
397.Description:
A 12x12 exterior area containing a small village at the base of a mountain and a mine at the top.
Feel free to modify this area or include it into your module, campaign or PW.
Comments and suggestions welcome.
Update 09/18/08:
Shaded terrain, tweaked sounds, minor walkmesh/texture changes

There's now also a winter version of this area, which can be found here: Link

398.Name: Myratma East
398.Author: VPJ
398.Description:
Tethyr has only recently begun to recover from decades of strife and war. The final battle to unite the kingdom was fought around Myratma by forces loyal to Countess (now Queen) Zaranda Star against those of Prince Yusef Jhannivvar. Most of the fighting took place in the eastern portion of the city near the Prince's stronghold.

The city has only recently finished rebuilding, with only the Jhannivvar estate left to reclaim. Most of the work on the walls and city proper is complete (with some minor work still continuing) and the City Council has appropriated the one usable building in the ruins. 

This prefab represents the East gate of Myratma and the Jhannivvar ruins. As always, you are welcome to make changes as necessary.

Comments and suggestions welcome. Flames, not so much...

399.Name: 666 Layer of the Abyss
399.Author: ho5a
399.Description:
My new area is one layer of the abyss...

My other areas.

Forgotten Village:
Link

Cliff Rocks:
Link

400.Name: Mountain Village Winter
400.Author: Jagwire
400.Description:
A 12x12 winter area covered in light snow with a small village at the base of a mountain and a mine at the top.
Feel free to modify this area or include it into your module, campaign or PW.
Comments and suggestions welcome.

This is the winter version of my prefab area called Mountain Village which can be found here: Link

401.Name: Glacial Valley and Falls
401.Author: 5thDragon
401.Description:
One 32x32(min objects)of a scottish highland inspired mountain. Devil's Backbone on The Known Lands.

Watch out for flying rocks in the screens, courtesy of Shaughn78's awesome boulder throwing. (not included)
Link

One 12x12 area "beneath" it, continues the feel but with waterfalls.

402.Name: Theater/Library/Bathhouse
402.Author: 5thDragon
402.Description:
A trio of areas from The Known Lands city of Silverbridge.

Dreaming Chimera Theater:
This was done prior to MotB so it's a bit more upscale than "The Globe" type theater that OEI gave us. It has seating for about 50, some balcony seating as well. A beneath the stage area with ropes/pulleys (OnUsed objects removed). A poorly faked catwalk portion is included, gratis.

Illuminator Library:
It has books. 'nuf said.

Bathhouse:
It has waist-deep water, sauna and cold room.

All areas may/may not have useable chairs from Patcha Link

Scripts have been removed in case you use Heeds or KEMO's haks.

403.Name: Arcane Haven Interior Prefab
403.Author: Sanjuro
403.Description:
This is an area from a module I'm working on. Most of the areas have been pretty specific to the mod but this one was more general and seemed like it could work as a prefab. 

It is an interior Magical area. The area is medium size at 5x10 area. It of a long hallway leading to a magical haven area.
 
All objects are environmental and I have bounded everything in walkmesh cutters.

Feedback is welcome. It will help while I'm finishing up the complete module. 

There is an erf file for builders and a module file for checking out. It uses update 1.13 and MOTB.

Thanks for checking out the area. Feel free to change the area just leave credit for its use.

404.Name: Underdark Descent Chasm
404.Author: Sanjuro
404.Description:
This is an area from a module I'm working on. Most of the areas have been pretty specific to the mod but this one was more general and seemed like it could work as a prefab. 

It is an exterior/interior chasm area. The area has a black sky and is medium size at 12x12. It consists of a cliff leading down with a camp midway down. 

Walkmesh is pretty tight on the path. All objects are environmental and I have bounded everything in walkmesh cutters.

Feedback is welcome. It will help while I'm finishing up the complete module. 

There is an erf file for builders and a module file for checking out. It uses update 1.13 and MOTB. It is 7-ziped I don't have a current copy of winzip. 7-zip is easy to use with no spyware it can be found here. Link

406.Name: NTB's Eroded Hills and Valleys
406.Author: nicethugbert
406.Description:
NOTE 08/30/2010:
In May I uploaded a 10 part series of Terraced Hills and Valley: Link

NOTE 04/11/10:
I have the magic numbers relations between L3DT, YATT, and NWN2 in a spread sheet here:
00) HTML
01) Open Office


NOTE 02/12/10: 3 of these areas are used in Valley Passage by Magical Wisps.


20 heavily eroded and terraced 32x32 empty areas made with L3DT and imported with YATT waiting to be populated with creatures, placeables, triggers, grass, rocks, trees, etc., and texture blended. The maps are roughly half rolling area with 1-4 eroded and terraced hills. Nearly all the walkmeshs require little to no touching up. The area transitions work but need attention. The areas are not designed to fit together but are connected for convenience.

YATT imports your L3DT Height and Alpha maps into the toolset. The YATT website explains what pixel sizes your L3DT maps must be in order for YATT to succeed. You will have to resize your L3DT maps accordingly either on export from L3DT or in an image viewer/editor such as Irfanview(it's free last I checked).

When you resize your map, you will also have to translate the max and min altitude of the L3DT height map if you have not already accounted for this in L3DT via the horizontal scale in the Design Map dialog.

Otherwise, your map will be stretched or squashed when you import it into the toolset. It is possible you may like this effect.

You can find the max altitude in L3DT by right clicking and choosing Operations->Heightfield-->Change vert. scale. Note, I messed up and set the wrong min height on all these maps. The result is that for each map, half of it is below sea level.

The smaller the L3DT tile count, the faster L3DT operates, but the smaller the resolution. I find that this is not a problem as cluttered terrain is a pain to maneuver through, and with the right settings, L3DT will crumple and roll the terrain so the eye is not bored, and leave the terrain usable.

The Design Map is the first map that L3DT makes. It is a grid and rough layout for the whole project. You can control a number of parameters in each grid. You can place mountains, plateaus, and seas. Change climate, erosion, terracing, lake formation, peaks, ridges, rolling, height on a grid by grid basis by clicking on each grid or brushing them on. You can also make changes on the entire map as a whole.

In retrospect, I should have tweaked the Design Map before I released my maps. I could have placed some mountains, plateaus, or seas to highlight the no-walk areas better.

407.Name: NWN2 OC and MotB Lighting Presets
407.Author: Jaesun999
407.Description:
NWN2 OC and MotB Lighting Presets

This collection of lighting presets are the exported Environmental Settings from 140 areas in the Original Campaign and Mask of the Betrayer areas. Each lighting preset is named after the name of the area they were exported from.

Files starting with a number, are from the Original Campaign. Files starting with a letter are from Mask of the Betrayer Expansion Pack.
The Files "generic_forest" and "greycloaks" are from the Original Campaign.

What are Environmental Settings?
This is the light, fog, bloom (and a few other settings) for an area.

Install instructions:
Uncompress the 140 files into your ï¿½Atari/NeverwinterNights2/NWN2Toolset/LightingPresetsï¿½ folder.
This is typically the default patch the Toolset uses when loading or exporting LightingPresets.
You *can* place these any where you like however. It does not matter where you place them, but it may be easier if you do place them where I suggest above.

How do I use these for areas in my mod?
1. Load up an area in the toolset.
2. Go to the properties window and bring up your area properties.
3. Click on the ï¿½Import Settingsï¿½ button. Select ï¿½Environmental Settings>DayNight Cycle Stage>All.
4. When the open file window opens, simply navigate to where you placed these files, and select one of these presets and choose OK.

TADA! You now have an area that is using lighting from an area in the OC or MotB!

ALL Lighting Presets were done by Obsidian Entertainment. I simply exported them to a file, for all to use.

Releases

10-13-08
v1.0 - Initial release

408.Name: Caste of the ?
408.Author: Alen Swift
408.Description:
Interior castel, some intersting secrets.
grould level and second floor in the same area map, But it is to represent diffrent levels limked through stairs.

Just add your own incounters.

409.Name: Grove of the Ancients
409.Author: Derek_H
409.Description:
8x8 exterior forest/valley area.
No monsters/NPCs.
Custom Lighting.
Sounds placed.

This is an area I was working on for my campaign. Oddly, I decided it didn't fit what was needed. So...rather then let it rot away on my hard drive, I decided to upload it so some people can use it as they please. Give me a brief nod when/if you use this in your campaign and I'm cool.

The area is rather thick. There is not a ton of room to move around in between the many rocks and trees--I realize this is not for all tastes. However, if you are looking for a narrow walk through cliffs until reaching a tranquil grove, then this might be for you. It's overgrown without relying heavily on grass, which is nice in of itself I think.

Outside of the cliff walls is 'blacked out' like in the official campaigns. I apologize if you don't like this style; however, this became a quick side project and it does not detract from the area at hand.

I am 'Chaos Wielder' over on the NWN2 boards. Please leave vote and/or leave comments.

410.Name: The Cavern Below
410.Author: Ticladesign
410.Description:
Here is the interior are "The Cavern Below", a one area Cavern interiour. 

It's a daring (I hope!) attempt at making two types of areas in one, heavily on tricks and traps, but also having the pathway from one exit to the other without any hurdles some classes cant get through. The "Hunting" area, which is a small encounter space that needs to be found, is seperate from the walking path. Many locked doors, some trapped, a fire trap on loot (my favorite, lol) and two Spider critters meant for levels 5 - 6.

Lighting - I worked hard on getting that to really be exeptional. Things you should look at are the "golden" glow on walls where Treasure is, and the shadows of certain placables.

Anyway, check it out.

411.Name: Ruined Castle
411.Author: Zarconus
411.Description: This is my third prefab area. It is a ruined castle exterior area set in the mountains or hills. As always I tried to make it generic so the user could add thier own settings sounds and encounters. I updated the map so you can now use the palace as well Enjoy!

412.Name: Haunted Ruin and Mine Camp
412.Author: Sanjuro
412.Description:
This is an area from a module I'm working on. Thought I would submit this as a Halloween themed pre fab. Could work as cult area or undead ruins. 

It consists of 2 interior areas a mine camp and haunted ruin. The mine camp area connects to the Ruin area in the mod file. Mine camp is 12x12 and the haunted ruin is 12x21. Both are rather dark and lit with point lights.

All objects are environmental and bounded with walkmesh cutters.

Feedback is welcome. It will help while I'm finishing up the complete module.

There is an erf file for builders and a module file for checking out. It uses update 1.13 and MOTB. It is 7-ziped I don't have a current copy of winzip. 7-zip is easy to use with no spyware it can be found here. Link

You can manipulate and use the areas just give credit for it.

413.Name: Kal-ahn'dur (Dwarven Ruins)
413.Author: PhD_Zaius
413.Description:
Originally developed these areas for the (now defunct) NWN2Haze PW. Found them on my hard drive as I was cleaning up space and thought I'd share them with the community.

The concept was an abandoned dwarven hall that was partially completed and is now being reclaimed after decades of neglect. Think refugee camp meets underground work-site.

There are 2 (large) main areas:
Kal-ahn'dur - the ruined dwarven stronghold being rebuilt/reclaimed
The Deep Mines - mine/cave complex under the ruins

Along with 2 (small) side areas (not attached in the mod, but designed at the same time, thus included here):
A dwarven-sized inn - filled with drinking games, firepit, storage and a dragon-head beer fountain (both unscripted)
A crafthall - more than just a forge, has carpentry, tanning/alchemical areas, etc

The areas are completely devoid of creatures/traps/etc.

Feel free to use these prefabs in whole or individually, however you please, but please give credit when you do.

Acknowledgements:
RWS Deep Halls - great work. No, really. This effort would not have been possible without it (HAK required for the main dwarven hall).

Razere's sittable chairs - in the module and inspiration to size everything to dwarf specifications

LostSoul - Play testing and design discussions. Thanks, old man.

The DF/Haze/NWN2Haze PW team and community - sorry to see it fade away, but thanks for all the fish.

414.Name: Ruined Keep
414.Author: PhD_Zaius
414.Description:
A large 20x24 foothill area centered around a ruined keep. 

Originally designed for a conversion of the WotC Base of Operations module to a DMFI mod (the full module still exists and sits at 80% completion, just no time to push it over the goal line).

I left in a few flavorful trigger scripts that are easily removed if needed.

Feel free to use it however you see fit, but please give credit when you do.

Acknowledgements
Thanks to Lost Soul, Hero Protagonist, Elgin and Helstrum for playtesting of the original module.

415.Name: Mines and Caves
415.Author: PhD_Zaius
415.Description:
Three separate areas, a medium sized abandoned mine, a small cave with hints of a solitary inhabitant, and a mid-sized cave complex with trapping of a humanoid presence.

Please feel free to use any as you see fit, but please provide credit if you do.

416.Name: G_Mountainpass
416.Author: ChaunceyBillups1
416.Description:
It's not really a mountain-pass I guess. But it IS mountain-passish. 

The area is built around a winding road and contains 2 cave entrances and one building, all intended for dungeons/flavor-interiors. 

-The area uses RWS Towers and RWS Cave Entrances. At some point over the last month or so, the cave entrances I placed stopped showing up for me ingame and in the tset. So, they SHOULD show up for you, but if they don't, I left little signs up showing where I had them placed. 

As always, I skimped on the sounds because, hey, I don't know how you wanna use my area mmkay? But other than that it's a darn fine looking area with a squeaky clean walkmesh. Aaaaand a WATERFALL!!!!!

417.Name: Sky Palace
417.Author: Burton Finch
417.Description: A sky palace similar to the one in the SNES game "ActRaiser". I've discontinued the campaign that I was going to use this area in and thus made it standalone as an empty prefab for players to use themselves. Included are custom models and placeables modified from the BCK Hakpaks.

418.Name: Waterdeep: City of Splendors
418.Author: -vendalus-
418.Description:
Bringing together the Forgotten Realms Weave and the Dungeon Master's Friendly Initiative, this is the first version of Waterdeep: City of Splendors. Built as a platform for collaboration, this prefab campaign can be easily expanded to include new areas of the city, underground crypts, nearby forests and guarded mansions of the rich and powerful. This is the perfect starting place for your next single player, multi-player or DM-run campaign.

At present this consists of three large exterior areas in one of the Forgotten Realms most spectacular cities with a number of interiors to be used as the basis for your next campaign. There is also an extensible world map system in place for traveling between areas.

The city is filled with commoners and nobles walking the streets going about their business, but there are also notable NPCs just waiting for you to breathe life into them. There are also a few merchants scattered throughout the city offering stores that scale by level for players to use.

Areas currently included:

Court of the White Bull
by Vendalus

Palace Plaza
by Vendalus

The Market
by Aristan

This prefab features and supports:

BCK
Link

BCKII
Link

RWS Deep Halls
Link

RWS Sewers
Link

Seryn's Drinks of the Forgotten Realms
Link

Dorrian's Drinks Pack
Link

Contributions from the FRW Base Module 1.01
Link

Contributions from the FRW Character Creator
Link

Item placeables by Kivinen
Link

Custom magic items by Dirtywick

Special thanks to everyone at the FRW and DMFI in giving feedback and encouragement on this project over at the Citadel: Aristan, dunniteowl, lariam, dirtywick, lordniah, styraxian, ladydesire, dark_wraith, Estelindis, steelfiredragon, dmguild, Carlo and anyone else I forgot.

Requirements

Requires MOTB 1.13 and the DMFI player/dm package (included in the custom content download):
Link

Installation

DMs and builders should download the campaign, custom content and documentation files. Follow the install.txt file for more information.

419.Name: G_Mountainpass2
419.Author: ChaunceyBillups1
419.Description:
A companion area for my G_Mountainpass. 

Basically the same overall theme with a slightly softer look and a glowing tree. Why a glowing tree? Because I liked the glowing tree. Hopefully there are a lot of people making mods out there that are desperately in need of an area with a glowing tree. 

ahem

I don't remember adding any sounds, so that's on you. The area does require the RWS cave entrances. If you haven't downloaded that yet then get to it. It's awfully nice having more than one cave entrance.

420.Name: G_Mountainpass3
420.Author: ChaunceyBillups1
420.Description:
A third and smaller area to go with the other two mountainpass prefabs I did. It's very gloomy, as you can see from the screenshots. It actually looks great with happier light settings though, so don't be afraid to change that up for a different look.

The treescape in the background on the north end of the map is not something that I was pleased with. I basically just got tired of working on the same theme for this long and thought it looked good enough to release as is. You might wanna flesh it out with some really tiny rocks though. 

This area requires the RWS towers. I haven't decided what to make next, so if anyone has any suggestions as to what type areas are needed then suggest away.

421.Name: Abbonshire Outskirts
421.Author: Grumblecake
421.Description:
I am proud to present the Abbonshire Outskirts for anyone to be able to use in their own projects. A 12x12 area free of any npcs but loaded down with story elements and spots to attach your own areas to it.
Open road leading out towards the south
A Cave entry to the north 
Mining Pit just outside the walls of Abbonshire.

Now being one who likes to incorporate story into an area. Here is some background information that can be used at will.

Abbonshire is a City of Tyr. Of course due to "demonic possession" the High Priests of the city have placed it into a state of quarantine, no one is allowed to enter or leave the city without authorization; in other words no refugees are allowed to enter. This has lead the city into a state of tyrannical control as well causing refugees to form a small little shanty camp outside of the gates, hoping one day to get in.

Though the High Priests' claim of demons can be somewhat true as a small area of dark magic has corrupted a portion of land just outside the wall and rumors of shadowy evil creatures are said to wander at night. 

Believing the cause of this dark magic is rooted somewhere below the ground itself the Priests have issued an order a dig down beneath the land in an attempt to find and remove the tainted land.

Unfortunately this isn't the only problem facing Abbonshire. A Band of Orcs have settled into a nearby cave it is only a matter of time before they reveal themselves and lay siege to a city in turmoil

422.Name: Beggars Nest inspired slum
422.Author: Kamal
422.Description:
Not a straight conversion of the NWN1 Beggars Nest, this external only slum area takes it's inspiration from the Nest and descriptions of it. 

Packed buildings and many narrow places. A central market area selling cheap goods. A number of ruined buildings to simulate the decay of a slum area. Once the sun sets, much of the map goes dark, making the area hopefully good for skulking about... 

A few token guards have been placed but otherwise the area is empty of creatures.

As this is my first submission, comments welcome. I'm sure there are many things I can improve.

423.Name: Silver Marches OM
423.Author: issacjr
423.Description:
Requires Motb+SoZ NWN2 2.21

Haunted by malicious dragons, hordes of orcs, and other ferocious creatures, the relentless cold and unforgiving terrain of the Silver Marches promise undiscovered riches and unspeakable danger to those bold enough to venture there. 

This is version 1.0a of the Overland map for the silver Marches it is not playable, but a prefab for Builders.

424.Name: Cozy House Prefab
424.Author: Borrie BoBaka
424.Description:
My first submission to the vault, a cozy house prefab to use anywhere you'd like. 

The house includes 2 floors both contained in the same area, linked and ready to go. Everything is baked and prepared for the front door transition and creatures to be put in.

Hope you Enjoy
-Borrie BoBaka

425.Name: Tepers Game Start/Temple Prefab Area
425.Author: Tepers or aadatepe
425.Description:
Hi everybody,I am releasing a new area prefab called Tepers Temple/Game Start Area. This prefab and be double 
as a game start area for your mods or you could use it as a strange jungle shrine or temple that you have
stumbled across in your journies. I hope everybody will enjoy my latest release as I have enjoyed making it. 
 
You will need to unzip the package using winrar if you don't have it you can download from 
"www.rarlab.com" its free. Inside you will find the following: 

1. Readme.txt
2. erf called Tepers Temple - Game Start Prefab Area
 

Note: Extract the winrar file on your desktop, copy the erf to your modules directory at

"MyDocuments\Neverwinter Nights2\Modules " then open up your tool set and import erf into new module. 
 
 ******** Requires both expansions NX1 and NX2..... *********

Please don't forget to vote.

426.Name: A Volcano
426.Author: Ugly_Duck
426.Description:
*********************************
*** Area Prefab: Volcano_01 *****
*********************************
Date: December 16th, 2008 (12-16-2008)

This is a volcano that I made. Hopefully it will be of use to you folks.

Use this however you see fit, but do give credit.

The file is an .erf and it is compressed in a .zip folder.

Please post any comments/concerns here.

Thanks.

427.Name: ProphetSword's Prefabs: Seaside Village
427.Author: ProphetSword
427.Description:
Nestled against the rolling forest hills, this small village is ready for you to use in your own modules. Just add NPCs, encounters, or whatever you wish.

If you decide to use it, please give credit for the hard work.

428.Name: Daluir - Luiren
428.Author: Luonnotar (0ts0)
428.Description:
A small town (mayhaps village) for my upcoming module (project title:"Daluir-Luiren") that will be set in Luiren, SE Faerun. 

The town is 12x12 exterior - with custom daynightsets (altered 'african setting' from here, forgot author of that one).

429.Name: Arabel (Cormyr)
429.Author: Wyrin
429.Description:
Situated on Cormyr's northern border and nestled against the rough and wild Stonelands, Arabel has always been a frontier city. Throughout the years it has been an independant hold, overrun and occupied by Orcish hordes, and, briefly, served as the seat of government for Gondegal the Usurper King. 

Arabel today is a booming, prosperous center of growth. Both newcomers and young Cormyreans are settling in the lands all around it, making Arabel, as the only practical place where they can hire services, ever richer and busier. It's a city of opportunity that is still lacking many of the sophistications of Suzail but not consumers' appetites for them. 

Often referred to as the Caravan City or Overland City of Cormyr, Arabel is dominated by land transport. It is a city of trading costers, warehouses, caravan companies, wagon makers, horse- and bullock-traders and merchant investors. All these are ably governed by ex-adventuress Myrmeen Lhal, the king's lord of Arabel.


This is my take on Arabel, using the maps provided in the Shadowdale supplement, but it can be used as a generic city in any context. I wanted to have a city which could be explored in one area, rather than separae areas for each of the districts. As such it's large, but can be cropped down using TerraCoppa as required.

Ambient placeables (barrels, crates etc) have been left out for now so this can be used for whatever purpose.

I've added some small areas to accompany the city
Kabarr's crystals - a store selling magical crystals and gems
The Pride of Arabel (unfinished) - the basis for a high class inn
Citadel - the Purple Dragon's base in the city, including rooftops access with views over the city

430.Name: Candelkeep
430.Author: Sebastien_Raymond
430.Description:
Here it his: Candelkeep. 

All exterior areas have been reproduced, as well as all the shops, temples and all places of interest like the library itself, like in the 1997 release. 

I respected as closely as possible the original design release by Bioware in 1997 and I even observed the precise location of objects in indoors areas. Some NPCï¿½s still wanders around. Put and adjust them (and obviously put more of them) like you wish.

You can use this Prefab like you wish. 

Cheers, 

SÃ©bastien Raymond 

////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// 
SPECIALS THANKS TO: 

Anthony Dietrich (aka Kieron), who helped me in the translation of a variety of texts included in this prefab and to Edward, a talented scripter (aka Ebear) who give me some help in some twisty scripts. Also for Josh (Jlftn), the maker of the Sword Coast Chronicle, who inspired for texturing. 

Special thank to Nytir maker of the Building construction Kit (BCK) and to RWS for is RWS Deep Sewer Tileset. 

Finally, to Michael Hoeing, compositor of the Baldurï¿½s Gate original music ! 

/////////////////////////////////////// 

raymondsebastien@hotmail.com

431.Name: Temple Ruins (interior)
431.Author: Luonnotar (0ts0)
431.Description:
Small temple ruins (interior) area. 
Can be set anywhere.

432.Name: Abysmal_Canyon
432.Author: Ugly_Duck
432.Description:
*****************************************
*** Area Prefab: Abysmal_Canyon_001 *****
*****************************************
Date: January 9th, 2009 (01-09-2009)

This area was my interpretation of what a section of the abyss might look like; including some of the weirdness one might encounter in the planes. I had a tough time making the stairs up to the ruins, but they are currently very functional.

Use this however you see fit, but do give credit.

I've uploaded 2 copies of this area: one copy is a .erf file and the other is a .mod file.

To check out the .mod file, simply place the .mod file into your MyDocuments/NeverwinterNights/Modules folder, start the game and then select Abysmal_Canyon from the module list.

To check out the .erf file, simply start the toolset, import the Abysmal_Canyon.erf file, place a start location, save it as whatever you want to call it - Abysmal_Canyon seems simple enough. Then, start the game and select the new module from the module list.

Check it out, and please vote. Also, post any comments/concerns that you wish here.

Thanks.

433.Name: Halruaan Monestary
433.Author: Kamal
433.Description:
Prefab: module format.

Located far away from the rest of Halruaan society, this monastery occupies a bit of coast along rocky cliffs.

No creatures have been placed, leaving you to fill in as you wish.

Talk to the boulders: they provide teleportation between the island, the clifftop, and the "mainland", but you could switch these out for statues or whatever you wanted. I used several different teleport effects available in the teleport system for show.

Takes advantage of:
BOG Fully Flexible Teleport system 1.0
Yatt
Teper's Heightmaps.

434.Name: Great Graveyard of Neverwinter
434.Author: Kamal
434.Description:
A section of the "Great Graveyard" of Neverwinter. from a module of mine

Now available in "spooky bloom" and toolset standard bloom erf formats, and with a more "lived in" look in response to suggestions.

435.Name: The Fishing Village
435.Author: Fizzbang of Khalidine
435.Description:
A Fishing Village from Grinning Fools forthcoming world of Khalidine. 

This is an example of the type of areas you can expect to see on Grinning Fools new Persistant World of Khalidine - Link

436.Name: Grumpy Strumpet Prefabs - Thundergnome
436.Author: MokahTGS
436.Description:
----------------------------------------------------------------
"Listen all! This is the truth of it. Fighting leads to killing, and killing gets to warring. And that was damn near the death of us all.

Look at us now! Busted up, and everyone talking about hard rain! But we've learned, by the dust of them all... Bartertown learned.

Now, when men get to fighting, it happens here! And it finishes here! Two men enter; one man leaves." - Dr. Dealgood, Mad Max: Beyond Thunderdome
----------------------------------------------------------------

Please to enjoy the Thundergnome Arena from an upcoming module project.

The arena is built with significant custom content from several sources listed below. I would like to first of all thank the content creators for their hard work. Without it, I'd be a very bored Strumpet.

Content Used:

Chaos Placeables compiled by Chaos_Theocrat

BCK I & BCK II by Nytir

RWS Merchants by Robinson Workshop

If you enjoy this prefab, please go NOW and vote for these content packs. They deserve it.

If you do not have these packs some 2DA adjustments will need to be made in placeables.2da. Just make sure your lines match up with these numbers and you should have everything in the right place:

RWS Merchants: 4619-4638
BCK I & II: 5001-5492 & 9001-10046

Have fun and vote if you like what you see or use this prefab!

437.Name: Village in far north
437.Author: Luonnotar
437.Description:
A small village for upcoming mod. Set in winter.
Some minor modifications of bloom.
Some NPC's placed out, lights, effects + some well-hidden treasures.

438.Name: Realms of Ultima Prefabs - Serpent Spine Mountains
438.Author: MokahTGS
438.Description:
What is it?
This is a 20x20 prefab area of snow capped mountains created for the Realms of Ultima Prefab Project. 

This is not the entire mountain range, but simply a small section for encounters. A path snakes (heh, get it?) its way down the mountain side past the tree line to warmer parts below. The area also contains an entrance to a frozen cavern perfect for stocking with hungry yeti.

Serpent Spine Lore
These mountains, named after the way they look like a winding snake on the map, separate the Deep Forest in the north from Britain and Castle Britannia in the south. You can learn more about this area of Britannia from the Ultima Wiki.

What is Realms of Ultima?
Realms of Ultima is not just one module. It's designed to be many module prefabs that can be combined together to make new story modules, PWs, multiplayer DMd modules or whatever people would wish to create, all with an Ultima theme.

***** Required Hak Pack Files ***** 
RWS All-In-One

439.Name: Sharpstone Village - v2
439.Author: Jezla9
439.Description:
A revamped version of Sharpstone village. This version has better texturing to give a more mountain-like setting, as well as a completely re-done walkmesh.

The area is complete with sounds and lights (including a small campsite). The music is standard and peaceful; you'll want to change it to match your setting and mood. 

As always, feel free to use this area in your mod or PW, but please give me credit.
To install, simply unzip the erf file and import it into your mod.

440.Name: Castle_Ext_002_24x24
440.Author: Ugly_Duck
440.Description:
*******************************************
*** Area Prefab: Castle_Ext_002_24x24 *****
*******************************************
Date: February 1st, 2009 (02-01-2009)

This is my 2nd attempt at mapping a castleï¿½s exterior. This particular castle has a somewhat evil theme, due to a few corpses and lighting in a few spots. If you do not want it to be evil, simply remove the corpses and either change the red lighting or remove it all together.

Use this however you see fit, but do give credit.

I've uploaded 2 copies of this area: one copy is a .erf file and the other is a .mod file.

To check out the .mod file, simply place the .mod file into your MyDocuments/NeverwinterNights/Modules folder, start the game and then select 'Castle_Ext_002_24x24' from the module list.

To check out the .erf file, simply start the toolset, import the Castle_Ext_002_24x24.erf file, place a start location, save it as whatever you want to call it. Then, start the game and select the new module from the module list.

Check it out, and please vote. Also, post any comments/concerns that you wish here.

Thanks.

*UPDATE*
I've uploaded a second .mod file containing a copy of this area with significantly less trees - only 5 to 6 different tree types. If you're having problems running the other version of this due to lag, try out the new 'LessTrees' version. Download whichever file you want. The original version with multiple tree types performed well on my machine & I don't have a great computer.

441.Name: wizard tower
441.Author: indyanna
441.Description:
This is a wizard tower prefab. All 20 areas are built. Just add encounters. It needs both expansions.

You should run through the areas in game to see how they're set up.

442.Name: work in progress, need guidance!
442.Author: velcrox
442.Description:
This is my first real attempt at a decent looking map, up till now all I have done is dabble with the toolset with mixed results.

There are a couple of things I don't find totally convincing personally

1) The dirt path didn't really make the leap from my imagination to the screen as I'd pictured it.
2) I'm not sure if I'm being brave enough laying down my grass textures, is the base mud texture showing too clearly through the grassy areas?

Any other comments you have would be gratefully received, so please don't hold back and tell me what you think!

The area itself is a small campsite area that you might just be able to recognize if you play alot of PC games. If someone can correctly identify the setting it will make me very happy because i think it means I'm on the right track! 

02/17/09 : Added my second area, a small burial ground. Unpopulated but I have added ambient sounds and placed lighting which were not present in my first area.

443.Name: Just Add Encounters: Gardens
443.Author: SGK73
443.Description:
A few garden/park type areas.

These areas might not be well suited for combat as visibility and/or framerate might be an issue.

Useage: Any, as long as credit is given.

444.Name: Volcanic Island
444.Author: pharos_gryphon
444.Description:
My first submission the Vault, this is a relatively simple island that I was doing up in my free time. Volcano rising up in the distance, ruins scattered about with two doorways for interiors. Was contemplating building a partially molten, subterrain interior to go with it, but that'll wait till later.

UPDATE: Finally went back and added that interior region! The exterior was also updated just enough so that doors and transitions matched up properly.

445.Name: The Winter Pass
445.Author: Fizzbang of Khalidine
445.Description:
A Winter Pass from Grinning Fools forthcoming world of Khalidine. 

This is an example of the type of areas you can expect to see on Grinning Fools new Persistant World of Khalidine - Link

To recreate the bridge shown in this erf, you need to download the RWS Bridge Pack - Link

446.Name: Pirate Lair
446.Author: Saboera
446.Description:
This is a small area i had been working on. It is meant to be a pirate lair located within a cave, complete with a huge treasure but can easily be edited for others purposes such as a dragon stash.

The area contains sounds, lights, over a hundred placeables and has an overall great atmosphere that screenshots cannot capture so check it out!

The walkmesh is edited and the area baked, you simply have to load it/import it and start building your module.

Take note that you will need both Mask of the Betrayer and Storm of Zehir to make use of this area.

447.Name: Forgotten Village Redux
447.Author: pharos_gryphon
447.Description:
So a short while back, Hosa added an absolutely awesome prefab area named "Forgotten Village" to the Vault. That being said, I tend to find that spooky, 'dead' regions like that have a ton more impact on the players and the story if folks are allowed to interact with them prior to being destroyed. Meet the people you'll eventually recognize as the corpses, stay in an inn that in the future you'll see as but a burnt out husk, etc. To that end, I took Hosa's area and brought it back to life. Ground texture was greened a bit, the building models switched to the unburned ones, and the trees given leafs yet retaining the same seed values. Walkmesh was also updated a bit and corpses and the like obviously removed. 

As a final note, I included the original version of Forgotten Village in the ERF as well. Again, this is just a redo of an already existent prefab. Credit really goes to Hosa for the incredible area design and idea! ^_^

448.Name: Town_Waterfront_12x12
448.Author: Ugly_Duck
448.Description:
*NOTICE* This prefab is resource intensive! I used quite a bit of placeables to get the right look for this area.

************************************************
*** Area Prefab: Town_001_Waterfront_12x12 *****
************************************************
Date: February 9th, 2009 (02-09-2009)

This is a small 12x12 port town that I made. It's upper level is the housing area & the lower area is the shipyard and docks. It took me a while to decide on how to map this one because I could not decide on whether or not to use a lot of placeables. I finally decided to just map it and make it look the best that I could. My machine is not that great, but it runs this area fairly well. I've got all the settings maxed accept for shadows, which are set to the lowest setting.

It uses a few placeables from Storm of Zehir, but if you do not have the SoZ expansion yet, do not worry - it should still work for you and look, for the most part, half-way decent.

Use this however you see fit, but do give credit.

I've uploaded 2 copies of this area: one copy is a .erf file and the other is a .mod file.

To check out the .mod file, simply place the .mod file into your MyDocuments/NeverwinterNights/Modules folder, start the game and then select 'Town_001_Waterfront_12x12' from the module list.

To check out the .erf file, simply start the toolset, import the Town_001_Waterfront_12x12.erf file, place a start location, save it as whatever you want to call it. Then, start the game and select the new module from the module list.

Check it out, and please vote. Also, post any comments/concerns that you wish here.

Thanks.

449.Name: Just Add Encounters: Pestilent Lands
449.Author: SGK73
449.Description:
Five different areas with a common theme of decay. 
These should be of use for anyone wanting to do a Ravenloft or Zombie Survival module.

Area 1:
A country side road and an ancient keep on a hill.

Area 2:
A dense forest holding dark secrets.

Area 3:
A cemetery.

Area 4:
A village.

Area 5:
A fortress under siege.

Use the siegetower to access the wall and the doors to move to the courtyard.
Made that as a quick and dirty way to get around, you will probably want to change the convo to something better.

A note for all the areas is that I've used the music (Kelemvor Temple) as another ambient background sound.

*Update 2009-02-15:

Added another Day/Night Cycle for those wishing a more bleak old horror movie style atmosphere.

This file contains only a Default Day/Night stage so you have to uncheck the day/night flag in area properties.

Also you need to set Desaturate to TRUE and Desaturate Factor to 0.4 as there seems to be a slight bug in the toolset when it comes to loading and/or saving day/night cycles.

If anyone needs a full Day/Night Cycle let me know and I'll put one together.

450.Name: Forest_002_16x16
450.Author: Ugly_Duck
450.Description:
This is an area prefab of a forest.

************************************************
*** Area Prefab: Forest_002_16x16 *************
************************************************
Date: February 18th, 2009 (02-18-2009)

I made this area a few months ago, but did not release it. I sat on it for a while to see if I could come up with more ideas for it. The only thing that has changed is that I've adjusted the placement of some trees and placeables.

Use this however you see fit, but do give credit.

I've uploaded 2 copies of this area: one copy is a .erf file and the other is a .mod file.

To check out the .mod file, simply place the .mod file into your MyDocuments/NeverwinterNights/Modules folder, start the game and then select 'Forest_002_16x16' from the module list.

To check out the .erf file, simply start the toolset, import the Forest_002_16x16.erf file, place a start location, save it as whatever you want to call it. Then, start the game and select the new module from the module list.

Check it out, and please vote. Also, post any comments/concerns that you wish here.

Thanks.

451.Name: Just Add Encounters: Jungle Temple
451.Author: SGK73
451.Description:
A temple set in a deep jungle.

Have included two versions one where the main area is clear and one where it's overgrown.

452.Name: Graveyard_003_8x8
452.Author: Ugly_Duck
452.Description:
This is a decrepit graveyard in the middle of a forest.

************************************************
*** Area Prefab: Graveyard_003_8x8 *************
************************************************
Date: February 21st, 2009 (02-21-2009)

I've been sitting on this area for a few months, slowly working on it and adjusting things. I feel that it is nowready for the vault. I hope you enjoy the area as much as I enjoyed designing it.

Use this however you see fit, but do give credit.

I've uploaded 2 copies of this area: one copy is a .erf file and the other is a .mod file.

To check out the .mod file, simply place the .mod file into your MyDocuments/NeverwinterNights/Modules folder, start the game and then select 'Graveyard_003_8x8' from the module list.

To check out the .erf file, simply start the toolset, import the Graveyard_003_8x8.erf file, place a start location, save it as whatever you want to call it. Then, start the game and select the new module from the module list.

Check it out, and please vote. Also, post any comments/concerns that you wish here. Feedback can also be directed to my email address: nwn.uglyduck@yahoo.com

Thanks.

453.Name: Arabic/Calimshite Interiors
453.Author: Kamal
453.Description:
a collection of arabic/Calimshan inspired interior areas.

this pack has been superceded by my Arabic Town prefab at Link which contains all areas listed here plus a number of extra ones.

454.Name: Grumpy Strumpet Prefabs - The Crystal Citadel
454.Author: MokahTGS
454.Description:
The Crystal Citadel is a canyon exterior prefab highlighting some excellent custom content available on the Vault.

The area is 16x12 and makes use of Hellfire's Cliff Placeables and ZSpirit's Crystal Placeables as well as the stock crystals from SoZ. The entryway was made using RWS Deep Halls as this was the intention for the interior of the Citadel.

I have included the 2DA hak that I made to keep all the content together. You will need to have the other haks from the other authors to use this.

PLEASE REMEMBER TO VOTE FOR THEIR WORK!

455.Name: Arabic Town
455.Author: Kamal
455.Description:
An arabic/Calimshan town. 

In my previous prefab of arabic interiors I was asked what I was doing for an external area....

The author of Solvheil: Tahamman Prefab (http://nwvault.ign.com/View.php?view=NWN2PrefabAreas.Detail&id=360), has graciously granted me permission to release this heavily reworked version. Please remember to go vote for that prefab.

This release also includes all the prefab arabic interiors of my previous release, plus some more. The mod version is all connected, and has placeholder map icons. Some areas are connected via area transitions rather than door transitions because of a toolset bug with the estate tileset (at least in my toolset). The main town area has music assigned, but the rest are blank musicwise. I especially like this area at night. 

(Some npc's are visible in the screenshots, but all npcs have been removed)

Contents:
1 main town area
1 extra outside area, the "spice farm" 
4 houses (one with a wizard's basement)
1 inn (multiple floors on one map)
1 temple (3 floors)
one government building (two floors)


uses the following Vault content (go vote for them):
Aquarium by merecraft
Lan's Placeable Groups v1.1

inspired by (go vote for it):
Storytellers Desert Town Adventure Pack (you can see these npcs in some screenshots)

456.Name: Snowpeak Village
456.Author: Sean
456.Description: A village built on a flate area in mountainous terrain.

457.Name: Silverymoon- Star Court
457.Author: Issacjr
457.Description:
The Political center of the Largest city in Lurue more commonly known as the Silver Marches. This will be attached to the Silver marches OM when it's complete.

Requires no special haks.

458.Name: Just Add Encounters: Jungle Paths
458.Author: SGK73
458.Description: A jungle mountain area crossed by paths and streams with a ruin at the centre.

459.Name: Tristor - Swamp village
459.Author: Wyrin
459.Description:
The village of Tristor, taken from the pen-and-paper module The Fright at Tristor (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Fright_at_Tristor), and set aside a dingy swamp. Village has a small shrine to Shaundakul, a temple to Lathander, a guardhouse and training ground, a brewery and inn.


I've had this area sitting around unfinished for a while, and am unlikely to now use it. It needs a little more texture/color work, but is perfectly usable as is.

460.Name: Sewers Area - 2 Levels
460.Author: LFenris
460.Description:
A 2 level sewer system - 2 16X16 maps. Lower level has an open tunnel end to continue downwards using the caves or
RWS Deep Chasms tilsets. No creatures are placed. There is a transition from level 0 to level 1 in place, and a
cute "scrap of paper" note at the beginning to give a rough bearing on finding it. I designed this to be played in "character" camera mode. Play it and you'll see why :)

Builders Notes: 

Except for periodic "clutter" in the hallway systems, I only "defined" 2 real areas on level 0 to allow you to
tailor it to your design; the first is what I made to be a humanoid type lair area (I'm thinking Kobolds), and
the other an obvious spider lair.

I have a light setting set to make this map set very dark, requiring use of light spells or a torch- there's a
torch placed at the entrance for testing purposes. The whole ambience of the place is designed around low light settings. I'm including a copy of the importable light settings I used for your inspection/use.

Also, given that I used RWS "Deep Sewers" tilset, I noted that using camera modes other than "character" allowed
the tops of moss and cobweb placeables to be seen when zooming out- to combat this I have placed a "tileblock" on
level 0 (see screenshot) to show you how to further place additional tiles similar to this to complete the setup.
I left the rest out because once they are in place, you cant see the corridors in the toolset either :) Setting
up in this fashion also has an additional benefit- the player map and mini map are hidden from the player,
requiring a more cautious approach to exploration. Personally, I hate the map being shown to the player, hence
all this.

NOTE: You can remove these "tileblock" tiles via the toolset if you wish, I just wanted to show a system where you
can have more control over the environment. 

Installation: Unpack the archive.

sewers001.mod goes in your Neverwinternights 2\modules folder.
BlackDayNightStage.DayNightStage is an environment setting you can import into other mods.
x_normal_vision.sef is an override you can use to disable low light vision for humans. This can be placed in your
Neverwinternights 2\override folder.

Credits/Requirements:

Required HAKs: (See the authors pages for builder/override versions if you wish to build with these)

RWS "Deep Environments" or (not recommended) RWS Deep Sewers.

Camb's "Placed FX Factory" components: Camb's Vines FX v1.2.1 and Camb's Placed Splatter FX v2.0

Cobwebs by Hellcow/Spajk


Required Addtional Components:

Scripted Lighting System Version 2 (SLS2) by Brendan 'Slayster' Ellis


Optional Components:

DMFI Player/DM User Package by Demetrious/DMFI Design Team


Comments:

This is my first submission of a map set, (actually my first map ever!) comments or bug submissions are most welcomed!
I was surprised to see no submissions for sewers, so wanting to be original for a prefab... Feel free to use this
as you wish. A little credit never hurts anyone, but I'm not a stickler for it either.

03/31/2009 - Initial Release

474.Name: Exquisite Day/Night Cycles
474.Author: Ovocean
474.Description:
A collection of carefully wrought day/night cycles.
Ok, for now there is only one cycle available, though probably the most important one. I plan to include more but want to finish a trees retexturing project I'm working on before. I will post screenshots on the news page when I release new cycles.

More screenshots

.: How to use :
1/ Unzip anywhere. If you have a previous version, you can overwrite it.
2/ Open an area in the Toolset, open its properties and choose Import Properties > Environment Settings... > Day/Night Cycle Stage > All, then open the preset file of your choice.

.: Notes :
- All cycles will not fit all areas. E.g.: the natural clear weather won't work well on snowy areas (too much bright light).
- Fog end and far clip plane are generally set to their maximum distance (resp. 800 and 300). You may want to reduce it in some cases.
- Bloom settings have been made to be subtle and to keep the same overall brightness level if you ever disabled it (not recommended).

475.Name: The Unhallowed Ruins
475.Author: Gremlin
475.Description:
The Unhallowed Ruins: A Prefab Dungeon
v1.0



Who knows what lurks in The Unhallowed Ruins- that dark place of irredeemable blasphemies? Its unholy taint is said to invade the dream scape of any who make camp to close to the blighted glade in which it resides. Tales have tantalized my mind with images of fiendish lizardfolk and ravenous Yuan-ti. Even rumors of demonic cults have cropped up in the gossip circles of the bordering swamp towns. Perhaps most outlandish of all is one farmers claim of a great shadow that swept across his field toward that forbidden demesne. Some speculated it was a dragon while others contrived more unbelievable and horrible ideas than that - hellish fiends or a rampant flying abomination born of mad wizardry to name but two.

I myself made way towards the infamous caverns to uncover the truth of the mystery surrounding them. Neither adventure, nor the unholy are new to me. I have examined the ground where necromantic abominations have marched and fought bandits for life and goods; however, none of my experience had prepared me for the true vileness of the eldritch aura that permeated the humid air of that place. I must confess my fear far outweighed my curiosity and the alien howls and hisses and inhuman screams that came at night did little to encourage my naturally inquisitive mind. So I left that place, and I am better off for it I believe. It is my hope that one day heroes of greater combat experience and of superior valor will uncover the truth of The Unhallowed Ruins and purify it of whatever taint may lay there in.

-Jacobus Toomey, The Wandering Scribe




***



-2 Level Prefab Dungeon

-2 Distinct and Detailed Environments

-No triggers or encounters(fill the dungeon with the creatures of your choosing.)

-A 'Boss Room' large enough for a small horde of enemies or something as large as a black dragon.


***

If you have opinions, suggestions, or a desire to see a specific type of dungeon made drop a comment.

Enjoy!

***

Exported both areas into .erf format and compressed them in a .rar for faster download.

479.Name: The Underlink - Main
479.Author: Azenith
479.Description:
" The underlink 
Under the surface, over the Underdark. In between the worlds we stand, shelter to the sons of night, temple to the dark gods' mans, heaven to the lifes traders." 
- Overseer of the Underlink

Hello all. What you just read is the summerized concept of a group of prefab areas i'm making. Today, I release the first of them, mainly to see what interest there is in the concept.

What is the Underlink ?

With a roleplay setting in mind, the underlink is a neutral grounds amongs the evilest of evil guys. evil rogues (might remove it), assassins, blackguards, evil shadowdancers. These are the only one allowed inside the underlink base. 

What you will find on this map :

-Lots of details
-working shops, but empty (fill them at your leasure)
-Customized npcs with customized looks, descriptions, names and dialogs. 

- The merchant npcs are dedicated to certain classes. One for rogues and assassins, one for shadowdancers and one for blackguards.

- An interactive door with interesting conversation. Make your way through it to reach the underlink. A different conversation node with class-fitting dialog has been created for each of the allowed classes (saves you guys the trouble). As a sidenote, you must be minimum level 4 in any of the above mentioned classes to enter the underlink. I did it because it is build for a roleplay server, and it is designed to avoid powergamers who take 3 levels of a class.

This is a functioning overland map with all SoZ encounters included, plus a few additional ones of my own choosing. I couldn't get the goodie system working properly but placeholders are present.

Static locations are Arabel, Tilverton and Shadowdale. Hidden locations include Castle Crag, New Acheron/Castle Joyous, and sites for random encounters e.g. crashed airship, caves and towers (sidequests not included).

Encounters scaled for ~7th level (use global in nChapter2enc to switch off more difficult opponents on the map).

A larger selection of encouinter areas is available, based on some prefabs by other contributors o nthe vault - email me if you are interested and I will chase up permissions.

DOWNLOAD CONTENTS

Put om_n_cormyr.mod file in modules directory

489.Name: Sanctuary of Sacred Strife
489.Author: Gremlin
489.Description:
Excerpt from the Diary of Mara Saren, Priestess of Loviatar

After two tenday of traveling north into snow covered lands of endless evergreen trees I have finally arrived in the prison town of Doleshire. The prison itself - a towering keep of stone - stands above all other structures in the town. It dwarfs even the towering apartments that make up the bulk of the settlement. I crossed over the pristine waters of the river called Twin Lash and rounded past the cemetery on my way to my new home: The Sanctuary of Sacred Strife. As I hopped down from the wagon I gave myself a moment to take in the beauty of the temple before me. Four great domed spires topped with thick iron spikes crowned the stone structure and two statues stood on either side of the door as if they had been waiting for me. Each was a depiction of the Maiden of Pain and it felt as though their open and outstretched hands were an invitation for my entrance. 

I must admit a measure of uncertainty as well. I came here because the church I came from was liberal in its dealings of pain...too liberal for my philosophies. I hear tell that the Sanctuary of Sacred Strife has a more conservative view on Loviatar's dogma. I find myself hoping this was truth as I entered the ground level. The first floor was lavish compared to the small church I have traveled from. With marble floors, golden trim, and statues each depicting the three pains of Loviatar it was an impressive sight. 

A Painbringer - garbed in an iron spiked ceremonial breastplate - greeted me. I followed my sister to the room she called The Antechmaber and there I met Dagna the Truescar, leader of this temple - the largest temple to Loviatar on the north coast I am told. The Antechamber was lit only by candle light and I caught the quivering crying form of a half naked man chained to a table behind Mistress Dagna out the corner of my eye. His blessings of pain where not my business however and I did my best to keep my attention upon Lady Dagna as she welcomed me. As we left my eyes lingered on the expertly sculpted statues of bronze that were pressed against the stone walls of The Antechamber. For a moment I could have sworn there were small faces of agony worked into the surface of the statues, but perhaps the dim lighting was but playing tricks on my eyes.

After the magnificent display of the ground level and the ornate statues of the dimly lit Antechamber I expected something even grander of the living quarters that resided on the top floor. As I was shown to my bed, however, I noted the rather plain nature of it all. Bare walls, a few rugs and candles were the only adornments. My bedroom I learned I would share with thirteen other sisters. The size of this place still impresses me. There is not much privacy save for the single trunk and bed that are my own, but I do not mind. I have no pains or anything else for that matter that I will hide from my sisters. I think this is a place I might be able to call home.

***

- A three story Loviatan temple complex
- Five NPC Loviatar worshipers including : Painbringer, Kneeling One, and Dagna the Truescar.
- Flavor text! Books within the temple can be read and provide the player with information on Loviatan rituals. There is also a sample sermon (in case you need to give an NPC something to read aloud, the writing is done for you).

***

The module can be downloaded in ERF's or as a MOD. Loviatar.rar includes the five NPC Loviatans.

This is one part of a small town I am building. Feel free to insert it into your own campaigns or worlds wherever a Loviatan Temple is needed, but I would appreciate the respect of being mentioned as a contributor.

Leave a comment or opinion and check out The Unhallowed Ruins (a to level dungeon done by yours truley). 

Thanks for downloading.

495.Name: Kamal's Stronghold Town
495.Author: Kamal
495.Description:
Not all evildoers hide in remote mountain dungeons. Sometimes a land just has a ruthless people with a taste for the beautiful. 

An evil church takes up much of the center of the city. An ampitheatre cliffside has a feature designed for gladiatorial combat, an open gate for tossing opponents off. 

And of course there's that giant complex of evil sitting atop the highest ground. There was a mountain there until a sorceror leveled it.

Of course, when you're that powerful you don't need pesky things like city gates. Summoning in a demonic horde works just as well for ripping your enemies to shreds, and good is scared to even approach.

A "clean" 32x32 town, ready for you to add your details to. No interiors.

It has walkable walls all the way around, both the castle tower and keep rooves are accessible. Large interior courtyard as well as a path around the outer walls leading to a hidden cave. There is potentially 15 entry/exit ways leading to other areas.



Please, Enjoy.

502.Name: Wassau
502.Author: J.E. McKellar
502.Description:
This is a set of exterior areas made for an upcoming module. Much like my previous attempt, The Last of the Danaan, the exteriors of this module will consist of 11 contiguous 16x16 areas. That is, you can see one area from another area.

The 11 areas are:
Fort Moultrie (FM): A fort built on the beach.
Lazaretto Marsh (LZ): A salt marsh with small islands and linked to an abandoned monastery turned goblin fort.
Wassau (WS): A city, complete with docks, drydock, town square, cathedral, and back alleys.
Ranzhuang (RZ): A small village for little people (gnomes and halflings), set amongst rice paddies.
Harper's Ferry (HF): An improvised fort built upon a sand bar, complete with a pontoon bridge spanning the river.
Bayou Alesienne (BA): A cypress swamp
Ossabaw Woods (OS): a stretch of forest overlooking the path along the river.
Beaufort (BF): A town overlooking the river.
Cape Jessamine (CJ): A plantation-style large farm.
Gwalior Hills (GH): A stretch of open, grassy hills.
Gwalior Rock (GR): An outcropping amongst the hills, topped with a menhir and attended by a nomadic encampment.

The areas are fairly bare, I've added basic sounds, but you will probably need to add in more placeables to customize each area to your particular tastes and needs. 

These are ERF files, you will need to add them to your module by using the import function, under 'File' in the toolset.

Updates:
12 September 2009 - Minor changes to Harper's Ferry, plus two new pics.

20 February 2010 - Three new areas added, filling in the 'hole' in the center of the map:

The West Bank (WB) - Swampy wilderness area south of Cape Jessamine (CJ).
Chickamauga Gorge (CG) - 12x12 area sandwiched between Gwalior Rock (GR) and Harper's Ferry (HF). Filled with narrow defiles with thick cover, perfect for ambuscades.
Ocmulgee Caverns (OC) - A massive network of caverns deep below the Gwalior Hills (GH), complete with ancient ruins and modern shanties.

Slight modifications have been made to all other areas as well. In addition to area transitions to the new areas, I've added lights to GR, CJ, BF, RZ, WS, and FM. I've also left terrain triggers in place in GR, GH, CJ, OS, RZ, OG, WB, LZ, and FM.

Additionally, now OC, BA, and OS now use scripted lights that add extra sun/moon lighting in spots. To use this lighting system, you have to initialize it when your module is first started, using ExecuteScript to have each area run the script 'area_init_lightswitch'. Otherwise you'll have sunshine at midnight.

503.Name: Stone Haven
503.Author: Alupinu
503.Description:
Stone Haven is a human town on the edge of the wild lands, nestled away in a mountain valley where possible adventure awaits. 

Stone Haven was a practice area (24x24) that was doomed for delete. At a friendï¿½s suggestion I reconsidered and posted it here for all you builders who donï¿½t want to spend the 15-20 hrs building a town from scratch. Enjoy! 
Oh and a vote would be greatly appreciated, thank you.

Alupinu
