505.Name: Faerun Overland Map
505.Author: Kamal
505.Description:
All of Faerun, as a set of four connected overland maps.

A few of the area transitions may be broken, but this is more of a demo/proof. The camera has been raised a bit from the SoZ overland map.

Water areas have been cut with walkmesh cutters, this should allow this map style to work with the over water systems out there. You can also walk to some islands that are close to shore between islands that are part of a group, to represent local ferries.

This will be the basis of my overland map system for my Path of Evil campaign. You can play the first module here, Link

Enjoy multiplayer? Join us at the Tavern of Hidden Tales. hiddentales.com

506.Name: Ghosttown and intact town
506.Author: Gonzo Gygax

507.Name: Dragon's cemetary
507.Author: Nagual_nwn
507.Description:
23/11/2009-Added one map(sunken ruin tile/screen 5 and 6)
-Reworked the first one a lot.

All is said in the title.
I gived a try using a rescaled Myrkul torso to build this in a cave/jungle environnement.
You need the DEEP CHASM hack to run the map.
It's an erf so you can import it directly in a mod using deep chasm.
There is no spawn.

508.Name: Ravenloft Village
508.Author: Gilraak
508.Description:
Enter the snow filled village of Ravenloft. A quite village within the Frozen North. 

This area is complete and can be used out of the box, though has tons of room for improvement.

**Do note that this area has nothing to do with the D&D version. This area is very old and when I created it, I did not know it was a big D&D thing.**

509.Name: Vampire Castle
509.Author: SkiMask a.k.a. EagleStarS
509.Description:
Vampire castle by: SkiMask

Disclaimer : I am in noway responsible for your CPU. Use this file on your own accord.

Version : Works with MOTB. I never got SOZ yet so this should work fine without a hitch.

Installation : Extract file "ERF" to desktop, then in the editor "import" this file into your module and test it out. Add some spooky music if ya like.

Notes : This is one of my 1st areas I made for my Children of the Night Module. So please don't beat me up too much. Most of all enjoy & have fun.

Contact : SkiMask a.k.a. EagleStars

xfire: xatefeaglex

Update: Cleaned up some area trees and added some zombie triggers. Added music and override files.

510.Author: Tukaram

The harbour. 
This is the first area of the magic Sleep island.

511.Name: Drow city+Lolth Temple

511.Description:
Using RWS DEEP CHASM
A drow city + a lolth temple(sunken ruin tile)

You should be able to shoot from the city wall without being able to go trough them.
The city can be used independantly from the temple for another civilisation/thÃ¨me/

512.Name: Grumpy Strumpet Prefabs - Underwater Passage
512.Author: MokahTGS
512.Description:
Underwater Passage is a 16x16 "Interior" area built on the bottom of the sea. It is a simple passageway connecting two areas via an undersea tunnel.

This area use some custom content from various sources, so you will need to download that content before you can use this. You will also need the 2DAs I've included for walls to match up where they need to be.

Best way to do this is to attach the supplied 2DA hak plus the required haks to a module, import the area .erf and there you go.

The following content was used:

BCK 2.1
BCK II
Container Fillers
RWS Underwater Placeables
RWS Creature Conversion Project
Mysteries of Westgate Placeables

Please make sure you go right now and VOTE for these content authors!!

513.Name: Talernon3 Prefabs - Lizardman Caves
513.Author: Dragonsbane777
513.Description:
Shameless advertisement - check out World of Talernon Age of Dragons Link

A group of 5 areas, from the Talernon2 server:
- an exterior area of cliffs near a river
- 2 interiors of caves
- 1 exterior made to look like an interior, a lizardman hatchery
- 1 interior temple to the god of water

They are all connected and linked up. I left the encounters in there, and included are over 40 lizardmen of various classes and levels - none look alike, and are made to be a challenge even to pro players.

You could easily open the areas and just delete the encounters to use them for your own needs, or you can DL the mod and just play it.

I made the exterior and 2 interiors, Pink Princess made the shrine, and D00M made the hatchery.

World of Talernon Age of Dragons Link

514.Name: Talernon3 Prefabs - Helwig Ruins
514.Author: Dragonsbane777
514.Description:
Get your ass on my PW for some crazy RP! Link

For your enjoyment, a set of areas from the Talernon2 PW. Play the module for some fun combat, or use the erf for areas for your own module or PW.

Included:
- 1 forest exterior (Helwig Forest)
- 1 graveyard exterior (Helwig Graveyard)
- 1 interior, 9 separate small crypts
- 1 large interior, undercrypts, includes a puzzle maze with torches you can turn on to mark your way as you port around between 16 small rooms

I did not remove the encounters so people could play the areas if they want. The erf and mod includes over 50 undead of various levels, including a few new ones and 5 liches with interesting spell lists.

Note that because of the large amount of custom content, there might be one or two bugs here or there, like a critter with no vfx or a monster with a missing weapon - I had to work on this a bit to release it, altering the textures on the areas and so on, so it would work without haks.

Like this? Come see the magic at World of Talernon Age of Dragons 
Link

515.Name: Snowpass
515.Author: ticladesign
515.Description:
The Snwowpass area is a Hilly lowland exteriour that slowly changes 
into a mountain and snow-covered highland. It's perfect for exploration
and hunting grounds. Suited well for Orc, or Barbarian populations, too.

516.Name: The Ascended City
516.Author: ticladesign
516.Description:
"As we ascend from the darkness, let us bring praise to the goddess of light who granted us the Ascended city in the sky."

The Ascended city is an elevated city that hoovers far above the ground.
Using a more alternative type of city building idea, I hope it gives a different city feel than most city exteriour areas that exist.

Good for any setting, though alternative/planar settings might get most out of this one.

517.Name: Talernon3 Prefabs - 3 Temples
517.Author: Dragonsbane777
517.Description:
Got RP? Dear god, check out Talernon3! Link

For your enjoyment, 3 temples from Talernon2. Originally made by CharG, one of the best builders I have ever met.

These temples were on a pirate island and dedicated to three evil deities.

I can continue to advertise for another, say, 300 days with releases.

Come see my PW. Link

518.Name: Talernon3 Prefabs - Dojo
518.Author: Dragonsbane777
518.Description:
World of Talernon PW Link

For your enjoyment, a multi-level dojo.

This is one amazing area, made by the uber-talented CharG for a power group in Talernon2.

Enjoy!

PS - check out World of Talernon Age of Dragons RP PW Link

519.Name: Krusings; City of Rothkel
519.Author: Krusing
519.Description:
The City of Rothkel build by man in Aleoud'a, an elven fortress ruin which once protect the mountain path to Glorigh. Several centuries ago, the city was razed, leaving non alive. The brutal slaughter was so severe that the ground is told to be smoldering still today, and the war drums echoes in the mountains.

An elven witch master was put to rest here during the elven ears of Aleoud'a. Monks from Rothkel tried summoning his spirit to learn from his knowledge, but was interrupted before the ritual was complete. He rests behind a sealed door in the mausoleum. (The room is not sealed off in the download).

Feel free to use this area prefab as you wish, just make sure to give the proper credit.

**************
KNOWN ISSUES:
-Waklway trigger not working on wooden path. (Easy fix)

This was to be a side mission quest in my module for NWN2, but as I changed platform, the area is now available for any one hwo finds use for it.

***

Special Thanks to Samuel Stoddard and his Fantasy Name Generator.

520.Name: Talernon3 Prefabs - Bard Halls
520.Author: Dragonsbane777
520.Description:
Check out RP PW Talernon3 Age of Dragons Link

For your enjoyment - Bardic Halls!

This area made by PinkPrincess was part of the giant mage school in Talernon2. I will be releasing it area by area. 

Go Tal3! Get your a$$ on my server!

Link

521.Name: Talernon3 Prefabs - Mage School
521.Author: Dragonsbane777
521.Description:
Check out World of Talernon Age of Dragons for some down n dirty RP! Link

For your enjoyment - a mage college! This was the central mage school from Talernon2.

Got RP? Link

522.Name: Feathered Serpent Beach
522.Author: seraphimsage
522.Description:
+(Final)
I made a few alterations, and added the Area Prefab as permanent addition to the Vault. This is the final update for this Area Prefab. Enjoy!


(A set of beach area prefabs that can be used for any sea adventure or perhaps just encountered while walking along the beach.)

Description:

Shipwrecked you wake up on a beach on a long deserted island. The beach leads farther inland, but you hesitate to leave the safety of the cove. There are two ships in the cove: the first is possibly the one you arrived in and the other has sunk long ago beneath the waves; only it's mast break through the cove's clear waters.

You see a weathered beach-house overlooking the beach. Upon entering you conclude that the beach-house was long ago abandoned. You spot the numerous holes that have opened in the ceiling illuminating the buildings three floors. A handyman's dream and your new residence for the time being.

Alongside the beach-house you spot a lonely cave. What treasures lie in there you wonder? Do you dare walk into those dark depths?

You wait and hope to be rescued, but should that day ever come, will you want to leave?

Comments are welcome!!!

///////////////////////////////////////
Installation Directions:
(((Most of you know the process already, but I'll state it anyway.)))

1.) Download the Feathered_Serpent_Beach.rar from the link provided.

2.) Extract the Feathered Serpent rar folder. 
(Winrar is ideal for this see link.)
Link

3.) Place the Feathered_Serpent_mod into your:
C:\Users\(Name)\Documents\Neverwinter Nights 2\modules

4.)Start the game, go to new modules, select the Feathered Serpent Beach module, select your character and start the module.
///////////////////////////////////////

523.Name: Duergar Mine
523.Author: Saryn1
523.Description:
This is a mine section built to replace the Duergar Mines for the server, "City of Eros" though for unknown reasons it wasn't included. 

The ERF only includes the map itself, which includes a handful of unscripted usable objects (Including Ore Veins and Mine Carts) to better theme as you'd like.

Enjoy ~<3

524.Name: Naga Cave v1.02
524.Author: MikeLM9215
524.Description:
A cave in Samarach or some other reptilian area where a water naga might live.

v1.01 cave placeables and chest with 2 items added.
v1.02 two items no longer cursed as they can't be taken from chest if cursed.

You need RWS Creature Conversion Project to use.

525.Name: Halfling Village
525.Author: Jet Truebow
525.Description:
Made from Mastokk's Little Village. It has been remaked into a Halfling Village.

Based upon the original neverwinter nights 2 OC mentioning that a group of halflings wanted to start a village near Crossroad Keep. 

My intent was to make it as light hearted and fun as possible. As well as provide items that some players might want to be included in SOZ that isn't namely, unique weapons, and helmets/hoods.

Includes a single quest meant for SOZ as well.

Comments on how to improve this tiny module are appreciated.
Amateur Scripter First Time Submitter
Submission to the Storm of Zehir Community Holiday Project.
Link
If it makes the cut.

I will try to make a standalone add-on (like the nimbre fix). and post here when completed. But I do recommend waiting for Chaos Wielders Completed SOZ Holiday Community project.

Edit: the override fix won't be that easy so for the meantime please use Chaos Wielder's Completed SOZ Holiday Community Project. Please play and report any bugs to Chaos. Thanks!

SOZ Community Holiday Project by Chaos Wielder

Other Storm of Zehir Holiday Project Entries
MikeLM9215 Naga Cave
The Fred's Cursed Gnome Hideout
Wyrin's Coiled Cabal Outpost
Kamalpoe's Inn of Hidden Tales

Hope you will submit something also. Let's make the SOZ community project a success.

Uploading new fixed version
-fixed quest convo bugs

1/05/2010 - Added Link to The Fred's SOZ Holiday submission
1/06/2010 - Added Link to Wyrins Coiled Cabal Outpost and Chaos' Combined SOZ Holiday Project
1/14/2010 - Added link to Kamalpoe's Inn of Hidden Tales

2/17/2010 - changed numerous placeables to environmental objects for faster loading.

526.Name: Cursed Gnome Hideout
526.Author: The Fred
526.Description:
My little something for the Storm of Zehir Christmas Holiday Project.

This is a 3-level gnome lair hidden in the mountains. As if that wasn't bad enough, aside from gnomes there are all manner of nasties lurking beneath the surface.

Really, this is not a prefabbed area but a prefabbed mini-quest, but you can add it to your module if you want to. :)

It is designed for a party of about L6, but a single character of L8+ could probably manage it - both these estimates depend a fair bit on your build, though.


UPDATES:
v1.1
The infamous Gnome Leader bug is (hopefully!) no more; both levels of the area should now be finishable. This also includes fixing a door not opening when it should have.


Known Issues:
There is a small bug with the switch puzzle door which occurs if you switch character halfway through, so avoid doing this. If this does occur, simply moving away from the door should fix it and let you get the GUI back up again.

Note that while the final project does, of course, require SoZ, this particular piece of it needs only NWN2.

Other SoZ Holiday Project works include:
Jet Truebow's Halfling Village
MikeLM9215's Naga Cave
Wyrin's Coiled Cabal Outpost
Kamal's Inn of Hidden Tails

The full project is now complete! Click here to get all the works at once! (Obviously you can still put comments about my bit on this page if you download it from there).

527.Name: Coiled Cabal Outpost
527.Author: Wyrin
527.Description:
Small (2 layer) cavern complex inhabited by yuan-ti and their kin as an outpost of the Coiled Cabal. Complete with encounters (upper level ECL7, lower level ECL10). Playable as a short (20 min) dungeon crawl.

Suitable as a hidden cave that the party can stumble upon. Lower level hint at larger underground complex which could be expanded. Simply import into your module. Requires SoZ but no custom content.

Submitted as part of the SoZ Holiday Project to expand the SoZ campaign with user-created content. Thanks to Chaos Wielder for organising this.
Other entrants include:
Jet's Halfling Village
Mike's Naga Cave
The Fred's Gnome Hideout


Will also be featured in my upcoming campaign Legacy of White Plume Mountain

528.Name: Inn of Hidden Tales
528.Author: kamal
528.Description:
My submission to the SoZ community expansion.

Poor Kamal, he opens a fancy inn with a Samarach theme only to have some uninvited guests. They are rude, crude, and scaring away all his guests! Kamal would like the heroic adventurers to help get his guests out of their rooms.

This area is complete and playable. There are two EL 12-13 or so encounters, though they are not immediately hostile (unless you say the wrong things...) so anyone can look around ingame. It could function as a drop in session for a DM needing something quick, though it doesn't take itself entirely seriously.

Notes: One area is completely black, this is on purpose. Also, the main floor looks slightly different than these screenshots. Spoiler: A certain creature can not be rescued.

529.Name: Cabin_Full_001_4x4
529.Author: Ugly_Duck
529.Description:
This is a small exterior area of a hunting cabin in the woods. It also comes with an interior area of the cabin. These use only a few things from Storm of Zehir: a grass, and some cobwebs. If you don't have SoZ installed, the exterior area should still look decent. The interior area may be a little bland though.

Its been a while since I've mapped anyting because I've been really busy with life and such, but I haven't given up on NWN2! Whenever I get a free moment I like to fire up the toolset and work on areas still!

Use this however you see fit, but do give credit.

I've uploaded only the .erf file for these areas because the modules I tried to create kept getting corrupted.

To check out the .erf file, simply start the toolset, import the Cabin_Full_001_4x4.erf file, place a start location, save it as whatever you want to call it. Then, start the game and select the new module from the module list.

Check it out, and please vote. Also, post any comments/concerns that you wish here.

Thanks.

530.Name: Forest Encounter Prefabs
530.Author: Gremlin
530.Description:
Forest Encounter Prefabs



Building a campaign or a PW that utilizes the world map feature? If you are constructing such then random encounter areas will surely be needed for those nasty surprise attacks from roaming bands of monsters. Included in this prefab submission are eight areas ready to go. From a snow covered pine forest to a bamboo forest. Even if random encounters are not needed these areas are more than suitable for DM events on PW's, or online campaigns, or even as small additions to new and old servers alike. Leave a comment or two or three and along with it feel free to voice any suggestions (and of course don't forget to vote). With that said, enjoy!


-Gremlin

531.Name: Prefab Town
531.Author: Gremlin
531.Description:
THE TOWN

The town rests against a great river in the foothills of mountains to the north and west. It grows every year from the goods it exports namely the valuable ore and marble from its quarry and mines to the west. Small farms have begun to crop up around the town as its wealth reaches new heights with every year that passes. To the south past the farmlands are forests and to the east across the expanse of the river thicker woods still.

****************************************

I built this town sometime ago and wanted to expand upon it with some of the areas mentioned in the description, but I never found the time. Instead of letting it collect digital dust I figured it might serve some use to the community, especially to any of you who want to get an online campaign going, but don't yet have a point a to start from. The screenshots illustrate only the exterior of the town, but there are 16 interiors as well. Hopefully the little bit of lore provided below is enough to inspire some ideas for quests or as to a possible flavor for the town.


****************************************


Temple: The spiritual center point of the town.

Townhall: A place where the people of the town may hold meetings - private or public.

Constable's Station: The Constable's office serves as a jail in addition to an office.

Northend Inn: A two story Inn located in the north of town. Its food may not be as good as the Kraven Kobold Tavern across the street, but they have beds to rest in for the night. It prides itself as an establishment more 'clean' than the Kraven Kobold Tavern.

Kraven Kobold Tavern: With gambling, musical entertainment, good drink and food the tavern steals away many of the 
Northend Inn's customers. It is a local favorite and farmer's often come into town just for the ale.

Silks & Such: The local tailor shop.

Hallem's Emporium: Furniture, bookshelves, cushions, or models? Hallem's Emporium has it all.

The Hunter's Eye: Arrows, bolts, and bows of all sorts The Hunter's Eye is the place to go for the right equipment for taking down both beast and monster from afar. 

Hammer & Tong: The local smith shop known for decent goods and unique customer service.

Lionside Tannery: Leather has been the Lionside family business since their great great grandfather and they have yet to stop making quality goods.

Barker's Butchery: The only meat shop in town is run by Barker - a half-orc who has adapted to civilized life - but of late there have been rumors and mystery as to where exactly he gets such high quality cuts.

Violet Spire Academy: Founded by a wizard - who decided to retire and call the town his home - to give the local children a basic education, and more talented youngsters training in the arcane.

Town Garrison: Headquarters for the town militia.

Cromwell Estate: Little is known about Lord Cromwell as he keeps to himself. What is known is that he is a wealthy man and retired to this little town to ''get away from it all''. 

Abandoned House: The houses that are closest to the Harbor are not look so well and a particularly run down building has seen some shady activity as of late.


****************************************


I encourage comments whether they are opinions or suggestions, and as always I appreciate your votes.

And as always: Enjoy!

-Gremlin

532.Name: Anduraga's DayNightSettings
532.Author: Anduraga
532.Description:
This pack contains some of my better DayNightSettings that I use frequently or tweak to obtain a similiar result.

The screenshots to the right show off only some of the DayNight settings to be found in this pack. There are 6 full DayNightSettings and 30 DayNightStages. 

LIST OF DAYNIGHT SETTINGS

Asian
Bounty Camp
Chessenta Standard
Taruin Farmlands
Taruin

Asylum
Cave Dwelling Bloom
Cavern - Blue

Misery Stone

INSTALLATION

Extract files to some location that you want to stash them in. I think Obsidian has some obscure location in C drive for them, but I created my own folder. 

To import the properties, go to Import Properties within the Area Properties Tab and depending on the setting you wish to view, you'll need to select "All" or "Default". Find and locate the file and it should import fine. 

Not all files are meant for Default however. Most of them should have a label regardless, such as (Default) or Daytime tagged at the end.

533.Name: Ravenloft Asylum
533.Author: Anduraga
533.Description:
Originally designed for Misery Stone, but was scrapped later on as new content was made. So, I am releasing it to you guys now. 

This prefab comes with 4 linked areas and fully scripted. There's some leftover stuff located in there that might need some removing, but otherwise easy to enough to change. 

For those who want to walk through the areas, before heading into the main lab area, climb the stairs into the tower and pull the lever to activate the portal system. This will make travelling through this large dungeon easier. And if you're having a hard time finding the entrance to the tower, its in the first area. Once your reach the transition to the laboraties, you should see two doors leading to a library section with a deactivated portal. The stairs is in that room. 

Hope you guys enjoy this area as much as I did creating it :) Although looking back, there is alot about it that I would've changed. At the time I was glad it was done, after I lost two days worth of work before...

534.Name: Corrupted Prison
534.Author: Anduraga
534.Description:
Requires MotB for Placeables and VFX.

The corrupted prison was another area originally designed for Misery Stone, but was scrapped.

This area requires one of two different haks, namely the RWS Dungeon or the RWS All in One Pack. I set up the module to use the RWS Dungeon Hakpak, so if you're using the RWS All in One, you might have to change this minor detail in the Module Properties before launching.

This area incorperates the submission of two other authors:
RWS Dungeons: Link
Camb's Blood Splatter Pack: Link

535.Name: Dwarven Ruins
535.Author: Anduraga
535.Description:
Requires MotB for placeables and VFX.

The third area set designed for Misery Stone that was scrapped. This version of the Dwarven ruins depicted a more magical society, which is probably why it got scrapped.

Also if you have a torch in your hand, you'll be able to relight the unlit braziers!

There is one scripted encounter at the end once you reach the furnace in the Hall of Kings.

Requires RWS Deep Halls or RWS All in One to play.

RWS All in One: Link

RWS Deep Halls: Link

536.Name: Forest Roadways
536.Author: Magical Wisps
536.Description:
Exterior Forest Roadway

- 7 Forest roadway Exteriors
- Day/Night cycles

Screen shots taken during the sunset period.

537.Name: The 9 Hells of Baator
537.Author: Magical Wisps
537.Description:
I wanted to make an abriveated version of the 9 Hells from D&D reference books.

So, I went to work and created all 9 layers of the Hells of Baator.

-9 exterior areas
-No encounters

Has 3 Interior areas that are not my work, so you can delete those areas unless you don't want to have to do any extra work and want to use them. I suggest Deleting them.

538.Description:
-1 Exterior mountain Area
-5 interior areas (2 Interior linear crypts)

1 Volcano

540.Description:
Snowy Mountain Pathways.
(5 Exteriors)

542.Name: Valley Passage
542.Author: Magical Wisps
542.Description:
Valley Passage
-3 exteriors

Used NiceThugBert's Eroded Hills and valleys, spruced them up with bush. Much thanks goes to NTB for those eroded areas.

543.Name: Box Canyon
543.Author: happycrow
543.Description:
Good guys check in, but they don't check out!

Well, not really. This was a technical exercise I thought I'd submit because there are very few desert areas online. 

Anybody who likes western knows that a "box canyon" is a terrain that's a major plot feature in and of itself. You can go in and run around, but then you're trapped.

In this case, there IS another way out -- a goat-path that runs through a small saddle in the back of the canyon. Usable as an emergency bolt-hole to escape the ravening hordes, or as a really good location for a den of brigands or smugglers.

The terrain *can* do double-duty for a temperate region, but in that case, you'd likely want to smooth over some of the buttes and mesas a bit.

Size: 12x8
Walkmesh: Completely clean
Placeables: None
Texturing: Warm desert (like Utah)
Terrain: b/c of the goat path, there is VERY little "off-camera" horizon -- terrain modifications will have to be consistent across both the inner and outer mesh.

544.Name: ASG Anceint Elven Tomb
544.Author: Timidon
544.Description:
The Ancient Elven Tomb

This is just a one-area adventure. It is mostly left barren for the module designer to place what ever sort of nasty creatures/traps that he/she wants into the adventure.

This module / erf does has a simple puzzle, contains 7 rooms all in one area.

The only treasure is located in the Inner Tomb Chamber, inside the ï¿½Crypt of Jenon Sunstriderï¿½ itself.

546.Name: ASG Corrupted Elemental Labs
546.Author: Timidon
546.Description:
Here is another entry with a puzzle, some areas and some special effects. Take a look, maybe something here for you to rip apart and design for yourself. 

* What is in this for you?

1) Six small areas, each 8x8 layout. With a bunch of small puzzles and one that takes the smaller ones to build the exit key.

2) Some Environmental Scripting, such as entering into the ï¿½Sickstone Fieldsï¿½ and ï¿½Fire Fieldsï¿½ that cause damage.

3) Scripts that are included are not invasive and can be totally scraped if you donï¿½t want them.

4) There is a conversation for each level that deals with the placeables that are used. 

5) Most of all you did not have to spend a week of your time off and build and testing out the areas! Time Saver!

547.Name: Seaside Castle Lands
547.Author: Jezla9
547.Description:
This is an area I built for my upcoming module, "Lowena."

It is a castle on a cliff with some surrounding lands, including a small farm. There is a cobbled highway leading north to morrlands (another area I plan on releasing soon). 

All of the doors are static, and the only useable placeables are the statues on the Causeway. I left those as they are to provide a little 'flavor.'

Sounds are placed, just populate and customize as you wish. The weakest part is when you are walking down the stairs from the upper cliff, part of the castle interior ground is visible, as well as the untextured parts of the turrets. I noticed this fault too late in the build process to easily correct it.

Enjoy!

548.Name: Path of Evil - areas
548.Author: kamal
548.Description:
107 prefab areas from my upcoming Path of Evil campaign (currently in testing).

I used a lot of prefabs. So I am releasing all my own work as a pack for others. Note that the Al-Qasr desert city exterior is based off of a prefab by Raith Veldrin, who has previously given permission for me to include it in another pack of my work on the Vault.

Built using Skullhak, I have provided a list of areas that depend strongly on it, with specifics as to the tilesets or placeables used from it. You can download skullhak from
Link

Included in this pack:
16 caves
10 religious buildings
39 houses and city buildings
31 towers, castles, dungeons, ruins etc
11 exteriors 

Note that underground areas and interior areas with no windows tend to be pitch black in default lighting conditions. This is on purpose.

These areas all have custom loadscreens, which I am uploading separately. The loadscreen hak is not necessary though.

Thanks to Anduraga and Ovocean for daynightsets and Lannesar for Lan's Placeable Groups v1.6. Also: hopefully I remembered to remove every single critter, trigger, waypoint etc, you might find some I missed.

If you do use one of my areas, all I ask is that you drop me a note to let me know.

549.Name: Complete PW - The Frontier Reborn
549.Author: Frontier Reborn Team - Past & Present
549.Description:
This is version 9 of the Frontier Reborn, a long-running persistent world set on the island of Calisia far to the west of Faerun. In it's prime the server regularly had 20-30+ players. It's fully functioning, requiring only a nwnx4 database/server.

Several of the key players behind this server are currently at work on a new server set in the dark ages of Arthurian Britain. Please take a look at Link if you're interested. We're looking to launch in May 2010. 

The module is quite large, weighing in at 1.57 gb. We're also posting smaller groupings of areas to serve as prefabs.

It should also be noted that the module uses a custom leveling system called E8. This system stops leveling after 8 and instead uses a custom GUI to allow players to pick feats for every 5000xp they earn after reaching level 8. This can be disabled by going into the module's scripts and deleting the scrips "stoplevelup" and another script with the term 'e6' in it (I forget its exact name). 

Current Status: All files are up. Unzip the haks into your documents/neverwinternights 2/hak file and add the module to your module file and enjoy.

550.Name: Graveyard
550.Author: Zarconus
550.Description:
This is yet another graveyard pre-fab! It is a large 16x16 graveyard complex. The map has two small and large graveyards! Two small crypts and one large crypt or church! I used sls2 for the lighting so if you don't have it please download it at the nwn2 vault. As always if you use any areas in your mod please give the authors credit!

Thanks, Enjoy!

551.Name: Barons prefabs
551.Author: Baron RWS
551.Description:
Baron's Prefabs
A quasi-RWS production

Attached are a pair of areas I was working on...since I havent gone anywhere with them and they arent likely to be used by myself or RWS maybe someone out there can get some use out of them.

Cuththroat Cove:
Cutthroat cove was planned as a small pirate village, there are only three areas in this mod no encounters, and a couple of merchants and thats about it.

Village01: 
A simple very rural village located along the bank of a small stream.

Both are just mod files - stick-em in your modules directory and view em.

552.Name: castle
552.Author: indyanna
552.Description:
This is a castle.

The castle_only erf file is only the castle areas. (5 areas) Wells and troughs in the balcony are set up for conversations.

The outside_castle_areas erf is 4 exterrior areas. Donitea, Mountain lake, winding road, and seaport.

553.Name: Oakridge Farm
553.Author: Vekin
553.Description: A small farm just off a road and beside a river.

554.Name: NTB's Terraced Hills and Valleys Vol. 01
554.Author: nicethugbert
554.Description:
From the maker of NTB's Eroded Hills and Valleys you get this Terraced Hills and Valleys set comprised of a set of 16 connected 24x24 areas arranged in a 4x4 matrix with overlapping borders. A few screenies are supplied to give an idea what the areas look like.

The arrangement between the areas is:

01|02|03|04
05|06|07|08
09|10|11|12
13|14|15|16

The set wraps around itself. I.E., left side of area one borders right side of area 4. Top of area 1 borders bottom of area 13. Etc.

Should you like a certain section that is split between more than one area try using TerraCoppa to copy/paste the pieces into a new area.

You will probably need to use TerraCoppa to shift areas down because the toolset places water only at -100 to 100 meters in height and these areas are in many instances above 100 meters.

The areas are created in L3DT and imported into the toolset with YATT.

The areas are baked. That's as far as I went. I did not make any adjustments.

There are islands of perfectly walkable terrain separated by cliffs. It's up to the module builder to connect them and clean up the stray walkmesh dookies.

Please feel free to texture, stock, and otherwise modify this humble offering to your hearts content. Go wild, make it your own, like Magical Wisp did with three of my areas here.


The area spans 960x960 walkable meters wide. The altitude range is 267.03 meters.

L3DT Design Map Settings:
 * Average Altitude = 100
 * Altitude Range = 60
 * Feature Scale = 100
 * Noise Strength = 20
 * Noise Shape = 0
 * Cliffs/Terraces = 100
 * Erosion = 40
 * Lakes = 100
 * Climate = Temperate

569.Name: Rolling hills terrain
569.Author: erikbreau
569.Description:
Need some rolling hill exterior areas to go with those ideas? Download, import and texture as you see fit! 

 2 formats are available, a full module download to build on, or the .erf file to import into your existing module.

 Produced via L3DT and converted with YATT, this set of 16 areas (16x16 tiles or 4x4 mega tiles) are plain (texture: grass 36) and ready for modification.
 
 Thanks to developers 'sidefx' (YATT), Bundysoft's 'aaron' (L3DT) and nicethugbert for the suggestions and info. 

L3DT: Link
YATT: Link

erikbreau.

570.Name: Forest Graveyard
570.Author: Registerdebakel
570.Description:
Two old abandoned maps of mine:
A zombiefied graveyard located in a little forest.

Mapsizes are about 2x 24x24.
Maps are linked together ingame.

Have fun walking around :)

Registerdebakel

571.Name: Snowy Ruins
571.Author: Kamal
571.Description:
At last you have reached the area marked on your map. You've seen this area marked on another map, one belonging to the frost giants living in the pass below. On their map, it was marked as forbidden according to Merrick the bard. Merrick was thrown from the mountain by a frost giant in a battle soon after that. Hopefully he said his prayers before landing.

Still you travelled on. You would be dead too, starved in a cave you carved into a snow embankment to survive a two week blizzard, but for the priest you travel with. You thank your diety he knows a spell to create food. 

Now, you have arrived. Will you find what you are looking for?

----------------------------
A snowy mountain cliff with numerous potential entrances to ruins. No music, adjust the fog and add snowfall to make a more blizzard type effect if you wish.

574.Name: Crafting House
574.Author: Sugarcandy
574.Description:
This is basicaly a simple crafting hall I made that I wanted to share.The hall has a golem vendor complete with most of everything you need for crafting, however the store's inventory can be easily altered to fit your gaming world.The goal of adding this to the vault was to supply persistant world admins with a crafting hall that did not use haks or anything, thus making it easy to toss in there and save people some work.Inside the hall are the following rooms...

1) Blacksmithy Room
2) Enchanting Room
3) Alchemy Room

Feel free to make any changes you want to this, however please acknowledge me if you use it. Thanks and enjoy!

575.Name: AW Template - Town
575.Author: Alaster Wolf
575.Description:
My goal was to create a town prefab which should be easy to reconfigure, to change its layout and reuse it -- so that it can serve as a template to quickstart any similar town.

Area size is 16x16. This town has a keep, market with the warehouse, slums, temple, several streets, corners and passages, caravan camp outside the town walls, barracks, academy building with an inner yard etc. The features are simple and nothing is really unique, which is intentionally. So you should be able to easily change its layout and features. I guess that the current daylight settings are suitable for a dark fantasy.

This uses the City HAK, which you can find here: Link

You can now find the updated City HAK here: Link

I tried my best to do the textures, walk meshes, daylight settings, to convert the placeables to environment objects and to put up some ambient sounds. Objects are plot, doors are static and unlockable - so you can use just what you need. Creatures are just sample - you will probably want to remove them.

Screenshots are taken with the Tree textures overhaul. That is not required, but you can find it here if you like it: Link


TUTORIAL - Building A City In Just A Day

Be sure to check the tutorial that I have posted - "Building A City In Just A Day". The tutorial contains a blank template that you can use to build the cities from scrach and to get something similar to this one here. You can find it here: Link

576.Name: AW Terrain
576.Author: Alaster Wolf
576.Description: This terrain area 32x32 can speed up your area creation. When you start building a new area, use this instead of a blank area. This has an uneven surface with a mix of textures and colours. The surface is just slightly uneven, so there are no unwalkable gaps but its uneven enough to simulate the wilderness. You can easily change the textures to quickly get a completely different environment (check the screenshots). You can even change textures to create a city terrain, if you flatten the surface. The area size is 32x32 so that you can cut it down to any size you need. Also, if you have your own area already with just the surface (heightmap) - you can use TerraCopa to just apply this mix of textures. Or, you can start with this and just raise/lower the terrain to get the surface you need. Quick and easy - just add water.

577.Name: City Slums
577.Author: cepapoe
577.Description:
This is an area (12x8) I worked on some time ago and decided I should share it now since it isn't getting put to positive use. The concept is a plague ridden slums. The air is oppressive as the city has been quarantined and the city militia have taken to burning bodies to control the plague. While must of the city is slumish the area in the vicinity of the church are better off.

This uses the City Hak:
Link
While the area was made using 1.23 SOZ, the city hak was never updated to SOZ, so SOZ placeables do not work with the hakpack as it is.

Feel free to give feedback or use it/edit it as desired. This area only includes the exterior, none of the interiors have been done yet.

578.Name: AW Woods
578.Author: Alaster Wolf
578.Description: Woods with a lot of open areas for your encounters and locations. Area size is 16x16. There is a river and two lakes. The area has several exits. Walkmesh is smoothed, all the placeables are converted to environment objects.

579.Name: AW Inn
579.Author: Alaster Wolf
579.Description:
Ground floor with tavern and kitchen, upper floor with common and private rooms, cellar with distillery and storage. I've tried to space out the furniture leaving enough room to walk comfortably (helps if you find the NWN2 camera problematic). The area has all stages of the environment settings - day to night.

I have reused really great placeable prefabs found here: Link

The screenshots are displaying the tileset "RWS_Standard_Interiors" that I am using. This is not required but I really recommend it, you can find it here: Link

If you don't want to use the "RWS_Standard_Interiors" then download the version "aw_inn_standard".

I have also added some loadscreens.

580.Name: NTB's Hills and Valleys Vol. 00
580.Author: nicethugbert
580.Description:
From the maker of NTB's Terraced Hills and Valleys Vol. 10 comes 6 sets of 16 hill areas. 

The screenies show what each set looks like in L3DT. I swapped the sand texture for a mud texture in the toolset.

Each module contains 16 connected 24x24 areas arranged in a 4x4 matrix with overlapping borders. 

The arrangement between the areas in each module is:

01|02|03|04
05|06|07|08
09|10|11|12
13|14|15|16

Each set of 16 areas wraps around itself. I.E., left side of area 1 borders right side of area 4. Top of area 1 borders bottom of area 13. Etc.

Should you like a certain section that is split between more than one area try using TerraCoppa to copy/paste the pieces into a new area.

The areas are created in L3DT and imported into the toolset with YATT.

Each set of 16 areas is the same set of areas subjected to increasing erosion and terracing.

The areas are baked. That's as far as I went. I did not make any adjustments.

Please feel free to texture, stock, and otherwise modify this humble offering to your hearts content. Go wild, make it your own, like Magical Wisp did with three of my areas here.

Each set of 16 areas spans 960x960 walkable meters wide. The altitude range is 77 to 86 meters.

581.Name: NTB's Headwater 000
581.Author: nicethugbert
581.Description:
A gravely and muddy canyon dead end from which I imagine seeing narrow water falls, creeks, and pools from which a river could start.

Area size is 24x24. Made in L3DT and imported with YATT.

I made a rough draft in L3DT by hand in the Design Map and let it handle the details.

The L3DT project is small enough to use with the free version of L3DT. The only difference between the free and pay versions of L3DT is the max file sizes they handle.

582.Name: Grasslands_002_24x24
582.Author: Ugly_Duck
582.Description:
*******************************************
*** Area Prefab: Grasslands_002_24x24 *****
*******************************************
Date: November 6th, 2010 (11-06-2010)

This is my latest area. It's a 24x24 grassy area with trees, moderate grass, and rocks. There are a couple Points of Interest, each marked with a Map Note Waypoint:

- Small Ruins: Rubble & the framework of an old structure.
- Mound of Dirt: A ritualistic mound of dirt with a hole at its base.

There is a lot of space for encounters, quests, and romping around.

Use this however you see fit, but do give credit.

I've uploaded only an .erf file for this.

Instructions:
To check out the .erf file, unzip the file first. Then, simply start the toolset, import the Grasslands_002_24x24.erf file, place a start location, save it as whatever you want to call it. Then, start the game and select the new module from the module list.

Check it out, and please vote. Also, post any comments/concerns that you wish here.

Thanks.

583.Name: Crags of Agony_24x24
583.Author: Ugly_Duck
583.Description:
*******************************************
*** Area Prefab: Crags of Agony_24x24 *****
*******************************************
Date: November 9th, 2010 (11-09-2010)

Welcome to the Crags of Agony! This is a mountainous area with wide paths perfect for encounters, and combat. There are several Points of Interest in this area that include:

- 2 Caves
- 3 Building Structures
- 1 Crypt

Some of the other points of interest include several Cesspools, an small unaccessable Graveyard, and two Lava vents. There are various ruins scattered across the unaccessable landscape to give it an old, abandoned vibe & several dark red lights to add a somewhat evil overtone. There are also, several crystal formations that lend to an outerworldly feel.

A special note on the textures and coloring: after watching SGK73's texture tutorial (which I highly recommend), I've practiced a bit, and I feel it has helped me a great deal. So, pay special attention to the textures and use of color!

I've included an optional DAY/NIGHT cycle for this area too; it's in each of the downloads, and there is a download for the cycle seperate from the areas. It's the same for all of the different day/night events, so if you want to use it, when you import it, go down to "All" in the import menu. The reason I've included this is because I built this area for a PW that I'm making and needed another Hellish Abyss area with mountains; and it looks hellish somewhat with that day/night cycle installed.

Use this however you see fit, but do give credit.

Instructions:
To check out the .erf file, unzip the file first. Then, simply start the toolset, import the Crags of Agony_24x24.erf file, place a start location, save it as whatever you want to call it. Then, start the game and select the new module from the module list.

To check out the .mod file, unzip the file first. Then place the Crags of Agony_24x24.mod file into your Modules folder in the 'My Documents/Neverwinter Nights 2/Modules directory. Then, select Crags of Agony_24x24 from the modules list after loading the game and start playing!

Check it out, and please vote. Also, post any comments/concerns that you wish here.

Thanks.

** UPDATE: Released version 2 "Crags of Agony_24x24_v2". I've removed the old versions and uploaded the new versions of the .erf & .mod files, so both available downloads will be up-to-date!

v2 Notes:
- Fixed unaccessable doors on the Deathgod's Vault & Sunken Ruin structures.
- Reduced Ambient Day/Night volume on area from 50 to 25.

584.Name: Mountainous Valley_16x16
584.Author: Ugly_Duck
584.Description:
***********************************************
*** Area Prefab: Mountainous Valley_16x16 *****
***********************************************
Date: November 11th, 2010 (11-11-2010)

"After an hour's hike, you find yourself in a lush mountainous valley. Tall cliffs surround the area; some jagged, some round and covered in small patches of grass, and dirt. The grass varies in height; browned near the path you walk, but mostly green in other areas. You notice a small camp on a ridge - it looks recently used. After walking up a small incline, you notice a building standing on a larger ridge above you. As you walk from the rocky outcropping, you spot a small pond with crystal-clear water, almost blue. You decide to refill your wine skin with some of the water. There is a cave entrance jutting from a rockface not too far from where you're standing, but you decide against venturing into it due to the faint growls you hear echoing from inside. At the top of the valley, you notice a merchant wagon not too far from the structure you saw earlier, but nobody is around - you think they may have gone into the building..."

Use this however you see fit, but do give credit.

Instructions:
To check out the .erf file, unzip the file first. Then, simply start the toolset, import the Mountainous Valley_16x16.erf file, place a start location, save it as whatever you want to call it. Then, start the game and select the new module from the module list.

To check out the .mod file, unzip the file first. Then place the Mountainous Valley_16x16.mod file into your Modules folder in the 'My Documents/Neverwinter Nights 2/Modules directory. Then, select Mountainous Valley_16x16 from the modules list after loading the game and start playing!

Check it out, and please vote. Also, post any comments/concerns that you wish here.

Thanks.

585.Name: PW: Baldur's Gate: The Sword Coast Chronicles
585.Author: jlf2n
585.Description:
These are the haks, areas, items and monsters from the long running Persistent World "Baldur's Gate: The Sword Coast Chronicles". The module contains 133 areas, 209 monsters and hundreds of items. It also contains the Drow city of Sshamath and several Underdark areas. Itï¿½s really two worlds in one. 

These areas are now available for the public to use however needed. The only two stipulations placed on all of the below content is that you cannot make money off of it and you must give credit to the creators of not only the PW but the individual 3rd party content used. 


PW Founder - Jlf2n
PW Founder - Driller

***********************************

 Original Team

Scripting - Driller, Otomo Tetsuo

Area Design - Jlf2n

***********************************

Additional Team members and contributors to this version.

Load Screens - Sinsimilla

Items & Monsters - Eldur, 
Haks - Driller, Luna

Custom Items - Sir Carnifax, Adzling

Area Design ï¿½ Sebastian Raymond

Other contributors whose help was greatly appreciated: HMV, Jayni, Akvait, Magicshisha, Raetin Electrocuter, Raph and Wildelf. If I forgot anyone please forgive me. It's been quite some time now since we all worked together.

*******************************


Also please note the 3rd party stuff used to help create the Module:

BouncyRock Entertainment: We used the Drider, Beholder and probably anything else they have made or will make. 

TLK Card Game by brockfanning.

RWS Creature Conversion Project by RWS.

Drinks of the Forgotten Realms by Seryn.

Bulletin Board by Qkrch.

City Hak by Tupoun. 

Minotaur head by Daronas

BCKII by Nytir. 

RWS Tower Rooms by RWS. We also use their pocket citadel hak as well.

Hatplosion hak by Schazzwozzer

The Colosseum by Plane Walker. I took his model for the arena and redid it. A great area by PW.

Wharehouse mod by Wyrin. A very nicely done interior.

Haunted house by Marcelo_Lopes. I used his interior and I redid the exterior to match our world. A great mod.

SGK73's work was used in the cloakwood mines as well as a few other areas. I also plan on using a few others of his in the future like the smugglers cave as well. He does great interior work, very detailed.

Elvered's Wolfguard Pass is also used in the mod. It has been redone and used as South Woods of Sharp Teeth.

RWS Towers and Cliffs - RWS has provided a number of priceless additions to the NWN2 community. This link will take you to a list of them.

********************************************************************************
********

This module contains 133 areas, 209 monsters, 20 quests and over 1,000 items. The areas cover Baldur's Gate, Candlekeep, Beregost, The Cloud Peak Mountains, Cloakwood, The Woods of Sharp Teeth, The Fields of the Dead and every place in between. 

Below you will find several files. One will be a module file that is ready to play, a directory folder version for you to look at in the toolkit, and the haks needed to run these areas. Also included are the item and monster add ons. 


********************************************************************************
********



Install:
Place the Directory and the mod file in your My Documents/Neverwinter Nights 2/Modules folder. The Hak files go into the My Documents/Neverwinter Nights 2/Haks folder.

586.Name: Swamp_001_16x16
586.Author: Ugly_Duck
586.Description:
**************************************
*** Area Prefab: Swamp_001_16x16 *****
**************************************
Date: November 13th, 2010 (11-13-2010)

This is the first swamp area that I've attempted to make with the toolset. I hope that it's up to standards for the community. It was by far the most challanging area that I've made thus far, texture-wise. Each download is using the default DAY/NIGHT cycles from the toolset, but there's more...

I've included an optional DAY/NIGHT cycle for this area too; it's in each of the downloads, and there is a download for the cycle seperate from the areas! It's the same for all of the different day/night events, accept for the night cycle. The night cycle uses some blacks and blues for the sky and fog. If you want to use it, when you import it, go down to "All" in the import menu.

** COMING SOON: Mini.Area.Pack (M.A.P) Volume 2! Keep an eye out for it within the next week!

Use this however you see fit, but do give credit.

Instructions:
To check out the .erf file, unzip the file first. Then, simply start the toolset, import the Swamp_001_16x16.erf file, place a start location, save it as whatever you want to call it. Then, start the game and select the new module from the module list.

To check out the .mod file, unzip the file first. Then place the Swamp_001_16x16.mod file into your Modules folder in the 'My Documents/Neverwinter Nights 2/Modules directory. Then, select Swamp_001_16x16 from the modules list after loading the game and start playing!

Check it out, and please vote. Also, post any comments/concerns that you wish here.

Thanks.

587.Name: Mini.Area.Pack (M.A.P): Volume 2
587.Author: Ugly_Duck
587.Description:
* M.A.P: Volume 2 - Five Different 8x8 Exterior Areas!

********************************************************
*** Area Prefabs: Mini.Area.Pack (M.A.P): Volume 2 *****
********************************************************
Date: November 18th, 2010 (11-18-2010)

Introducing the Mini.Area.Pack: Volume 2! It contains 5 different areas:

- Desert Wastelands
- Frozen Pond
- Mountain Ruins
- Small Forest
- Swamp

Each area is 8x8 in size, and represents an individual environment.

** Special Note: I'd like everyone to give suggestions on some new types of areas that I can make. I'm running out of ideas people! Be as detailed as possilbe & I'll try to make them!

Use these however you see fit, but do give credit.


Instructions:

You need the compression utility, "7-ZIP" to unpack these files. 7-Zip is a great tool & can be found here (for FREE!): Link

* Go to the DOWNLOAD button on the left of your screen, then select the correct version for your particular operating system.

To check out the .mod file, install 7-Zip first. Next, right click MAP_vol2_MOD.7z and mouse over the 7-Zip option. Select "Extract Here". This will decompress the files and make them useable. Then place the MAP_vol2_MOD.mod file into your Modules folder in the 'My Documents/Neverwinter Nights 2/Modules directory. Then, select MAP_vol2_MOD from the modules list after loading the game and start playing!

Check it out, and please vote. Also, post any comments/concerns that you wish here.

Thanks.

588.Name: Town_Hillside_02_20x24
588.Author: Ugly_Duck
588.Description:
* Updated to 20x24! A Hillside Town.

***********************************************
*** Area Prefab: Town_Hillside_02_20x24 *******
***********************************************
Date: November 21st, 2010 (11-21-2010)

This is a town entrenched into a mountain valley; it's fortified by large walls too.

* Special thanks goes out to jlf2n for releasing such wonderful areas! I've been examining his areas & trying to learn his style. His Baldur's Gate: Sword Coast Chronicles was the inspiration for this area. Thanks again dude!

Use this however you see fit, but do give credit.

Check it out, and please vote. Also, post any comments/concerns that you wish here.

Thanks.

** UPDATED: 11-23-2010 [Time: 8:30pm Eastern U.S.]
- Increased map size from 12x12 to 20x24 to include all of the town in the walkable portion of the map!

589.Name: Heimta Iskardhi South
589.Author: Ticladesign
589.Description:
Heimta IskarÃ°Ã­ South, for the Neverwinter Nights Vault
---------------------------

Builder: TiclaDesign
Area type: Exteriour
Number of Areas: 1
Area(s) Size: 20X16
Tag: 02_hi_south
Project started: 20th of November 2010
Current status: FINISHED
Project finished: 28th of November 2010

---------------------------

Project/Builder Notes: Heimta Iskardhi south, with an abandoned/deserted Homestead that's becoming a ruins with crumbled walls, unfinished parts and a (main) Building that can be entered. The area itself is a Lowland/mountainous steppe like area where the player can move around on freely. It works very well with large creatures or many NPC's needing to navigate.

Last Minute Notes: The DayNight cycle has some issues in the morning transition, i'll see what's causing that.

Future Plans: Post a module of the area with the NPC's that belong in that area. (Lore specific)

Area Lore and Background: 

This is the first of my "Heimta IskarÃ°Ã­" prefab areas, based on the Lore of my books "Ticla the SkÃ¢ldÃ­". 
Maybe one day i'll make a SP module out of them, but currently i'm releasing them as Vault Prefabs. 
To the south of the village of Heimta IskarÃ°Ã­ (Home of the Black Birds) Lies a crossroad, only known to a few. 
The Village shrouds itself in a thick fog, while to the south many black birds make their home in the 
"Forest of the Standing Stones." It is said that on the day man cut down the last tree on the HÃ¢langard Plains, 
the Hidden People of Heimta IskarÃ°Ã­ raised the monoliths to serve as the new trees, and homes to the Many Birds 
that lived on the plains. This particulair area has a now abandoned homestead, maybe a tragedy had befallen it's occupants. No one knows, but the ever watchfull Totum of the God Odanaz, the watcher of all. 
It stands there now on the highest hill, as a silent witness. None but Odanaz himself, knows the history 
behind the Abandoned Homestead. At night, an eerie wind blows to announce the arrival of the "Northern Lights", 
vengefull Whisp like beings that haunt the plains like magical wolfpacks. It is in those HÃ¢langard Nights that 
people remain in their houses, doors and windows are sut tight. 
Until the daybreak when the sun shines on the lands again.

Current Updates: 

- 28th of November: Prefab released on the Neverwinter Nights Vault

590.Name: Swamp - Forest
590.Author: Skumar & Vamp
590.Description:
- Description -
This is a small Swamp - Forest area from our module, Darkness Falls. This is the prefab version, as in I removed all links to other areas and references to our module so you may use it out of the box and not have to slave hours changing text and such.

- Features -
12x12 Swamp area, rather large on foot.
A small Swamp House for exploration.
A Crypt for exploration.
A Cave for exploration.
Ambient music set in place at the perfect volume to make it blend with the music.
Completely original and does not make use of hak paks and such.

- Credits -
Please give all credits for terrain and texturing to Skumar and placement to Vamp. If you use our prefab in your module or tweak it, please let us know as we'd love to look at it!

591.Name: The Island Temple of Sune
591.Author: Cloud_Dancing
591.Description:
This is an Island Temple of Sune (or whatever you wish it to be.) It has an exterior with a Tropical/Middle Eastern Climate with a thick garden, an oasis, and a grove of palm and citrus trees.

The interior shows what the exterior so well displays, a thick lush interior garden with plenty of room for devotees of any faith as well as a deep underground spring and worship area for the temple.

592.Name: Volcanic Wasteland_32x32
592.Author: Ugly_Duck
592.Description:
32x32 Volcanic Wasteland.

******************************
** Volcanic Wasteland_32x32 **
******************************

This area is a Volcanic Wasteland created for the EoW persistant world.

Cheers,
Ugly_Duck

32x32 Desert Canyon

*************************
Date: December 21st, 2010 (12-21-2010)

This 32x32 map depicts a desert canyon. It has 3 campsites, a magical portal, a cave at the end of an upward path, a 

barricade for encounters, and a ruined keep.

Note about the keep: the walkmesh went bonkers near the door, so you cannot go inside the keep, but you can still use the 

door for an area transition.

Hope you gals and guys find a good use for this!

32x32 Jungle Island

This map is a jungle island 32x32 in size. It uses many assets from Storm of Zehir. Most of the terrain is walkable, even 

the water that is accessable on the map.

Included in the download is a .mod file and read me text.

Enjoy!

595.Name: Alara, City of Elves
595.Author: Vampire & Sharanskumar
595.Description:
This is the prefab version of my starting good city for my module, Darkness Falls.

The area has been stripped to not include any of my module content, so you may use the area out of the box.

Included is:
- Full city, with houses, tavern, church, shrine. 
- Plenty of room to create a lively city. 
- Meant for any Good alignment.
- And trees that are placed well and don't get in the way (:

We worked very hard on this area and would love any feedback on it. 

Hope you enjoy the area, and hope you enjoy Darkness Falls when released.

597.Name: Drider Pits
597.Author: Magical Wisps
597.Description:
-1 EXT. Drider Pits 

(Although it just seems to be an exterior mockup to look like it is underground. Eh... I don't really know what it is...)

-1 EXT Cemetery

599.Author: Magical Wisps

-1 Underdark Trading Post

(Uses an exterior mocked up to look like and Interior Cavern. The Tilesets are great for somethings, but not for generating large Cavernous Underdark Areas.)

YES IT IS DARK, IT IS THE UNDERDARK... YOU'LL NEED A LIGHT SOURCE.

Fail or success? IDK...

600.Name: Athkatla - Waukeen's Promenade
600.Author: Moofin
600.Description:
Athkatla - Waukeen's Promenade:

The promenade is a prominent, oval-shaped marketplace, located in the heart of Athkatla. The Promenade is named after Waukeen, the missing Goddess of Wealth. A good portion of it was destroyed by the evil Mage Jon Irenicus, but has since been rebuilt. Located within the Promenade are general shops, bookshops, homes, a carnival, shops carrying various sundries, inns, and the Adventurer's Mart, run by former adventurer Ribald Barterman.

Remember the playing BG2 SoA? Then you'll remember Waukeen's Promenade. I've tried to recreate the area with NWN2 toolset. I hope to capture every detail in the original and add a little extra to boot. The area was originally intended to be used with my new module I'm working on but I don't think I'll have the time, so I'm releasing this as an area prefab to use as you wish. There's over 3000 placeables covered by an area of 20x16. The main issue was trying to bake this monster. The stairs were the main problem, I could only create a ramp type effect, spent hours trying to figure out a solution, but its the best I could come up with, some stairs aren't baked, this was due to the scale of the city, trying to bake multiple stairs in close proximity to each other resulted in the whole tile not baking. 

Anyway, all yours. Hope you like and have fun! :)

601.Name: Svirfneblin
601.Author: Magical Wisps
601.Description:
- 1 Exterior area made to look like an Underground deep gnome city.

Because short people need love too.

602.Name: Quaervarr
602.Author: Vekin
602.Description:
This prefab was made to represent the village of Quaervarr located in the Moonwood of the Silver Marches, though it could be used to represent any village in a wooded area.

It contains one exterior area and two interior areas. I have included a number of NPCs and all the stores should be working because of this.

You will need Kemo's Custom Chair hak to use the chairs in this module:

Link

603.Name: Light Fjord
603.Author: Lifaen
603.Description:
Light Fjord is a 32x32, 35MB area with a large fantasy fortified city, a small abbey and a watchtower, on separate islands.

The area includes 10+ houses which can be linked to interior areas; a small marketplace in the city proper, walkable walls, a park with a performance stage, a tall tower overlooking the city, and several ruins upon the hillside. 

This area is not currently baked and does not come with any interior areas or NPCs. I plan to upload some interiors shortly so keep an eye out.

It requires SoZ, MotB, patch 1.23 and the Skullhak hak pack. 

It could be used as a starter city, a quest hub, or even a city under siege. Have fun!

(ERF file: download into My Documents/Neverwinter Nights 2/erf and import into module. IMPORTANT: Skullhak must already be imported into the module)

604.Name: TRS - Unused Area
604.Author: TRS Crew
604.Description: TRS has decided to not add this area in the PW but I do believe that this is a great one.

As the NWN2 incarnation of our PW closes, here is the entire PW for players and developers to download and play or use as they like. It has 150+ areas, over 1000 items, over 500 creatures, dozens of quests, and over 1000 custom scripts. 

You MUST download these files in order to use the module, and they are a major download, at least 2 GB.

All of the files are available here:

Link

Any questions email me at Dragonsbane777@gmail.com

*last edit Jan 2013*

606.Name: Forest Path_01_32x32
606.Author: Ugly_Duck
606.Description:
32x32 Forest Path

** Forest Path_01_32x32 **
**************************

My newest area, 32x32 Forest Paths. A winding path through a forest that takes you by several points of interest. There is a wizards tower, a castle, a cave, docks, a small town, ruins, and a small graveyard with a crypt. The majority of the map is walkable; even the hills!

Enjoy!

607.Name: Eiche Schloss
