607.Description: A fortress on a hill inspired by medieval Europe

608.Name: Glade of the Moon
608.Author: Vekin101
608.Description:
This area is currently serving as a Temple of Eilistraee on the Dalelands Beyond PW server. It could of course be used for many other things especially a Ranger Camp.

Upon entering the area make sure you pick up the loot bag near where you spawn as it contains the temple's key.

You will need to have Kemo's chairs if you wish to use the seats in the module:
Link

610.Name: Areas of Joy pack
610.Author: tfunke
610.Description:
Hello there Nwn2 community. Glad to see others still out there playing.

This area (areas) is from a campaign that I had spent well over 400+ hours on, but I have sadly however lost motivation to continue. I am thoroughly impressed with some of the areas I got off the vault that I had planned to add to my campaign and wish to give back to the community. I do hope the areas are put to use... somewhere. :)

note: some of the areas I made using RWS all-in-one and i have tried to note them specifically. Honestly though, if the tileset isnt used, then chances are I havent used many RWS placeables so the areas should work fine. 
Peace.

611.Name: Valley of the Elves
611.Author: Lifaen
611.Description:
NOTE: Requires RWS all-in-one hakpak to work as intended.

This is a collection of three areas at various stages of construction. I built these over the course of a day. Most of the work has gone into the exterior area (32x32) and the interior areas (a cave which travels behind the waterfall and an interior to link two levels of the village) are relatively undeveloped - due to a crash I lost three of the area transitions and the entire village interior, but it is relatively simple to work out what should link to where. 

I was going to rebuild the interior which links the levels of the village but as I had already decided not to use this area in my campaign I thought it would be better to allows builders to develop the interior as they wish, so you will simply find an empty grid to connect the levels of the village. Alternatively you could forgo the interior and link the doors directly, depending on the level of realism you would like.

The exterior contains a small village with elven architecture, or as close as I could get. It has three cave entrances; two of which are for the waterfall passage and the last of which could be used as an exit from the valley or a dungeon entrance. There are various bridges to traverse and as far as I am aware the walkmeshes work as intended, but I have not done extensive testing. 

It may look tree-heavy, but I have kept the numbers of trees to a minimum. Instead most of the trees in inaccessible areas are RWS card trees from the all-in-one pack. They are environmental objects to further lower the memory they take up, but you may still experience extended loading times.

Use as you wish, I don't require credit as there is still a fair amount of work to be done, but it may serve as the groundwork for a fairly impressive looking area. 

Thanks to RWS and Moefx for their contributions to the vault which have been used in this area (don't worry about the moefx effects - the override is included in the module directory)

612.Name: Oaken Druid Circle
612.Author: Cloud_Dancing
612.Description: A druid village made of trees and a simple druid circle to be expanded on.

613.Name: Rustic Tavern and Shrines
613.Author: Cloud_dancing
613.Description: An elaborately decorated tavern of three floors. And two shrines, a lawful stone affair and a tree druid interior.

614.Name: Tiny Fey Barrow Village
614.Author: Cloud_dancing
614.Description:
A large underground Fey Village sized to be at perfect size for Fey creatures and maybe even "Svirfs."

It has mushroom houses, a Fey castle, and a fey shrine as well as a reflective pool.

If the spell is cast "Reduce Person" it will shrink your players down to perfect size for this OR you can use the DMFI if you have it.

615.Name: Kamal's Random Maps
615.Author: Kamal
615.Description:
I built these areas were built for the Ex Scientia Vera PW, which may or may not see release. I've decided it's time to release them to the community.

Included are a large number of 4x8 encounter type areas. These are the same size as the OM encounter areas in Storm of Zehir. There is also a small snowy fortress/town and one small interior shop. Note that they are slightly light on detail as they were made for a PW.

Also provided are two pre-textured areas, 4x8 and 12x12. These have no content and are there to simplify creating different terrains, just swap out the textures for snow/desert/etc. You just need to add texturing specific to your area such as roads, cliffs etc. To give you an idea of what can be done, these were used as the base for all the 4x8 areas.

The areas are empty of critters, triggers, waypoints, area transitions etc.

A few of these areas already appeared in the Path of Evil campaign if you played with the teleporter.

616.Name: Mine Quarry & 2 Level Mine
616.Author: Ugly_Duck
616.Description:
Exterior mine quarry & 2 levels of the interior mine.

***************************************************
*** Area Prefab: Mine Quarry & 2 Level Mine *******
***************************************************
Date: July 10th, 2011 (07-10-2011)

This submission has an exterior area with a mining quarry in the ruins of an old structure. There is also a Cave Entrance, a small leanto with campfire, and an Inn.

And, it has 2 interior areas that represent the first and second floors of the mine itself.

Use this however you see fit, but do give credit.

Check it out, and please vote. Also, post any comments/concerns that you wish here.

Thanks.

617.Name: Combat City_24x24
617.Author: Ugly_Duck
617.Description:
Large Arena in the Center of a City.

************************************
*** Area Prefab: Combat City *******
************************************
Date: July 24th, 2011 (07-24-2011)

This prefab area has a large arena in the center of a bustling city. The city itself is surrounded by large walls. There are many buildings for your enjoyment.

Use this however you see fit, but do give credit.


Check it out, and please vote. Also, post any comments/concerns that you wish here.

Thanks.

618.Name: Grumpy Strumpet Prefabs - City Docks
618.Author: MokahTGS
618.Description:
Land ho, ya salty seadogs!! Welcome to the city! Usually the first stop for any adventurer, the docks offer many entry points for quests and stories. Make your own!

This area is 16x16 and uses the updated SoZ version of the City Hak by Tupoun.

Enjoy and please vote and comment!

619.Name: Grumpy Strumpet Prefabs - The Lost Crags
619.Author: MokahTGS
619.Description:
A'vast ye scurvy dogs and hear the tale of the poor souls on the lost crags...

Fragment of the ship's log of the lost Sea Sprite

[quote]Journal entry 43
Sixteen men were lost last night in the maelstrom that now has us adrift. The ships mast cracked in half as if it were a twig to the claws of that dark monster of a storm. Bosun Smith crushed under its weight before my eyes.

We now languish in the duldrums after the storm pulled along by some strange currents. Not a ripple in the tattered sails yet we move at a good clip. There by foul magic in the air. A lookout has said that land be off to the west, though it only be jagged rocks I see. 'Course that would be better than floating in the nothin' The lookout also says that he sees a tower spire, but by sun and stars, we are many leagues from man nor beast. The sun be playin' tricks on us all.[/quote]

The Lost Crags is a 16x16 area lost out is the vastness of the sea. A strange stone tower rises from the central rocks and silently watches over those unlucky sailors washed ashore. Those doomed men and women have been there so long that they have fashioned together a meager village from the flotsam on the waves and now live out their days among the crags.

This area uses TONS of custom content from all over the Vault. Please make sure to vote for those authors, as areas like this just wouldn't be possible. All of the content used is linked below, and there is a special 2DA pack that you need for everything to work out well.

Enjoy yer shipwrecked doom, ya seadogs!

620.Name: Pontoon at sea
620.Author: tfunke
620.Description:
This is an area I did for BGTSCC, wanted to share it with the community though. Haven't seen anything else like it around.

Uses some of the more common and better hak placeables..
RWS ships etc, Heeds boardable ships, most importantly Walkmesh helper placeables.

621.Name: Baggin's Hollow
621.Author: Dann Pigdon
621.Description:
Baggin's Hollow is a halfling village inside a bag of holding, inspired by the in-game description below:

"Prized by pack rats far and wide, Bags of Holding originated among the mischievous kender in the far-off 
world of Krynn. According to popular folklore, one enterprising kender actually founded a utopian village 
inside his Bag of Holding. It apparently continues to thrive to this very day."

I've substituted kenders for halflings to make it more relevant to the Forgotten Realms setting. Requires Mask of the Betrayer and Storm of Zehir.

622.Name: Everhold
622.Author: Tirelen
622.Description:
***Requires Skullhak***

This is an exterior castle area which I made while messing around with BCKII. It was originally going to be included in my upcoming Moonshae Campaign as a major stronghold, but in the end I decided it didn't make the grade (and I also wanted to keep large areas as custom content-free as possible due to memory problems). It's almost entirely finished, it only requires baking and the doors linking to interior areas for it to be useful. Most of the walls etc have been converted to environment objects to save memory; however the vast majority of the castle is walkable, and there are multiple hidden pathways up through the buildings and around the river.

This is mostly a conversion of one of NiceThugBert's Eroded Hills and Valleys - so all credit goes to him for the scenic landscape.

Use this however you like, but if possible it would be great if you could comment here or PM me - I'd like to see how people use this.

623.Name: Rocky Beach
623.Author: Zarconus
623.Description: This is a 16x16 beach area. It has a shipwrecked boat and a makeshift camp for the survivors of the wreck. It is meant as a starting area on a jungle island but can be used for anything.

624.Name: Oriental Adventures City
624.Author: Banshe
624.Description:
Development Note: I reached the deadline of free time I had to work on this (Friday, December 9th, 2011) and this is what has been completed. Going forward, I wonÂ¡Â¦t have the time/energy to work on this further. This city does require finishing touches to bring it to life. See README for more details. 

Oriental Adventures City

Setting: Those of you who have watched Kung Fu films (especially those produced by the Shaw Brothers) may find this city familiar in many respects. One of the strengths of the Oriental Adventures D&D system is that it mixes numerous real Asian civilizations. So it is my hope that you can find some use for this regardless of the nature of your project and despite its strong Chinese influence. If you are short of ideas on how to use this city, it was designed as a martial arts culture with rival martial arts schools, rival criminal gangs and rival clans all in the same city.

Usage: For Documentation on this city, please download the README. For any questions/issues, please visit the following thread on the Bioware boards:

Link

The following files are here for download:

oa_city_build.rar: This is a directory with all areas included
orient_city hak.rar: This is all the content customized for this city. It should be top of the hak list
oa_prefabs.rar: These are prefab buildings etc for your use 
oa_blueprints.rar: These are customized blueprints for your use

The remaining downloads are optional. They are individual area erf files. All these areas are in the city build directory already:

OA_Full_city.rar: The city area
OA_Building.rar: All the custom buildings laid out in an area
OA_Placeables.rar: All the custom placeables laid out in an area
OA_Random.rar: Has placeable doors that fit each building
OA_Shops.rar: Has all the shop interiors laid out in the area. 

Credits: You may use this area in any way you like whatsoever without giving me any credit. You can cut/slice/dice/expand/improve etc. this area any way you see fit and repost your creation on the vault and elsewhere. However, if you do so, I would appreciate it if you did two things for me:

1. That you give your creation with the same expectations as me. In other words, no demands for credit giving on your part. I would like to see this work shared as freely as possible in the most unrestricted manner. So I would be disappointed to see people put demands on others regarding the usage of this prefab. 

2. That you do give credit to the following authors whose placeables were of great use in creating this city (and vote for their work too). Just because I do not believe in credit giving doesnÂ¡Â¦t mean that those who do should not be given credit. To each his own. 

Author List:

Nytir's BCK: The backbone of this work
Amraphael's Placeables
Kurogo's Oriental Content
GPS's Trinity Custom Placeables
RWS's Merchants
SDJ's Oriental Content
Jaesun999's Tapestry Pack
SGK's Boxes

In order to use this city, the following haks are needed (remove any placeable.2da files in the haks):

Trinity Placeables:
Link 

Jaesun's Tapestry Pack
Link

Nytir's BCK
Link 
Take the following from that page:
Link
You can delete the "Classic" set as it is not used. 

Kurogo's Content 
Kenchiku:
Link 
Naisou v.1
Link 
Naisou v.2
Link 
Fusama Doors
Link 

RWS Merchants:
Link 

SDJ Oriental Stuff:
Link 
Link 

Amraphaels Placeables (get the combo all in one hak):
Link 

ENJOY!!!!

625.Name: Grey Isles - Druid Grove
625.Author: Vekin101
625.Description:
This is the Druid Grove on the new PW The Grey Isles.

I used this area as a walkthrough on how to make forest areas, the walkthrough is on the Grey Isles forum currently.

It has a small campfire set by the pool, a open area inside a stone circle and a temple set onto a hill at one end of the grove.

To use the chairs you will need to have Kemo's Chair hak but you can explore the area without it as long as you dont sit on the benches!

626.Name: Elysium Wood (Campaign & Mod)
626.Author: Zarconus
626.Description:
This is my unfinished campaign The Elysium Wood! 
I am posting this in the hope that someone can use this for thier own purposes and hopefully some of my content will make it into a mod!
I have several areas that are finished and some that are not. I can't finish this because i am no scripter but alot of love went into making the overland map and all the areas.
As it is now this campaign has no quests or stories. It is just a hack and slash mod with some shops to buy and sell gear and to hire mercenaries at the tavern for some extra help.
All the npc's,mercs and monsters are custom made as well as all the maps.
I did use a few things from the community and credit should be given to them for thier work if it is used!
 
KNOWN ISSUES:There is a bug with getting a room at the inn when you use the key on the door it doesn't fire the script to send you to the right room! 

Hopefully someone will get some use out of the work i put in. Enjoy!

627.Name: Forest Combat Map
627.Author: Zarconus
627.Description: This is an 8x8 forest combat map! I wasn't happy with the combat map for the forset terrain that i included in my unfinished campaign (Elysium Wood) This map is intened for use as a combat map with an overland map style campaign. To use with the (Elysium Wood Campaign) Just import this map and open up the forest_combat map in the toolset. Delete the two waypoints that are by themselves: Not the one inside the trigger! Save and exit!

628.Name: Campsite
628.Author: Zarconus
628.Description: This is a 4x4 area i made as a campsite in a forset for adventurer's to rest in!

629.Name: Book of Challenges
629.Author: Darin LaSota
629.Description:
The Book of Challenges is described by Wikipedia as:

"Book of Challenges (ISBN 0786926570) is a supplemental rulebook for the 3rd edition of the Dungeons & Dragons role-playing game that presents a number of ready-made dungeon encounters that a Dungeon Master can insert into a scenario.

The encounters range from straightforward traps (such as a domed room with a hinged floor that serves as the hidden lair for a beholder), to challenging logic puzzles, riddles and even roleplaying encounters where combat or skill mechanics take a secondary role to the players' own wits and intelligence. All are categorized by challenge rating and run from CR 1 to CR 22. The book also includes advice for DMs on constructing similar traps to the ones presented, including tutorials on basic logic puzzles.
[edit]Description of sample traps
All of the Treasure, None of the Traps A series of already-sprung traps in a spiral corridor that automatically reactivate once the players reach the center.
Fire and Water A logic puzzle that connects the pulling of colored levers with musical tones to prevent the players from accidentally unleashing either lava or rushing water.
Curse of Iron A magically-locked door that bears a riddle, the solution to which is the only sure means of entry.
Medusa's Traveling Casino Not a trap per se, but a series of gambling games meant to part the PCs and their gold. (the segment is rated at CR 12, only as the potential combat NPCs equal that.)
[edit]Publication history

The book was published as a paperback, perfect-bound edition by Wizards of the Coast in June 2002. It was authored by Daniel Kaufman, Gwendolyn F.M. Kestrel, Mike Selinker, and Skip Williams. Cover art was by Todd Lockwood, with interior art by David Day and Wayne Reynolds."

As an aid to the NWN2 community, and for general practice with programming, I have decided to start going through and re-creating these encounters for NWN2. All will be found here, as file uploads (a zip file containing whatever files are needed, more often than not in *.erf format). 

If there is a certain one you want to see done, let me know in the comments.


So far:
-A Familiar Situation (ECL 1)
 [Mostly dialog/placeable use to get a bunch of familiars back in their baskets]
-Temple of Draxion (ECL 2)
 [Weak monsters well defended, a lot of fun placeable effects here, was testing out various code ideas. worth a look just for the scripts]
-Curse of Iron (ECL 4)
 [A favorite of mine, and my first use of xml code...ever.]

631.Name: Arena_001_24x24
631.Author: Ugly_Duck
631.Description:
Arena_001_24x24

************************************
*** Area Prefab: Arena_001_24x24 ***
************************************
Date: August 16th, 2012 (08-16-2012)

My latest area; a town with a large arena in the center.

Use this however you see fit, but do give credit.


To check out the .erf file, simply start the toolset, import the Arena_001_24x24.erf file, place a start location, save it as whatever you want to call it. Then, start the game and select the new module from the module list.

Check it out, and please vote. Also, post any comments/concerns that you wish here.

Thanks.

632.Name: Brigand Fort
632.Author: Zarconus
632.Description: This is a small wooden fort on the edge of a lake. As always i left it generic so you can add your own goodies! Enjoy!

633.Name: Snowy Ruins
633.Author: Zarconus
633.Description:
This is my first snow area! It is a small castle or keep ruin in the snow!
Enjoy!

634.Name: Freehaven V2 - The Dancing Hunonculus
634.Author: TiclaDesign
634.Description:
Freehaven V2 - The Dancing Humonculus, for the Neverwinter Nights Vault 
--------------------------- 

Builder: TiclaDesign 
Area type: Interiour 
Number of Areas: 1 
Area(s) Size: 12X8
Tag: fh_dancinghom_int 
Project started: around november 2011, and March 2013 for the Vault version 
Current status: FINISHED 
Project finished: 9th of March 2013 

--------------------------- 

Project/Builder Notes: The Dancing Humonculus is a rich hotel/Inn that feels much more wealthy than any other Inn. 

Last Minute Notes: March 2013: Removed an invisable table (walkmesh), fixed a wall texture and other misc fixes.

Future Plans: None 

Area Lore and Background: 

Secretly made by the Thayan traders with their own goals, it is an Inn that is made for rich merchants, and Nobles. 

Behind the scenes the Thayan traders have their (illigal) activities going on, such as employing slaves as dancers 

and hotel personell. But these things are cleverly hidden from the clientele of this Hotel.

I've sticked close to the Thayan interiours of the MotB OC, so the area has a distinct Thayan feel over it. It 

works best in correlation with the "poor man's" Inn called the Iron Horn, which I will be putting on the vault 

shortly.


Current Updates: 

- 10th of March 2013: Prefab released on the Neverwinter Nights Vault.

635.Name: Freehaven V2 - The Iron Horn
635.Author: Ticladesign
635.Description:
Freehaven V2 - The Iron Horn, for the Neverwinter Nights Vault 
--------------------------- 

Builder: TiclaDesign 
Area type: Interiour 
Number of Areas: 1 
Area(s) Size: 4X10
Tag: dal_are_fhironhorn
Project started: around november 2011, and March 2013 for the Vault version 
Current status: FINISHED 
Project finished: 10th of March 2013 

--------------------------- 

Project/Builder Notes: The Iron Horn is the poor man's Inn that is smokey and being used for Gambling.

Last Minute Notes: Fixed the door tags and misc. fixes on the walkmesh and tables.

Future Plans: None 

Area Lore and Background: 

Made for visitors to the settlement of Freehaven, the Iron Horn is also called the "Poor man's Inn" because of it's 

overall cheap and simple rooms. The main Inn room is smokey and on many tables visitors play gambling games.

The main room has a Cardgame table, but you need to replace that table from the cardgame hakpack if you want to use 

it. Currently it's just an enviromental table. The chairs and benches are allready made ready for Kemo chairs.


Current Updates: 

- 10th of March 2013: Prefab released on the Neverwinter Nights Vault.

636.Name: Freehaven V2 - The Crafter's Guild
636.Author: Ticladesign
636.Description:
Freehaven V2 - The Crafters guild, for the Neverwinter Nights Vault 
--------------------------- 

Builder: TiclaDesign 
Area type: Interiour 
Number of Areas: 1 
Area(s) Size: 8X8
Tag: dal_fh_crafters_guild
Project started: around november 2011, and March 2013 for the Vault version 
Current status: FINISHED 
Project finished: 10th of March 2013 

--------------------------- 

Project/Builder Notes: The Freehaven crafter's guild is a Mage school and crafter's guild in Freehaven.

Last Minute Notes: Fixed some walkmesh issues, and door tags. Unlocked the Guild area for prefab purposes.

Future Plans: None 

Area Lore and Background: 

The Freehaven Crafter's guild was set up by gnomes to provide a small Mage school and crafter's guild to help the students learn the art of Crafting, and Enchanting.

Main floor has a crafter store room, and upstairs is the guild area with the Mage school and crafting benches.


Current Updates: 

- 10th of March 2013: Prefab released on the Neverwinter Nights Vault.

637.Name: Crimmor - Areas
637.Author: Kamal
637.Description:
As I extensively used prefabs in Crimmor where I could, this is all my areas from Crimmor (some areas may be completely reworked prefabs). If you use any, please let me know :-) 

Triggers are left in place but creatures, sounds, waypoints are removed. (Beware! I may have missed some creatures).

Files are currently being sent to FTP for posting...
